description:
Went to my partner's favorite pizza place on Friday night about a month ago.

And we got the Portuguese? 

-

My only complaint has nothing to do with the pizza..

My partner asked me if I wanted to share a slice between the two of us.

And to me regardless of how big that one slice was: it was like two normal pizza pieces.. and that's a minimum standard for me.. two to three pieces of pizza.

-

Anyways the pizza was good and I'm never sharing again. I can eat his half next time and get me a slice.
author: Lilian L.

description:
My go to #1 Pizzeria in San Francisco for a late night slice or calzone. 

Love that when I call I can have fresh slice of pizza made ready for pick up with a choice of toppings that would put most pizzeria's to shame, there selection of toppings should satisfy most if not all pizza enthusiast.
author: Ray P.

description:
Serranos  is one of the best pizza spots in town. Anyone else who is giving this place a bad review don't know what they are talking about. They make custom slices fresh for you every time. None of that pre bake bs. It's definitely not the type of spot with Edison bulbs that people ride electronic skateboards to where all the waiters have matching plaid shirts. But it is one of the last honest pizza shops in town. They also got bomb lasagna and pasta, and hella veggie options 

Insider tip: order your slice well done and it comes out nice and crispy
author: Adam M.

description:
This place is more like a 3.5 but that doesn't really matter. I come here pretty often as it's close to my house, and they're pretty prompt on making food. Usually 10-15 mins for a pizza slice pickup. Prices are a little high, but still a lot cheaper than other meals in the area. 

I've gotten a full pizza pie here, but I almost always get a slice of pizza. They make their pizza slices by cutting out the shape of the slice from dough before putting toppings on which is my favourite way to make slices tbh. Gives me more crust to dip. Slices are big so don't worry about the crust taking over too much space.
author: Rajeev S.

description:
I haven't been here in 4 years. I was feeling sad cause i don't have a babies mother no more. I was lonely like Kanye at Clinton rally so I cried my way over to 21st and Valencia. As soon as I walked in that home cooked Latino pizza smell woke me out of my droopy malaise. I remembered again why I choose to become a professional fat ass: Serrano's pizza! 
Honestly I don't know what the bad ratings are for but the masses have always been confused. They must not have been getting what I've have; the traditional slice of pepperoni and sausage. It comes out in 10 mins hot and fresh. The sausage is the best in the mission the pepperoni is perfect because it's not too greasy. No need to dab this baby with a napkin they've already done it for you. This is the best "slice" (not whole pizza ) outside of Tony's. Do yourself a favor and come here. Order the pepperoni and sausage. Tell 'em The Professional (fat ass) sent you...
author: Johny B.

description: My new favorite pizza place! Serranos got you on a cool dinner for barely 15$ and its off the hook, A-, right on serranoz.
author: Angel B.

description:
4/5 stars

So a number of my co-workers LOVE this place and on a whim I decided to try it out. I called in my order and it took about 15-20 minutes for them to have my slice ready. Walking there it really looks like a hole in the wall as there is very limited seating and the kitchen/ordering place is really compact. 

Their menu is quite extensive and I love how their slices are made to order instead of sitting under a heat lamp. I don't remember the name of the pizza I got, but it came with pepperoni, sausage, and green bell peppers. By the time I got back to the office and took my first bite, it was still cheesy and delicious! I loved the savory, juiciness of the sausage, the crunch of the bell pepper, and stringy cheese that melted away with each bite. Love it! Now this was a giant slice that could easily be two meals for me so price-point wise, it was really good. 

Overall, I know there are mixed reviews about this place, but as for me and my co-workers we are sold and this will probably be our go-to lunch pizza joint.
author: Melissa N.

description: This is my first time to order pizza in that place. It was very bad when I opened and saw the whole pizza like this. I'm never come back.
author: Thu N.

description: First and last time buying a slice. New to SF and on a quest for the greatest pizza slice, I should have known when I saw other customers' pizza that I wouldn't be satisfied. But the aroma pulled me in! Maybe you all like that dry pizza bubble on top of your pizza, where the oozy, creamy cheeses is supposed to be, but it's not my thing. A third of my slice was that dry pizza bubble stuff and I asked the rep for more cheese. He explained some cheese gets crusty like that. I handed him the uneaten slice and walked out. If I want 80's pizza bubble Little Caesar's-quality pizza, I would have hopped into my time machine.
author: Larry G.

description:
The delivery was fast and the food taste good. Unfortunately, the bottom of my pizza dough and calzone was burnt. The taste is excellent but the texture, honestly, it reminded me that burnt parts can be cancerous (research says). This is the second time I ordered. First was an online order and pick up. The lady who gave my order was friendly. 

I'm having second thoughts purchasing again..
author: Kat P.

description:
SUPER CHEAP, SUPER DELICIOUS

Serrano's doesn't look like much from the exterior: but the pizza is exquisite. Walk here with your friends from Dolores park for a slice of pizza. Take cute pictures in the full wall mirror. And definitely come back again!
author: Bec S.

description:
Used to have an awesome lunch special.
(Referring to slices only.)
Which i used to call ahead to pick up. 
Called today to find the special I'm used to ordering( the two topping) has increased in price by more than 2 $
 
Now it's  cheese only for over 8 and  a 2 topping slice for close to 10$.

Wont be back. 
Ill continue my pizza slice quest elsewhere.
author: Jana F.

description: There's no better cheap pizza than Serrano's. I recommend one slice (it's huge and luckily has their amazing crust on all three sides) and occasionally splurge and get the cheesy garlic bread. If you order delivery, pay online because they write all your credit card info on the order form which doesn't seem safe from a security perspective.
author: Logan H.

description:
I work at a near by hospital and ordered +10 x-large pizzas. Hands down everyone loved it and so did I.
Great tastes that meet the SF awesome pizza standards! Recommend and will RETURN!
author: Pstephan A.

description:
I am disappointed in the service.  As a long time customer I go out of my way to hit Serrano's when I want pizza!  There slices are big and it's really good.  However they are a little sloppy, but that's normal in a small place like this.  The last few times I got 2 pieces of pizza.  Given they are cut the 2 slides after cooking (being cooked as one double slide, there were toppings spilled onto the other piece.  I don't mind usually as it's my husband and I and have no intolerances.

However this evening, my dining companion can't have Garlic, but I LOVE Garlic.  I ordered 2 pieces of pizza and handed over my card.  As they were charging it I mentioned my friends intolerance.  I ordered 2 pieces of pizza for 4.60 and 5.10 = 10.10.  Not a quarter, half, but 2 separate slices.  I was told they WOULD NOT separate them they would only make and cook the 2 slices as 1, together.

I said the person who is eating the other piece can't have garlic and I was told there was nothing you would do to prevent this from happening other than being careful.  BUT given that the pizza is not cut until it leave the oven, the toppings tend to over spill there really was no way to prevent this, except like I asked, before putting on the garlic, separate the slices.  I was told you were too busy...
 
Basically if I walked in and asked for 1 piece of pizza there would have been no issue.  I would have paid $5.10.  If someone else, my friend who was sitting in the car, had walked in she would have paid $4.60 and been cooked a separate slice. 

I hope it was worth it to lose a customer because you couldn't cut the 2 slice into single slices before putting the garlic on, literally an extra 15 seconds to prevent a customer from eating a food they are intolerant to.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
one of the best pizza spots in the mission. all these gentrifiers made the pizza prices go up though. use to get a slice for super cheap. 
if you want someone to speak better english learn spanish or take your ass to the marina
author: April M.

description: They're pizza was delicious. However they need a better cashier that can speak proper English. I couldn't understand almost anything she would say. Also she was extremely rude to me as well, as if it were my fault I couldn't understand what she was saying.
author: Cesar G.

description: Man this place is awesome!!  Some of the best pizza in San Francisco hands-down!!! The San Franciscan is a favorite of mine but they all look so great. Soon enough I'll try all of them LOL.
author: John M.

description: I've ordered from this pizza place for over a decade, about once a week over the last year. Never again. The customer service I experienced today was so terrible it was unreal. I'm allergic to fish and an accidental anchovy ended up on one of my slices, when I called them to try to return my pizza in exchange for one I'm not allergic to, they denied the possibility that they could have messed up, refused to bring me a new slice and take the old one back, and told me if I wanted to complain I would have to come in person and prove there was an anchovy (I ordered delivery).
author: Tucker M.

description:
Thanks for my delivered pizza Serrano's and doing nothing to fix this mess. It may have come out fine when you gave it to the Postmates delivery driver but you could have done something yourself to fix this. *picture posted*

The pizza toppings slid over and the pizza isn't even good! It's ok. I should've gotten Bravo's instead but I wanted to try something new. What a mistake!
author: Patricia S.

description:
I've been somewhat of a regular here since 2005.This was my go-to pizza  place in SF during the 00's. Always loved their BBQ chicken pizza!!

Fast forward to 2017... I haven't ordered from them in several years so thought to tame my growling stomach on a late night tonight. Ordered my past favorite,the BBQ chicken pizza...So far so good lol. Tastes just how they've always made it through the years. Very consistent. The sauce and the crust is absolutely still delish!!! YUM.I'll even go as far as to say they're way better than California Pizza Kitchen,way better.

I don't get that low health score though...They always seem to present their food very very clean. I wasn't gonna let that deter my judgment though. Never got sick from eating at this place after all these years. Their pizza is still awesome(might even be one of the best in town to this day)...I'm glad I ordered from them tonight. Serrano's rules. Past faves also include their lasagna. Really good stuff.
author: Isabella A.

description:
Maybe I have different tastes than the rest of the reviewers, but I thought this pizza was below average. Particularly the crust, which reminded me of a warm breadstick. 

The toppings seemed okay, but lacking in both the pesto and sauce department. 

Don't bother with the "salad". You can tear up a few lettuce leaves and drop a few sad olives on top as easily as they can.
author: Tyler L.

description:
I'm not sure if I got lucky based on so many prior reviews, but I had no issue at all with the delivery or the quality of the pie.

I began the on-line order process but when prompted to use a cc for payment, I decided to cancel the order--I wanted to pay cash instead when the delivery arrived.

I called Serrano's to place my order and told them I would be paying in cash.
They quoted a 45-60 minute delivery time.  The large pie with sausage and mushrooms came to $21.50.

The pizza arrived in 40 minutes.  It was very good--the crust was thick and the seasonings were spot on.  The cut of the slices was a bit off but no one cared!
author: Thomas D.

description:
I was the beneficiary of some "left over" pie slices from Serrano's at a friends house, and was pretty pleasantly pleased. It was a "combo" pizza and very tasty, crust was perfect and a good supply of toppings. Putting cold slices in a toaster oven regained that "freshly baked" pizza goodness even after a day in the fridge.  

Pizza is one of the perfect foods of mankind, next to the banana which comes in its own eco friendly packaging.  

Serrano's is now on my list for pizza joints and will be there soon for a up close and personal pizza experience.
author: Matsuo U.

description: HUGE HUGE slices (think like costco size) for affordable prices. Cash only, call 20 mins ahead to put in your order, no walk-in pickups.
author: Hanna M.

description: I ordered from them 3 times in 1 day for self and work.  Great tasting pizza and I love their lunch specials!  Awesome service, too!
author: Michelle B.

description: Massive slices, great price and quick service.  What else can you ask for out of a pizza joint. Cheers!!!!
author: Goldie G.

description: The pizzas here are huge. One slice is more like two! They have a bunch of pizzas to choose from as well as pasta and even deserts. The place is small but most orders are pickups or delivery. You can order online and by phone. They accept cash and cards so no worrying about going to an ATM. The pizza is well priced considering how big they are. When you get delivery they give you coupons that give pretty good discounts. They are open pretty late too.
author: Manuela G.

description: My go to place whenever I head over to San Francisco. Love it, the closest thing to a New York style pizza in my eyes. They're always busy so I recommend ordering ahead of time. But other than that great selection !
author: Kaila O.

description: This place is great for takeout or delivery, considering they don't have a lot of space inside. Recommend ordering ahead, I got the lunch special with a slice of margarita pizza. It's the best margarita pizza I've found in the city! They layer the basil awesomely, under the cheese, there's a whole layer of basil, then they put a few crispy pieces of basil on top! Lots of tomatoes, too. One slice is huge, two can share it easily. Since everything is homemade, not just left under lights for speediness, I do recommend calling ahead for pick up. It's worth it. Salad was tasty too, nice big pepper comes with it, really dresses it up. Thanks Serrano's!
author: Jessica S.

description:
The best slice. 
Monster slices, fresh ingredients, delicious specialty pies and one of the few places you can get French silk pie.
author: Shalaco W.

description:
Serrano's is my next door neighbor, and I really couldn't ask for a better neighbor. Their Portuguese pizza has linguisa, my all time favorite topping, I work downtown, and I often order a pizza while getting on my train and it'll be ready for me when I get home! It's a pretty delightful set up.

The pizza is quick and pretty tasty. They also make single slices of any pizza on the menu. What more can you ask for?
author: Christina S.

description:
Ok, firstly recognize that the low-ish overall rating is due to fuckwits complaining about their food middleman delivery service crushing up their pizza and cake (seriously, who the fuck orders cake delivered from a pizza joint?!) But you should ignore all those chumps - just go get a slice from there and see for yourself.

I have been a solid customer here for almost a decade. The giant, lavish slices are sure to leave you satisfied. Tons of topping options, and they get pretty creative with the combos. Yeah, because your pizza is slathered to the brim with toppings and sauce, delivery can get a bit sogged out - that's why if you know what's what, you put your device down, get your ass off the couch, and walk or bike to this local gem.

Oh, and it's open until 1 am. So if you are sick of tacos...
author: Manfred D.

description: They always deliver good hot and fresh pizza.   Love this place.  Recommend to this who have not tried.
author: Eddie O.

description:
Amazing service!
I needed 10 pizza trays for a birthday party.
I called a number of times with different questions prior to making the order. The person on the other side of the line was extremely helpful and patient.
The delivery guy arrived right on time, with a big smile :-)
The pizza was delicious!
Will definitely use their service next time I need to order pizza!
author: Ilanit S.

description:
Tbh I only came here because my boyfriend raved about it every time we talked about SF. We finally visited the city this past Labor Day weekend, so I got to try it out. I was pretty impressed.

The location is a small hole in the wall place with very little seating. The girl at the counter was unfriendly, preoccupied on the phone with her boyfriend, and quick to rush customers. Basically they're lucky their pizza is dank.

The slices are HUGE and with tons of flavor. I got a slice of pesto delight and it was just so good. I hate pizza crust, but here I couldn't wait to eat it.

The prices are good for how much they give you. If you want a great slice of pizza, Serrano's is for you.
author: Danielle P.

description:
ignore the fuckwits complaining about the poor delivery.

I've been eating here for 5 years. Seriously some of the best pizza i've ever had. Cheap too.
author: Zachary V.

description: I had Californian Calzone and I added pineapples. I waited almost 25 minutes for it which worked my nerves just a little....but I tell you, it was well worth the wait.  I am a cheese fanatic, you know, the kind that has eggs with their cheese not vice versa, haha. When I cut he corner off the calzone, cheese literally started oozing out. It was possibly the most beautiful piece of food I have ever seen. I'm in love with this place. This is my first time here but it definitely will not be my last! this should be called the Californian Volcano
author: Maya J.

description: Nothing great about this place, but nothing wrong either. Fairly good sauce, good toppings and cheese, pretty good crust. Delivery is not super-quick but reliable.
author: Tony B.

description: My cake slices that were delivered through eat24 arrived crushed and upside down and smaller than expected. Cake was good but disappointed by the delivery
author: Ambika B.

description:
Popped in on a Thursday night for a quick, inexpensive dinner and was pleased!

I ordered a slice of the San Franciscan pizza, which contains pepperoni, sausage, bell peppers and mushroom.  The slice was generously sized and the sausage was tasty.

All slices are fresh and made to order, and take about 10 minutes.

The service was friendly and fast, and it is a pleasant environment to eat in!
author: Barnali D.

description: Discovered this place by accident and decided to share a large "Prima" (pesto, chicken, red onions) with some friends. Our order took about 20 minutes like they promised. We got our pizza to go and didn't get to eat it until about half an hour later. It was lukewarm at this point but still incredibly delicious so imagine if we'd had it while it was still nice and hot! I think we were all kind of surprised by how much we liked their pizza and definitely wouldn't mind coming back for some more.
author: E. C.

description: I always order a slice of cheese pizza and a salad. But today I ordered a vegetarian lasagne with a small salad and garlic bread. My goodness the lasagne was one of the worst things I ever ate. I took like 3 bites and I threw the rest of it away. It was absolutely disgusting. It tasted premade frozen and reheated. 2 stars for the garlic bread and salad being decent. I would warn anybody to not order their lasagne from serranos
author: Mohammad A.

description: My favorite pizza place in the mission. Slices are fresh and cooked when ordered (not under the heat lamp). Lasagna is great too. Highly recommend a sundried tomorrow, ricotta, and pepperoni.
author: Richard K.

description:
I ordered this pizza for the first time 5 years ago and immediately stopped looking for any other pizza places. It's just a really solid, pretty consistent, medium crust pizza, with ample cheese and ample toppings. Their delivery (through GrubHub at least) is always early, they deliver later than a lot of other places in the neighborhood, the pizza is always hot, the order is almost never wrong, and it's cheap. Can't fork over the cash for a pizza? Buy a slice for $5. Or two, if you're the hungriest you've ever been. The slices are ENORMOUS, and are fresh-made and topping-rich the same as the full pizza. 

Other things: The calzones are pretty great, and also a pretty decent size. The lasagna is mostly a really good reason to eat a bunch (a BUNCH) of mozzarella cheese and sauce, but who're we kidding. That's what a lasagna is. And they have orange soda. Freaking sweet.
author: Emma D.

description: Three and a half stars for the pizza, but 2 hours for delivery was really excessive. The driver didn't knock on the door the first time, and took it back to the shop. Then another 35 minutes wait. Wow. We had some hungry kids.
author: Dave K.

description: Perfectly nice pizza (ordered via GrubHub), and it came right on time. The only trouble is that they marketed my order as a "deep dish pizza"-- and it's definitely not. It's basically a regular cheese pizza with a stuffed crust, but a deep dish pizza should have a rigid crust and be more like a cake/tart crust than just a regular pizza pie. Tastes great, though!
author: Giacomo D.

description: I didn't think I could switch it up from Supreme, but Serrano's is a serious contender. The slices are huge and the sauce is delicious - it reminds me of Chicago style. I love good pizza.
author: David F.

description:
UPDATE - Response to yours.

How dare I? - there you are being snappy again.  That proves one point.

Second - 9:23?  How about you called us downstairs at 9:37 and because you refused to find legal parking to come up and deliver - it was 9:40 when I took possession of our food which is when the delivery was actually made.

Third - yes, you called and asked to meet downstairs to which I said you're already so late but I'll come and meet you.  So, yes, I did agree.  But only because we were starving and frustrated and the only option to get my food was to meet you because again, you refused to find legal parking to deliver.  And yes when asked why you were so late, you were a snappy little dick about it.

If infact the delivery is for 1-1.5 hours, the way to tell a customer is not by being snappy, but maybe in an understanding, apologetic way - would probably save us from all of this back and forth.  

Last - $1 tip?  Try $4.00.  On a $22 order, I'd say that's pretty fair.  

May I remind you that you work in service and customers may not always be right and you can have that opinion but you asked me to be a man about it and tell the TRUTH, so there - I am telling it.  Oh and because we are on about telling the truth, I made a mistake, the order was at 8:10, not 8:05.  

Pics of tip and time called posted to prove matter further.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

This is strictly for their delivery and customer service.  

I ordered the food at 8:05.  They delivered it at 9:40.  That's an hour and 35 minutes.  

To make matters worst, the delivery guy who is super late, refused to come up to our 4th floor apartment to deliver the food.  Plus he was such a dick about it that when we asked why it was so late he was snappy and said - delivery time is 1-1.5 hours.   

No apologies.  Probably because he already got the tip by ordering through eat24.com.
author: Ryan P.

description: Wonderful delivery pizza - great value and tasty slices. Ordered last minute for the debates and it rocked.
author: Andrew K.

description: This place has the absolute worst customer service. The lady who took our order over the phone was rude and hung up on us before I was even done speaking. When I called back she was even more rude. I asked her to please have the driver CALL us instead of ringing the doorbell out of courtesy to our hosts and she failed to do so. The delivery took longer than the time we were told and when I called back to inquire about our delivery (the place was closing in 10 minutes and we had yet to receive our pizza) the same lady told me the driver was on his way without giving me some sort of ETA and hung up without another word. Sure, the pizza was fine, but their poor customer service makes me deeply regret giving them my money.
author: Daisy M.

description:
People can be picky about their pizza and I happen to be one of those lol. First time here and my tummy was so satisfied. You get SO much for your money too. That's hard to come by these days! 

Add pineapple to the California. You will not regret it. Deeeeelish!
author: Chelsey S.

description:
Delicious Pizza and the single slice is huge!
I love that you can order a slice of anything you want and its baked fresh. 
BBQ Chicken and pineapple is my recent favorite.
author: Anthony M.

description: I was craving pizza after a night out and ordered a slice of cheese on Postmates and it hit the spot. It was a large slice and really the size of 2 slices in my opinion, which was great. Good value if you need a slice of cheesy goodness in a pinch.
author: Kelly F.

description: Serrano Pizza continues to underwhelm despite my hopes each time I try it. A neighborhood pizza spot that has been around for sometime - so really wanted to keep trying in case pizza improves. After 4 separate pizza disappointment, conclusion is this may be for folks that like a medium to thick crust (part of pizza crust was partially cooked 2 of 4 occasions) and globes of cheese spread with half cooked ingredients. Well, nothing wrong with this if you like this kind of pizza - hey each Pizza lovers have their favorites. This just falls short of what my pizza tastes. Pay a little more for Little star or about same  price for The pizza shop in Mission.
author: zack k.

description: I don't know why this place has less than five stars I love it here I have been coming here for years the pizza is amazing really good quality in all aspects in terms of the cheese the bread and the sauce and that the really hard combination to find you either get one or the other but this place really has it all their garlic bread is really good at their chicken wings are really good if you call ahead don't have your pizza ready for you by the time you get there
author: Nicole J.

description: One of my favorite pizza places in the mission. I'd recommend ordering delivery directly through them. Super fast (was estimated an hour, it was delivered in 30 min.). Great taste! And the crust is on point.
author: Derek B.

description: I'm a huge fan of their pizza. The crust and sauce is delicious, and there is always ample toppings, with such a great variety. I pretty much order at least garlic and pineapple on every pizza I order, and it aways comes out delicious. They delivery quickly, and I have never had a wrong order. I pretty much only order from them when I want pizza delivered.
author: Bryan M.

description: So dang good. Delivery was quick and painless. The veggies they put on the pizza was super fresh. My other friend ordered 2 really expensive pizzas somewhere else and no one ate his. I would definitely order from Serrano's again.
author: Suzy Z.

description: Ordered for delivery and almost 2 hours later pizza was still not here. I called about 3 times to check in on the status of my pizza and each time they would say "it's out for delivery" "he will be there in 5 minutes". Finally the pizza man got here and I was asking what took him so long. They had stated it would be delivered within the hour and almost 2 hours later the pizza was just arriving. If I would have known it would take this long I would have just picked it up myself. He then offered to give me 50 percent off but I kept asking what had happened. He literally just said all I can do is 50 percent off for the trouble as he was walking away, he ended up walking away with the pizza. Worst experience EVER!
author: Adriana P.

description: I love this place so much. There lunch special is the best item on the menu. Super filling and shareable. I grew up eating here and now bring all my friends. See you next Sunday!
author: Tamara R.

description:
While their pizza was good the fact that it took 1.5 hours to get my pizza was crazy. 

I placed the order through my Yelp app (Eat Street) and waited 30 min before heading out from Daly City to pick up the pizza.  When we arrived, we learned that they messed up on our order. Instead of making a medium Serrano, they made a slice of Serrano pizza. The order was fully paid and they should've noticed the difference between a $9.50 slice and a $30 pizza.

Good thing I was in the mood for a walk, so we walked Valencia for 25 minutes and received a call when our pizzas were ready.  They didn't offer anything in compensation for the inconvenience and didn't even throw in any extra ranch for the mishap. Bad customer service. So sad...
author: Joy G.

description:
This isn't high end "authentic/modern" Italian food. It's just tasty. 
  
If you want/need a "high-end culinary tour of Italia", there are a million options around the Bay for you and if that fails AItalia will be glad to take your money and drop you off in Naples. 

Serrano's is solid Italian-American food, with a predictable smothering cheese blanket that makes you feel safe and secure at night.  

As a transplanted New Yorker, I need this.  

Yeah, I know what my deceased grandmother's freshly made hand-rolled pasta/ ravioli tasted like and it's not this.  
  
This place, is for the cheese blanket. The cheese blanket and the cheese filing and the cheese topping. Did I mention cheese? Save the fancy ripieno for someone else.  
  
I love this place. And will continue to use it for all my melted cheese with sauce and bread needs.
author: Liss T.

description: Used to be a nice little spot to get a good, quick slice, and a good value on pizza delivery. I think there was a change in ownership or management last year. Regardless, the quality has dropped - and so has the service. They didn't raise the prices, but the pizza's not as good anymore and their delivery is inconsistent. Not worth it anymore.
author: Lake Y.

description:
I had enough with this place... Although their pizza is good I got sick of the constant delays... They say they deliver in 45-60 minutes but it's always longer (around 1h20m). Today I ordered again and although I was informed that they are busy and delivery will take 1h30m it's been 2hrs and still waiting... 

I'm a fairly regular customer and I'm tired of being treated this way... I used to work in a pizza place before and regular customers were always prioritized...

Although I like their food this was my last order with them...
author: Nikos K.

description: Food Is Good But Their Customer Service Has Went To RUDE Over The Time Been Coming Here For Over 23 Years....
author: Tee S.

description:
UNIQUE pizza with flavors that beat anything else.
you get a huge piece for the price and it's a funny football shape.
never seen that before.
plus the toppings are always do something with the flavor to just put it over the top.
most pizza places are missing that delicious mix of topping goodness. This place has it.
author: Tomi A.

description: Straight up garbage. Rubbery, mushy crust, tasteless toppings, inflated price. Save your money, go to the East Bay and get Fat Slice if it's that late. Or just wait until breakfast time. Your stomach will thank you.
author: Malcolm M.

description: Ordered a pizza slice and wings through eat24 app at 8:00pm. Expected time for delivery 9:30. Okay, I get it you may be busy. However, after the time passed eat24 reached out to them and they said they lost the order. wtf. How do u lose an order after eat24 called u initially and u said the order was on its way? Get ur ish together and fire the worker who cannot do their job correctly. Last time I ever order from this disorganized resto.
author: Mark C.

description: Worst customer service ever. We specifically told a woman over the phone to let the driver know to call when he's outside with the delivery. Not only was the woman over the phone rude and hung up on us BUT she did not instruct the driver to call. This place is a joke. Pizza sucked too.
author: Evelyn A.

description:
Took over an hour and a half for an order of soggy and gross buffalo wings and an order of mediocre garlic bread.

This was the one and only time I will ever order from Serranos.
author: Raanan R.

description: Favorite fast pizza place in SF. For me, it has the best dough to marinara to cheese ratio. And it's so cheap! An X-large w/ 3 toppings (1 meat) was $25! I've also had their veggie pizzas too and those are good. Great for vegetarians and former vegetarians. ;)
author: Katey W.

description:
Serrano's Pizza gives you a lot of pizza for not a lot of money. My coworker had half of a slice, stating that he'd have the other half for lunch the next day.

So yeah, you can essentially have two good lunches with one of their slices. They aren't too greasy, come out thin, and have a good crust. Bonus points for taking the time to prepare them in their oven rather than heat them in some sort of pizza sauna (a la Little Caesar's).
author: Casey S.

description:
I actually drunk dialed Serrano's (through the yelp app) instead of another place, but let me say I was glad to have made this mistake!

Serrano's serves a thin crusted pizza, and hits the spot in terms of quality. We ordered delivery for an XL all meat pizza, and it fed 4 hungry people easily. The pizza arrived in less than a hour, which during fleet week on a Saturday evening was plenty fast for us.

I'll definitely order again from them, and actually prefer their pizza over other spots such as bernal pizza or seniore's.
author: Andrew E.

description:
First time here! 
I got the bacon cheeseburger pizza I believe it was called and the slice was HUGE. I thought 5 and some change was too much for pizza but it was perfect! 
The beef could have had more flavor because honestly it was flavorless :( besides that though the cheese was really good. It also had tomatoes and onion. 
The places is kinda small but they have more seating outside but not so much. Staff is really nice. Pizza came out quick.. Not five stars because of the beef and the fact my stomach hurt after eating it.  :(
author: Celeste F.

description:
I don't even know what to say about this place except PHENOMENAL! I seriously love coming here. My BF lives super close and even on the lazy days we don't want to walk the block and a half to pick up our pizza the delivery men/women are prompt and always come to the door happy to bring us our food.

One big piece of advice I can give is to order your pizza extra crispy. They load so much of the good stuff (i.e. sauce and toppings) that it makes the pizza really heavy and the bottom can get a little soggy. The sogginess by no means makes the pizza less good but if you're a messy eater like I am you'll appreciate the extra sturdiness, otherwise your shirt might meet your toppings.

Also try the pesto pizzas with pineapple - yum.

Happy eating!
author: Kimberly D.

description: Thin crust, crispy, made to order slices. As a New Yorker missing home, I was not disappointed.
author: Jamie F.

description: Says that they're open until 1am - got there right before 12:45 and they wouldn't serve us. Unfortunate, they should update their hours or keep slices until they close.
author: Kay R.

description:
The real secret here are the lunch deals.

slice a soda and a salad sort of things for cheap.

A slice takes about 10 minutes, they make you your own little pizza slice personal pizza!. So have a seat outside and watch 21st street go by. 

This is a serious amount of food for very little money. 

Wasnt really feeling the chicken wings the one time I ordered them.
author: Peter M.

description:
Great Pizza!   Really good.  Nice service.  Easy to get into.  VERY SMALL area to eat in.  Probably best to order ahead either electronically or by calling and then pick up to go.  

Interesting collection of pizza choices.  Plus, you can build your own as well.
author: Joseph S.

description:
Serranow's Pizza.. 
1) I'm currently high and drunk.
2) their single slice = 1/4 of a pizza = 
3)I didn't have enough cash for a soda, so owner came out saying, one time only and gave me a free soda.

Disclaimer: not saying you should come here not knowing there is a credit card minimum and try to get a free soda. If you do that you're a douche.  I'm saying these people are fucking homely nice, they deserve your fucking business.

*mic drop*
author: Darren C.

description: I call and order a slice of pizza from Serrano's at least once a week. They're big slices, the pizza is delicious, and the price is right. They usually quote you a 10 minute wait for pickup, and I'm quite alright with that because fresh pizza is 10x better than the reheated slices you get at places like Escape from New York Pizza.
author: Galen P.

description:
i got what i thought was a slice of the clambake pizza. kind of expensive for ~$5, considering the fact that i thought it was one slice (it said so on the menu!). and then two huge slices came out. no complaints here, it was delicious. and i was starving. the crust was crunchy and chewy and yeasty, the sauce tomatoey and straddling sweet/acidic very well, with tons of garlic to satisify the crazy in me. not to mention the fact that there was a generous amount of clams on top. 

my friend got cheese ravioli with meatballs and garlic bread on the side. i personally didn't care for the ravioli, but she seemed to like it. her portion was huge as well, and she easily got 1/4 of a large loaf of garlic bread.
author: Heather F.

description:
I love their pizza.Fresh and fast delivery.Nice people .I had chicken wings and Calzone for dinner.Delicius.
God bless them!!
author: Érica T.

description:
Decadent, delicious pizza. I have craved this pizza so hard while walking around the area, that I had to stop and order a large with my man and walk the 15 some-odd blocks back home. It's like a female pizza boner. 

I would also like to say that I firmly believe that you can tell how good a pizza really is after you take a bite after it's been in your fridge hours after your first round, and feel no urge to warm it up because the flavors have actually gotten more mature and savory by sitting together in the icebox. It's like a pizza party in your fridge and you're invited.

Always get the stuffed crust, don't even think about not getting it. Four stars only becuase I hate waiting for pizza, and Serrano's has kept me waiting several times.
author: Crystal C.

description: Best Pizza EVER! I have been going to this place for 5 years and I hate every other place. If I ever have Pizza from another place I always say it's not better then Serranos though. This place is amazing!
author: Alejandría J.

description: I ordered from Eat 24 a slice of pepperoni,  a slice of margarita, Cesar salad and a slice of chocolate mousse. The pizza came pretty quick under 40 mins. The 2 slices are pretty big and was still warm, and tasted like any other pizza. My daughter enjoyed the whole Cesar salad to herself and it was also a big portion. The best part was the chocolate mousse...yummm!!!
author: Wena D.

description:
Large pies for decent prices. The pizza portions are huge! Sometimes I even see customers eat there pizza with forks and knives. A good place to go to if you are looking for a quick way to fill your appetite, especially after a night of drinking nearby.

The service is great. The employees there are friendly towards everyone every time I went, and they usually recognize me and other customers by name.
author: Henry L.

description:
I ordered through their website and after an hour called to check on the pizza.  I was told they never received the order and I gave them then confirmation code. Then they "found the order" and told me it would be another 45-1hr.  I demanded to know why they wouldn't put me first in line and get it to me ASAP and they just kept saying "oh well it takes time to bake."  

They are about a 5 min drive from my house.  No pizza takes 40 min to bake.  Finally I get her to tell me 25-30.  Then 9 min later I get "my" pizza. Which was, in reality a cold stale reheated pizza, my guess from another order eralier in the day. 

This was not acceptable so I called back and asked why they sent me an old pizza and they have the audacity to say it wasn't.  Really?  According to them it takes 25 mins to bake, and yet I get it in 9 after calling to complain and it comes cold and stale and it's "fresh out of the oven?

I've been calling to speak to a manager since then and they refuse to let me speak to one.  Mysteriously the manager is NEVER there.  Not on Thursday, Friday, Saturday or Monday.  Amazing how that works right?

I paid through PayPal, so i'll try to make a claim through them I guess.
author: P K.

description: I love this place for a hearty slab of freshly made pizza. The made to order slices are nothing fancy, but they are large and delicious and my perfect comfort food.
author: Morgan C.

description:
This used to be our go-to place.  Now it just sucks.  Assuming they actually remember that you placed an order, it takes almost an hour and a half before the pizza is delivered and then it is often cold.

Time to find another go-to pizza joint.

EDIT:
This review was stuck somehow in the unfinished review section and is originally from last year.
author: Bryan H.

description: Hey Serranos!.... Your pizza is not so great...the toppings are ok,  and seem fresh, but. by the time it is delivered the crust is soggy....  and .... YOUR CHICKEN WINGS REALLY SUCK!.... Soggy, sauceless, limp, tasteless, freezer burned, gross chicken wings.... served with warm Kens blue cheese dressing in a pouch.  I mean ... REALLY?  Chicken wings are much regarded in this culture.... Quit being lazy about them, and let's see a little effort.... Maybe some fresh, crunchy, fried chicken wings tossed in spicy hot sauce served with carrots and celery... with fresh, cold blue cheese dressing... What a concept!  Fix the wings (chickens are giving their lives for these things!), address the problem of the soggy crust...and I'll gladly give you 5 stars.
author: Bryan M.

description:
I ordered a calzone here last night, expecting a pocket of mozzarella, sausage and pepperoni, with perhaps a little bit of ricotta. Instead, I got a packet of dough filled with soupy ricotta cheese.

Thats not a calzone folks.
author: Electric V.

description:
So this pizza is a staple of the Mission, as it is the quick delivery or takeout pizza. It is not gourmet, or high end, or really comparable to the top of the line pizzas out there in SF, but it serves a purpose of the takeout and delivery, and they do an EXCELLENT job.  I normally get the chicken pesto, delicious, and the combination or San Franciscan? Great prices, not too steep. And they always have been able to deliver within a reasonable timeframe.

I've had this place for nearly 6 years, it's quality, does the right fix, and I highly reccomend.
author: Howard J.

description:
Wow, your Yelp public response only further solidifies your atrocious customer service. 

The ".com" service confirmed that your driver could have delivered the pizza and offered an apology and credit.

It is 100% your fault. We will never order from you again.
author: Jessica N.

description:
I had to downgrade them to 2 stars, even tho' their pizza is still pretty solid and delivery is on point. We have never waited an hour for our pizza.

The one thing that brought them down to 2? I might've given 1-1/2 if Yelp allowed 1/2 stars.
They still advertise  "Fast & *Free* Delivery" so, how does a $ 22.00 pizza and two sodas come to $30.00?? It doesn't! The "girl" taking orders adds on a tip or whatever. This has been the case for at least the past several months now. We let it slide in the beginning, but really we shouldn't have. We tip well, maybe not great, but well. Certainly NEVER below 15%, so there  really is no need to tack on an added $5 or so to our order. 

It's enough to make a person switch to Escape to NY. It's just as tasty and their delivery has been good/fair, tho' we've only ordered from them twice. We'd like to remain loyal to Serrano's since we've been w/ them for quite some time. But their current practice of adding add'l charge to our order feels like robbery.

Oh. And the chick quoted $30. for the order, but when the bill arrived it had $29.00 as the total! A dollar less than quoted, but still more than it should have been for a $22. pizza and two sodas.
author: Sheba B.

description:
I've been ordering from here for years and the pizza and the delivery time is just getting worse and worse and worse and I'm talking that I've been delivering from for 10 years, they suck now!!!

I don't want to have to call, here are the things:
Never same size slice huge or small, make em just large.
Every time I put notes for xtra anything pep, cheese.. Never happens
Recently it's been over an hr& a half delivery unless from those two old school guys! They're always Koo
I can erase the additional comments, after you read them if you'd like,

You Ass Hat!!! I always tell them to charge me, I don't ask for free shit! To Hell with Serrano's!!!! 
Thanx for nothing!!!
author: Hayden J.

description:
A) Whatever that thing was, it wasn't deep dish.

B) Don't tell me it's "their version"--deep dish doesn't have versions, just varied ingredients.

C) You will shit your pants.

D) And it will have cost you somewhere around $20 to do so.

E) No, really. You will shit your pants.
author: Jiordan C.

description: Decent SF style (thicker crust) pizza for ordering out.  Nothing fancy.
author: Thomas R.

description:
T+0: place my order for a chicken pasta, small salad with bleu cheese, garlic bread, Orangina. Having read the reviews on here, I know others have encountered issues, but I'm really craving pasta, so what the hell. Delivery estimate 45-60 minutes.
T+10 minutes-ish: Serrano's confirms the order.
T+68 m: I call Serrano's. They're unable to get in touch with the driver or tell me more info, but they say my order's on the way.
T+82 m: I chat with Eat24 support to figure out what's going on. Sarah is busy but super nice.
T+95 m: Serrano's driver rings my doorbell. He's apologetic, understandably.

The garlic bread was decent, the chicken completely overdone, the pesto okay, the linguine *far* from al dente, and the side salad inedible (complete with packet of Ken's bleu cheese dressing. /sigh). The Orangina was just fine.

Not again, sorry.
author: Will H.

description:
If you are looking for "good average" pizza with seamless delivery then this is the spot. 

Ordered a pizza, wings, and Caesar salad. No Frills and no complaints.
author: Keri V.

description:
I ordered delivery of a salad and explicatory requested a fork. The salad did not come with a fork and the driver said it would take him 40min to get another fork. 

Also, their pizza is the worst I've had in San Francisco. 

This place is horrible, incompetent, and desperate.

EDIT: I found the fork. It was buried under half my salad. WTF???
author: Melville M.

description: Always been my fave pizza place if I want a quickie. One slice is satisfying but I'm a fattie so two slices is what I do.
author: April S.

description: The flavor of this place is good, however service is lacking. I ordered a Pizza and was told that there was a 30 minute wait.    I got there at the exact 30 minute mark.   When I asked if my pizza was ready, Hector a person that prepares the pizzas pointed to a pizza that he was adding the tomato sauce to and said that was mine.  In a very very rude way, he asked "do you want the pizza or no?"        I would have been fine waiting an extra 10-15 minutes if it wasn't for this persons extremely rude attitude.      I ended up with a refund and going across the street to Jays cheesesteaks.    Good pizza.   Terrible service.
author: Hugo G.

description:
Open till 1am not really
They do not stay open for their posted hours
This place has decent pie 
But staff is rude and the customer service sucks
author: Sf R.

description: One of my go to's in the Mission. Fast and affordable.
author: Jillian M.

description:
I used to eat almost every night here, cuz I am a driver in SF and I've needed almost a fast affordable good pizza. Most of the time I ordered a slice of " CHEF" its a slice of pizza with a combo of cheese, tomato, and Chicken on the top.
By the chance sometimes when I checked the "chicken" on my pizza I noticed that its half cooked and half RAW!!!!!! Till after almost 4 or 6 months, I noticed when I eat food I mean during my eating and also after that my mouth STINKS!!!!! First like everyone else I checked with my dentist and she said my teeth are completely fine. Then I go to a gasteronologist. I did endoscopy!!!! They found a bacteria called "H. Pylori" in my stomach!!!!! Which comes only from raw food! That bacteria intensify my stomach Acid Reflux also. If you don't take care of it carefully you will get ulcer and consequently cancer, its a very Strong and Resistable bacteria. Finally now I'm in a long way of expensive medical treatment And very "Hard and Almost Impossible Diet"! I can only eat banana or rice with turmeric. I totally recommend DON't EVER GO TO THIS PLACE ANYMORE, till someone from SF sanitary deputies inspect their restaurant!!!!!
author: Att P.

description: Talk about poor customer service is an understatement! I just ordered a pizza that took over 65mins when my home is less than five blocks away. The pizza itself is harder than a rock and with freezing cold cheese. I am shocked they would send out this quality of food. I feel as if the pizza was cooked this morning and kept around till ordered.Once I got my food I called the store to complain but THEY HUNG UP on me!!!! Serranos will never get a penny from me again
author: Rudy M.

description:
I ordered a pepperoni pizza at 7:05. It's 9:30 and it's still not here.  Seriously!?  We've called four times so far. Tons of excuses, and a really rude manager. Their pizza isn't good enough for this crap - it's mediocre pizza to begin with. 

Edit: it got here!  9:50.  2 hours and 45 minutes.
author: Seth O.

description: Waited an hour for delivery, delivery came after the store closed, so when i tried to contact them but they don't even pick up. Waited until 12:35 am to receive my order even though I was only a 7 min drive away. The pizza was cold and hard.. My worst experience ordering pizza in San Francisco
author: Mandy Z.

description:
This little place is simply the best at what they do.  I highly recommend ordering the slice, which is actually a personalized pizza, made just the way you want it.  The ingredients are fresh and they are open late too.

They also deliver - and if you order your larger pizza "well-done" it is still perfect by the time it arrives to your house!
author: Autumn B.

description:
Always I pass this spot when on my way to Dolores Park. Each and every time, there are people sitting outside, enjoying a slice. After a 2 hour journey back from Carmel ( where it was Sunny & warm ) my man an I opted for pizza. 

My first thought was Little Star. He googled a spot and it was Serrano's. I backed him up with a Yelp search and found a four star average rating, from over 300 reviews! This place was a definite Yes.

We ordered a medium 1/2 San Franciscan 1/2 Prima. Our order was out lickety-split in 10 minutes flat. As we walked home, the aroma from the box was tempting us to open it and eat as we walked to few blocks home. I have to tell you the pizza did not let us down. Delicious!

It is no Little Star, keep that in mind, but it will definitely do on a Friday night i.
author: Jaylena P.

description: This is some fantastic NY-style pizza. The calzones are great, too. The only caveat is that they're hecka slow! Order 15-20 minutes ahead. Stopping in to grab a quick bite just isn't going to happen here.
author: Mike B.

description:
Where is the green and blue bin system!?  every time I walk in I see the one 'collect all' bin loaded up overflowing with all sorts of recycleables and compostables. It makes me sad!!

Other than that, i love this place as a neighborhood slice spot. I always order a bit of extra red sauce with my orders, and easy on the cheese! :)
author: Best M.

description: Been a fan ever since I was a fetus... My mom would crave their pizza while she was pregnant with me! One of the few places the gentri haven't kicked out of the mission!!
author: Mario R.

description: Best pizza in SF BAY AREA. Must try. The only down side is that the location is very small, but who cares when the pizza is that good! Haha
author: Sergio L.

description: This place is a hidden gem.  All slices are made to order so it takes about 10-15 minutes, but totally worth the wait.  Really cheap too and the slices are huge.
author: Poochie M.

description: Pizza by the slice* (or whole) made to order! Definitely worth the 10-15 min wait.  *portions matter.
author: Jose G.

description: Best pizza in the mission. Ordering online is a breeze. Always on time. Amazing crust/dough.
author: Hollis N.

description: Had a mushroom and sausage slice. Pretty dry and not that great for being freshly made. Why is it so hard to make good pizza in this city? It took about 15 min to get the slice as well.
author: Mitch A.

description:
Cons: 15 minutes for one slice of peppery pizza that fell apart. Be prepared to wait this long for mediocre pizza. There are five other places on valencia street that are faster.

Pros: you can get any topping of your choice on a single slice. Big slices.

Tip: do what everybody else does and make a phone order.
author: Andrea A.

description: This is currently my favorite pizza spot in the city. Slices are made fresh and there's outside seating. Best deal for designing your own slices in SF. Probably not the most ideal for large groups due to limited seating.
author: Gary G.

description: It took an hour and a half for a slice of pizza and sprite to be delivered.  The pizza was cold and flavorless.  The driver didn't include red peppers or cheese.  : / Won't be going back.
author: Shannon O.

description: This used to be a great little pizza place. Lately their orders have taken more than 1 hour regardless of when you order. The new owners aren't as friendly. The price has increased but the quality has decreased. I think there are much better options for the same price or a little more.
author: Cub C.

description: Lady who works the front is a straight bitch. Messed up my phone order, no apologies no anything. Blamed me after, she has short black hair and bad attitude.  Pizza is delicious but the people who work here make me sick
author: Aundria G.

description:
This is the only pizza place I order from. Other pizza places normally have a whole pizza sitting under a lamp and sell them by slices. Serrano's Pizza bakes each slice to order, fresh out of the oven. I always order a slice of San Franciscan with BBQ chicken as an extra topping, and it's a huge slice every time I order. The crust always stays the perfect texture, not too crispy, not too soft. Outstanding!

Because each slice is freshly made to order, it takes about 15 mins to get your pizza slice. If you don't have time to wait or don't wanna wait, call in your order over the phone and then go pick it up, since they do take phone orders. Serrano's is a small place, there are only 3 or 4 seats at the counter and the 1 table they have can fit 2 or 3 people. They also have a couple tables and seats outside.

If you love freshly-made slices of pizza, get your own fresh, delicious, scrumptious pizza from Serrano's Pizza.
author: Chloe B.

description:
Just as in 1993 nine men from around Staten Island once exclaimed, "Wu-Tang Clan ain't nothin' to fuck wit'!" Serrano's has proven itself to be, in this respect, the Wu-Tang Clan of by-the-slice pizza in San Francisco.

To further murder this metaphor, just as Inspectah Deck murdered "Tiumph," a Serrano's slice has RZA-like composition; has the personality of a Ghostface record; espouses a woah-like factor comparible to Liquid Swords as well as the aforementioned Inspectah Deck verse; makes you want more like how OB4CL needed its sequel; is always worth the wait such as Masta Killa's "No Said Date;" is as easily enjoyed as anything Method Man has ever done; and you can only respect it for what it is like ODB. 

This skips U-God, because, quite frankly, if Wu-Tang was like Voltron, U-God would be the toe nail on the pinky toe.

The fact is Serrano's is reasonably priced, more than reasonably sized, filling, and satisfying
author: Ashwin B.

description: An old friend and I used to go to this parlor and school back in 04/05 best homemade pizza ever! I ordered recently and nothing has changed, meaning they're still delicious!
author: Simone M.

description: Been Coming Here Since I was A Kid, Now I Am Here Eating Pizza With My Son. Great Workers & Food
author: Francisco C.

description:
Bad pizza and TERRIBLE wings. This would normally be a 1-star review...

...BUT the calzones are great!!! Plus, they'll deliver a single calzone which is even more awesome! If everything else met that standard, I would be getting fat ordering from Serrano's at least once a week. But for now, it perfectly satisfies the occasional calzone craving.
author: Jesse F.

description: Best pizza joint in the Mission so far. Good-sized slices. Make sure to call ahead of time for pizza by the slices.
author: Thomas L.

description:
(415) 695-1615 is the new 911.

Because when you have a bad cold and merely going out of the house is a Herculean task, there is nothing better than having a freshly made Serrano's Art & Tom pizza (with tomatoes, artichokes, & garlic) delivered promptly to your door.

(Talk about a lifesaver!)
author: Amy C.

description: Good little pizza place in the mission. It's on 21st and Valencia and it's a good place to grab a bite when you're just walking or strolling around. Pizza was average tasting, generous size, but taste wise it could have been better. 3 stars, room for improvement!
author: Catherine Y.

description:
I checked out Serrano's during my lunch break from my Saturday letterpress printing class at CCSF. My classmate recommended it for their pizza by the slice option. You get your own slice, made to order. You will not find dizzy pizzas spinning around waiting for someone to stop by. 

You pick your toppings or go for one of the specials and they get just enough dough for one slice (big a$$ slice) and put it in the oven. Have you ever felt this special? 

Before you get too excited, I must tell you that this is not a fast food place. You will need to be patient because your big little custom slice is going to take a while to bake. Be ready to wait at least 15 minutes for the pizza to be ready and then maybe 5 for it to cool down enough to stuff your face with it. It is worth the wait though. Seriously. Did you hear about the hipster that burned his tongue because he ate his pizza before it was cool? You've been warned.

Serrano's also bakes entire pies and you can call ahead and pick it up or get it delivered if you're in their area.
author: Daisy S.

description: Ordered a pizza for delivery. They estimated it would be 1.5 hours because they were busy. Fine, I get it. 2 hours later, no pizza. Call them and am told it's on it's way and I'm the next stop. 30 minutes after that, still no pizza. Fantastic service. As I'm writing this it's currently been well over 2 hours since placing my delivery and still no pizza...
author: Zack P.

description: This place is really cheap for the big slice of pizza you get! I like the variety of combinations too. Good stuff.
author: Amy R.

description:
Yummy, fresh pizza. (Not the best I've had, but still pretty darn tasty)

I'll never go back.

Six of us went there last night to grab a few slices. We were served our pizza in PAPER BAGS. I asked for a box, homeboy refused. Yes, he REFUSED. Told me "his boss" wouldn't allow him to give out boxes...for free.

This mofo (who was already rude to us) charged me 65 cents for a thin flimsy box that barely even held the weight of my two slices. The fact that my partner threw a few bucks in the tip jar when she ordered, and he STILL refused to give me a box, really ticked me off!

4 stars for the pizza, minus 2 stars for SHITTY customer service.
author: Miss T.

description: Such a disappointment. I spent over $40 on a deep dish pizza and it showed up, not deep dish with all the toppings off the pizza dripping out the box. Such a waste of money. Save your money.
author: Kelly R.

description: I called in order for three slices to go, during a recent trip to SF (my first) during which I stayed in the Mission around the corner, and on the advice of my hosts. This place is a nondescript little hole in the wall with little room to sit. The proprietors certainly didn't appear to be Italian, and I thought,  hmmmm....Well, the three slices (Pesto Delight, Clam Bake, and San Franciscan) were crazy good, and 1.5 slices more than I could eat. This was after a day of walking the streets, and I'm a 275 lb of of shape guy who can flat put it away. Don't judge a book by its cover. This will be one of your favorite pizza places. Next time in the neighborhood, I'll be back!
author: John S.

description: Heaven is a place on earth, and it's taken form in Serrano's. The pepperoni calzone is flawless, stuffed with 2 types of cheese and a dank amount of tomato sauce. The Cesar salad was basic, but I only get that to even out all the cheese and bread. Never change
author: Jay C.

description: Great place to get  pizza.  I have had pizza from NY to California and this is the go to when I want some good ass pizza..  great service and verity.  I highly recommend...
author: J B.

description: If youre ordering on the phone I wouldn't recommend to do that because they suck at it.
author: Abror A.

description: One word ...Hurting. What's to like? The wings are pre-made so the skin is nice and loose, so it's like chewing a rubber band. The amount of ricotta cheese stuffed into the calzone would choke a crocodile. I guess if you're drunk the pizza is passable.
author: Bruce S.

description: These slices are huge! I had the margherita pizza, which took awhile to make, but it came out hot and fresh, so I didn't mind. It's not the best pizza I've ever had, but it was pretty good -- I think my friend's sausage pizza was a little bit better.
author: Kelly R.

description: Good food, and it was delivered 20 minutes faster than estimated. The pizza was delicious, and the salad was fresh and delicious (I'm a sucker for whole banana peppers and shredded cheese on my salad though). One warning: they're deep dish pizza isn't a true deep dish, it's more of a stuffed crust.  But it's stuffed with real mozzarella,  not that slimy cheese product the big chains use.  Definitely would order it again.
author: Michael L.

description:
Ordered delivery from Serrano's tonight, because not too many pizza places deliver to my area.  Most recently I had takeout from Goat Hill, and while it was delicious, I can't afford to spend quite that much on pizza all the time.

So I looked on GrubHub and found Serrano's.  An $8 minimum for free delivery??  Yes, please!  (Most other places it was at least $15, if not $25!)  I ordered a make-your-own deep dish pizza online, and the delivery estimate was about an hour, however, they showed up roughly 30 minutes earlier, YAY!  +1 star for this hungry girl!

Anyway, I open the box, and it's not exactly your typical deep dish, like the Chicago-style.  It's more like regular pizza with HUGE crusts filled with mozzarella.  It's sort of like the stuffed crust pizzas that I think Domino's used to sell, but of course MUCH better quality.  So don't order this deep dish and expect Little Star or Zachary's style.

However, being a major carb-lover, I enjoyed every bite of that cheese-filled crust!  Delish.

I had to stop myself before I devoured the entire pizza, it was just amazing.  Can't wait to eat the leftovers tomorrow!  (and maybe even the day after that...it's very filling!)

Will definitely order from here again.  Might skip the deep dish style next time and just get regular pizza, but then again, those cheese-filled crusts are certainly amazing!
author: Caroline K.

description:
Just ordered delivery from them for the first time, and am really happy with both the food and timeliness of the order arriving.  I ordered, and I swear it couldn't have been 20 minutes and the food got here.  I love when I'm expecting up to an hour and its here sooner!

I ordered 3 salads (am I weird? maybe) because I couldn't decide which one I wanted, and so I'd have lunch for tomorrow as well.  All of them have really fresh ingredients and I requested fresh garlic be added to them and I could tell it was freshly chopped....sooo good.

Great experience with them, and will definitely be ordering again.
author: Scarlett C.

description:
Went for the infamous 3-crusted slice. Got only two crusts because the person behind me ordered the same thing so they just made a big one and sliced it in half. This wasn't really a huge problem seeing as normal pizza usually only has one crust.

Unfortunately, the pizza itself just wasn't all that good. The crust was doughy, and the sauce was almost sour. Plus, the dude behind the counter initially gave me the wrong change, and I had to walk him through the simple math of subtraction. Since the customer ahead of me paid with credit, he apparently forgot to delete that order from the register and added it to my order, tripling the cost. Mr. Math Genius actually had to call his manager over because that effort was beyond him.

Maybe this place is better when you're drunk and ordering delivery. Somehow, I doubt it.
author: Amanda S.

description: One of the best pizzas in San Francisco! I always order a slice of the Fiesta and it never disappoints. A HUGE slice with meats galore. Perfect balance of sauce and the dough is not too thick, not too thin, not too soft - just the way I like it.
author: Jonathan P.

description:
WHY IS THE SAUCE SPICED WITH HOT PEPPER? 

Every place in the world that serves pizza offers crushed red pepper for those who want a little (or a lot of) heat, so why put the heat in the sauce?
Serrano's is convenient and I really want to like their pizza; unfortunately (for me) I find it inedible. 

What I find most upsetting is, this could be GREAT PIZZA! The crust is thin and crispy with just a hint of sweetness, the ingredients are fresh and the pizza looks delicious but you can't have great (or even good) pizza without good sauce and in addition to the spice issue, this sauce is heavy and tastes of pepperoni (?).

I belong to that tiny minority (at least in the Mission) that doesn't think that everything I eat is improved by the addition of hot pepper and that pizza is automatically improved by adding more (and more) cheese.
author: Tom W.

description:
Quite literally two hours & fifteen minutes -still no pizza delivered. 3 promises that would only be ten more minutes. I cancelled.
I just saw another review by someone that had. A similar experience. The excuse was that the driver was attacked- possible but was  someone attacked again tonight? I ordered at 7:44, it's 10:05, Still no pizza- really?  If they were attacked  it was probably because you guys took over two and a half hours to deliver their food and they were beyond hangry. 
Lots of excuses no food. Now I am doing exactly what I  was trying to avoid walking in the rain looking for food. Pizza is not good enough for this crap.

It just showed up- 10:42p.
author: M T.

description:
serranos is thee spot !!! 

Get the San Franciscan or the Pesto...


There's like hella other different hipster toppings for yall hipster outer towners too.
author: Yeni K.

description: Huge, fresh slices with tasty ingredients -- great little hole in the wall.
author: Jose L.

description: Great pizza good prices order on the phone and it's usually ready in the estimated time they give you
author: Jazzy M.

description:
This is, hands down, the best pizza in San Francisco. Always made fresh, to order, and comes out amazing every time. Their sauce, the amount of cheese, the dough, all incredible, especially for San Francisco. Also, the slices are HUGE. For $3 you get far more pizza than any of the competitors.

The location is also great: proximity to bars, quiet street in the Mission; tucked away but close to it all. 

A MUST.
author: Micah H.

description:
Amazing fresh by-the-slice. Slices made from scratch have a nice crust around the edges. 

This would be a five-star review, only I once had a whole pizza delivered and it wasn't even that good. So definitely stick with slices.
author: Nat O.

description:
The good: Great pizza. Ordered a veggie, meat, and chicken pesto and all were delish. 

Could be better: Delivery time was over an hour  (quoted time 45-60min). 

Would order from here again!
author: Loretta R.

description:
MMM PIZZA.

Sorry no details here, this pizza slice was consumed post bar hopping. But I do recall it being delicious!

Stay open later please!
author: Jess C.

description: Serrano's has been my go-to pizza for about six months. It's usually fresh, delicious and delivered expeditiously. Tonight, however, the pies arrived late, cold and just OK. Toppings seemed canned/lower quality than usual. I'll give S's another chance, but I'm wary now....
author: Andrew J.

description: Honestly My Favorite pizza!! I am a regular i go all the time with my husband BUT i do have a complaint the only latin girl that works there with glasses is rude as fuck she always gives attitude she always rolls her eyes , shes need to brush up on her costumer service skills ! I suggest to check her on that .
author: Diana V.

description: Great Pizza especially the Portuguese but their delivery SUCKS big time
author: ive g.

description: If you're in the Mission & need a good, inexpensive slice, this is the place. I recommend pepperoni, mushrooms & green onions ;-)
author: Ted R.

description:
I'm from NY and this is without a doubt THE BEST PIZZA I HAVE EVER HAD!

They make each slice to order, as in roll out the dough and add on the freshest toppings around, for every. single. order.  If this isn't enough to make you drool already, you're crazy!

The crust--immaculate.  The toppings--fresher than fresh. The slice--ENORMOUS. My love for this place--never ending.

Their delivery is fast and the guys are SUPER nice and the pizza is ALWAYS spot on.  If you have never eaten pizza from Serrano's before, I'm SO sorry for you!!  Get on your phone RIGHT NOW and call. 

This is a decision that will leave you coming back for more; again, and again and again. I think I order from here at least 3 times a month... it's less of a craving and more of an addiction.

BRING ON THE SERRANO'S!
author: Alyssa S.

description: Huge pizza slices at a great price, fast delivery with only an $8 minimum. I've been ordering from them for a while, can't believe it took me so long to drop a review.
author: Danny M.

description: Simply the best pizza in SF, and also inexpensive.  Each piece is practically a meal in itself.  Just be aware that it's not fast food, as everything is baked fresh.
author: David M.

description: Hands down my favorite pizza spot in SF. Slices are around $6 and by slice I mean this huge thing that counts as two slices for the price of one!!! They bake every single single fresh after you order it so it does take 15 min. But if you have no problem waiting a minute for a slice that comes right out of the oven, you've got to try this place. I usually get the lunch special because I can get a slice, small salad, and can of soda for under $8... Cheapest meal in the mission!
author: Jariah B.

description:
This is a great pizza spot especially if your just in the mood for your own slice which is more like two slices :)

Love the basic pepperoni slice here always nice and crispy and the sauce is awesome :)

They are pretty quick on delivery too.
author: Michael W.

description: Great food! The portions are large and just right. My fav is the Mission slice. Delivery guys are always prompt and nice. I've ordered delivery about twice this week already.
author: Charlie R.

description:
Dear Serrano's,

I love you. I order from you weekly because of your simple, yet delicious, salads, and excellent calzones...but I have one request. Every time I order, the person who answers cannot understand me. Please, please, please for the love of all that is good with Serrano's, San Francisco, and this beautiful world that we live in, put someone who can understand English on the phones.

Thank you. I am look forward to the salad and calzone that I ordered. As always, you'll be here at my apartment in 45 minutes to an hour. Yeah!!!:)

Sincerely,

Matt
author: Matt D.

description: Said they would get in touch to "take care" of what happened, never got in touch. Way to dig yourself in deeper Serrano's  :(
author: Diana B.

description:
Slices were huge and had generous toppings, but were just rather salty and tasteless. Calzone was hot and crispy with flavorful crust. But tomato sauce has overpowering oregano flavor and not much else. It could, however, be easily improved. 

They used Virginia ham in a ham calzone and the ricotta filling had overall sweetish flavor, so it definitely didn't taste like the classic Italian calzone. Plus the sauce was on the inside. I asked for some sauce on the side, and it was cold. 

Dining surfaces were grimy. No one was wiping down the counters and tables in between customers, and the communal water pitcher was sketch-eek.
author: Barbara N.

description:
I had been ordering delivery from them for 5 years when I called up to get a pizza the other night.  The person on the phone said they don't delivery to my address.  I asked when this change was made, but the person on the phone said they have never delivered here.  I said I had been getting delivery for years from them and they said I hadn't.  My previous review from 2012 even explicitly calls out that they've been delivering to me.  I don't appreciate this behaviour, so I'll take my business elsewhere.

Anyway, the pizza is OK.  This place is cheap and you get what you pay for.  I'd rather Patxis or Little Star these days anyway.
author: John F.

description:
The pizza and the pricing aren't bad; but the promises on the delivery to address in the Mission (calling at 11:20 am, being told multiple pies, drinks and salads in aluminum trays will be there at 12:10 pm)---might leave you in the lurch.

Finally appeared at 12:49 pm, leaving everyone 11 minutes to eat and bolt.

It's 1.2 miles and 8 minutes according to Google maps...

Pies themselves were fine, if not Tony's Pizzeria---

But be careful about the delivery option
author: Roger W.

description: The go-to pizza joint in the mission. One generous slice is big enough for a filling dinner. The wait may be a little longer, but that's because they make each slice from scratch. A great choice for either a regular meal or a slice after drinks at nearby bars.
author: Jeff W.

description:
This is my favorite pizza place that I've been to in the south side of SF.  I like it more than the competition because their pizza is a bit less greasy and has more emphasis on the crust which I think is often the most critical part of pizza.

They have a nice spicy sauce.

While the orders can take forever if you walk in, their ready within the time it takes me to drive there.  

The slice prices seem high, but you basically get two slices for that price because they are so big. They have a good lunch special too where you can get a side salad, slice, and a drink for like 6 bucks.
author: Mark N.

description:
This review isn't about the timing.. because it wasn't that bad.. within the hour. 

However, the food was pretty disappointing. Friends of mine have passionately talked about their pizza. I actually did try them once before when I was forced to by the homies to order some and yes, yummy! Unfortunately, the pizza we got tonight doesn't look like the Serrano's I tried a few months back. I bragged about how delicious Serrano's was to my boyfrirend and ordered us the Dolores Pizza. 

Sadness.. Where do I begin? The crust  was doughy and thick, cheese was rubbery, the zucchini was undercooked, garlic undercooked and the spinach looked like prepackaged chopped frozen spinach that was carelessly laid over in chunks. I think the most unattractive part was the chicken.. which looked very processed. You know chicken is processed when it's texture is in comparison of McDonald's chicken nuggets.The good old spongey blended and molded chicken. Yum! The pizza had no golden tint or color --everything was pretty raw.

 Very disappointed, Serrano. Way to take cool points off in being a girlfriend who knows her pizza... Grrr.
author: Leelee K.

description: I got a small pizza delivered. Took like 2 hours but i didn't mind so much. Really good pizza hits the spot but i am pretty easy going with pizza. If its decent it will do the job. but this pizza....sadly... sucked mega ass. 3 slices in i tried to lie to myself and shuffle it down (since i was hungry and paid 13 dollars. but the truth couldn't stay buried as it made me puke a little in my mouth. ya know like the burp that you puke a little with... what came up went back down and I continued determined to finish the pizza. why? Cause i didn't want to waste money. Something....in... the dough.... not..of.. earth origin. I laid on my bed like a depressed pterodactyl moaning in the moonlight.
author: Drawing G.

description: The pizza itself is very average. The price is high, the size of the establishment is despicable. When taking food to-go they will resist giving you too many boxes, napkins, utensils, etc because they are cheapskates. The costco cheesecake they re-sell is cut into tiny $3 slices when you can buy about 20 full size slices from costco for $12.99. If you are starving and happen to be standing right in front of this place i guess its your only option, but otherwise dont waste your time!!!
author: Local G.

description:
While this is one of the best slice pizza shops around, they forgot my order!  I called 30 mins ahead, showed up, and they said, "it'll be another 30 mins.  Didn't you just call?"  Me: "No, I called 30 mins ago!", checking my calls list on my phone.  She didn't even offer to rush it or put it ahead of the other pizzas in queue.
