When she checked her order slips, I realized why she made the mistake.  She wrote down my order like 5 slips underneath the top one!  I might give them another shot, but I now realize that I'll have to continually call after I order in order to confirm that they're actually making my pizza.
author: J S.

description: Got pizza delivery...pizza so so not great and a little soggy in the middle! Garlic bread didn't get delivered!!!
author: Sammy E.

description:
San Francisco is obsessed with perfecting the Neapolitan pizza. Actually, more accurately, San Francisco is obsessed with adding their own unique twist to the classic recipe, instead creating variations that almost classify as the original but more closely resemble a close cousin. A16, Flour and Water, Ragazza, Delfina Pizzeria, Beretta, Una Pizza Napoletana, Tony's Pizza Napoletana, Zero Zero...the list goes on. It's so prolific that, other than a few, well-known deep-dish pizzerias I began thinking that this was practically the only non-chain type of pizza available in this city.

My problem is that, frankly, it's just not my favorite style of pizza. Yes, of course a panna and prosciutto pie can be magically delicious, and yes being presented with pizza menus that actually change depending on the season keeps things interesting. Hell, I've even been to Naples and had the real thing! And you know what? I just didn't understand what the craze is all about. I understand that the perfect Neapolitan pizza has a special place in the hearts of many SF inhabitants, but you know what I have to say? F*** Neapolitan pizza.

Sometimes I just want a big, thick, overly-mozzarella-cheesed, greasy slice of heaven. So you can imagine my excitement to find my very own neighborhood version of Round Table Pizza just around the corner from my house in the Mission. 

Serrano's Pizza serves up just what I like: incomparable slices of hot, chewy, pepperoni-covered pizza large enough to feed a small family. Actually, a large is so large that I was able to feed two people a satisfying lunch and dinner for two days straight. Of course, those two days were so spectacular that I thought, "Why stop at just two?" and kept going for a full four days in a row.

And no, I'm not ashamed.
author: Kelsey E.

description: Only one problem in many years...sometimes the crust is a tad burned. Otherwise they are good neighbors and good old fashioned inexpensive fresh pizza. I have used them to serve many a production meeting or private parties at my house to good reviews too.
author: Sion S.

description: I absolutely HATE being lied to especially when i'm hungry ... they told me my order would be delivered within 45 mins an hour and 15 mins later still no food ... called to cancel my order and the guy hung up on me. won't be going there or ordering from there ever again !
author: Vanessa T.

description: The quantity you get for the price is hard to beat... However, the quality sucks. And my experience with delivery was pretty horrible. The lady on the phone was extremely rude. As she was trying to take my card number she said "can you hurry, because we're really busy." At that point I told her to go ahead and cancel my order because I'd rather be hungry than wait an hour for below average pizza and crappy service.
author: Cass C.

description: Disclaimer: I do not post Yelp reviews, but I have to for Serranos. I'm visiting from out of town and have been sampling the SF delivery scene and this is by far the best experience I've had. And I was very hesitant based on recents reviews but am sooooo happy I gave this place a try. They ran out of a topping I ordered and called me literally 5 seconds after I placed the order to ask for a substitute. The woman on the phone was so friendly it caught me off guard! Pizza arrived about an hour later and it was still hot. Most importantly: THIS PIZZA IS DELICIOUS. I am from NYC which has very strict pizza standards and Serranos is damn good. Slices are huge and I did an odd topping combo that is still amazing just because of quality ingredients! Also they deliver individual slices? Unheard of. Hats off to you Serranos.
author: Kailey Y.

description:
Just recently moved here from the city known for the terrible Cubs Baseball franchise, Al Capone and the DEEP dish pizza pies....and with that being said...I loath deep dish! 

While venturing out one night in the mission district I stumbled upon this little nook of heaven. My stomach started talking to me, my brain listened and my nose sniffed out the right spot for my hunger games. I stepped foot into this joint and the smell of cheesy goodness engulfed my nostrils.  My mouth instantly began to salivate such as a dog that has been classically conditioned. I looked up at the menu and pondered for a brief minute, b/c I knew my first choice would have to be a good one since it was my first time. First impressions always stick. So , after many minutes I decided to get a classic pepperoni and a hawaiian slice. 

I have had NYC style slices before, and I figured one would not be enough. How wrong I was. To my bewildered amazement, the slices were basically 4. I had anticipated the pizza so much while it cooked, I didn't even bother to leave, and scarfed down the pepperoni slice right there on the spot.  (for a mental image...think of a rabid wolverine) The workers pry thought I was Takuri Kobiyashi...u know, the asian dude that dominated the nathans hotdog eating contest for years. 

After that sad display of public eating, I ventured out with my other slice...hand in cheese walking merrily down the road. I fig'd I would eat this one on the way home. But that too didn't even make it to the Chase Bank at the end of the street where it intersects with Mission. Def stuffing my face with this pizza for years to come.
author: Mr. Potato G.

description: Pizza is average, at best, in my view. Buffalo wings were soggy and served with very low quality dressing. My delivery order was a disaster. One item was missing. The other was the wrong item. I called in to have it corrected. They neither corrected my order nor offered a refund. This restaurant is clearly not focused on customers. Never again.
author: Jeff E.

description:
First off, this is based solely on the delivery. I've eaten here once but I've ordered dozens of times. It's one of the most consistent pizza delivery joints in the area, and I can always count on Serrano's delivery late at night.  The $8 minimum is pretty huge, too.

Decent pizza. Not great in my opinion, but It's good for a cheap pie in San Francisco. Traditional slightly sweet thin crust, fresh pizza sauce, good cheese and generous toppings. It has always been cooked perfectly for me, never too doughy or cold, and never overcooked and burnt. The "Deep Dish" is what I've always known as Stuffed Crust, usually when I think deep-dish I think chicago-style, but apparently around here It's thin crust with cheese-filled thick outer crust. 

The pasta is pretty good as well, but some are very oily. The Green Ravioli is my usual - Raviolis filled with ricotta, mozzarella, spinach and herbs - with the pesto sauce. Usually the pesto is good and not too heavy, but rarely it can be very oily and a bit much.

My order has always gotten to me on time, they usually say 45-60 minutes, which is repeatedly accurate. Free, on-time delivery and excellent prices in addition to satisfying food and a convenient location make Serrano's an all-around excellent spot for a quick slice or late-night delivery.
author: Chris G.

description: Who says there isn't good pizza in SF? Not this yelper after trying Serrano's. Initially attracted by the aroma of baking mozzarella and italian herbs, I decided to stop in for a slice. The wait, about 10-15 minutes, was well worth it: my pie was hot out-of-the-oven, generous w/ toppings and cheese, and gargantuan. And at $6.40 (for the Chef Special) you'd be hard pressed to find a cheaper hot meal in SF.
author: Patrick C.

description:
Got a slice of 'The San Franciscan' 
It was so delicious and the size was such a great value.
author: Ragnar R.

description:
I'm not really into veggie pizzas, because I don't really care for mushrooms, onions, or peppers (hi, I'm boring!) - however, Serrano's vegetarian pizza is so good I don't pick any of those items off. It's the best veggie pizza I've ever had. Fresh ingredients. Good crust. Super garlicky, which is a plus in my book. Since leaving SF, I've craved it regularly (such as right now, prompting me to write this review). 

Minus one star for being on the pricey side - over $21 for a 14"/$7 for a slice. Granted you get what you pay for, and what you're paying for is deliciousness...worth it if you can afford it, tauntingly prohibitive if you can't.
author: Stacey L.

description: Its right around the corner from work.  Super delish if I do say so my self. Highly recommend chef special and pesto delight . Lunch special a drink and salad with slice .
author: Nicole V.

description:
It pains me to give even 1 star. Very disappointing customer service for a called in order over this past weekend. I found Serrano's Pizza on Yelp and figured it appeared to be a favorite for many, prices were ok as were the photos. I called the order in, initial call was ok but no ETA given. I know places when busy can be up to one hour, so we waited, and waited and waited. 

I called them, the woman said 'he's on his way'..this was past the hour. 
About 15 min passed, I called in again, a man said 'he wont be there for a while, we're really busy'....what ???????
I shared my concern, that by now it's been 1.5 hours. I suggested that upon ordering, please update late delivery possibilities d/t peak hour. It was between 8-9. 
The last guy was so rude & cavalier. Come on, really did you have to be so rude?

I told him I wasnt going to pay for the pizza. He said 'ok, we'll cancel the order'. I said 'no, please deliver it, we've already been waiting....but your customer service is so poor'....he said 'ok ok ok' and hung up. 
Then - no pizza delivery. 

There are many other pizza places and were pleased w/ another pizza place. But they at least had great customer service, pleasant, informative. 
Good customer service goes a long way. I'm not paying hard earned $ for poor service.
author: Theresa L.

description:
Excellent pizza for the price!
Thought it was a bit too oily, but dabbing oil off with a napkin is easy. For the price, I don't think you can get any better pizza in SF.
author: K L.

description: Huge slices for under $5 w/2 toppings. A big plus in my book is that they have pesto as a sauce option which wins big points. I haven't had pizza in over a month and this was the place that popped that cherry!! If I'm ever in the Mission, this will be on the radar!
author: Richard G.

description: I've been coming to this place for years!! I love the Greek special!!! Pesto with Canadian bacon, onions and feta cheese I love it!!! Great customer service the only thing is that I have to pick it up because i am outside the area that they deliver to other than that best pizza ever!!
author: Evelyn M.

description:
What's great about Serrano's is that each order is baked individually, so the slices are oven fresh. Of course this takes a few minutes, but it's worth it to not get an hours old slice of congealed cheese.

What's not so great is that the pizza is very average.

Toppings are toppings, so it's mainly the quality and relative ratios of crust, sauce, and cheese that differentiate pizzas from one another. Serrano's crust is of the flat-bread type, by this I mean that the dough is either not well yeasted or the yeast is past its expansion stage, so the crust comes out dense and flat. Ideally one would bake the dough at the height of yeast activity such that the expanding CO2 will form a light and springy crust, but in a mom and pop operation this isn't always possible, and I saw that Serrano's raw dough was very flat, suggesting no yeast activity. (Then again, it's always possible that you might order a pizza at exactly the right time and get a much better crust than I got.)

Their sauce is typical, and fortunately they did not over-cheese, which is a sin of many a pizza joint.

All in all, since I don't mind flat crusts, a good solid average pizza.
author: Rob C.

description: A close approximation of NY-style pizza, and pretty good by California standards. Lots of cheese, and the sauce is not overly sweet like many of the impostor pizzas that plague San Francisco. Even their single slices are made to order, which is wonderful when you're dining solo. Very nice, accommodating staff.
author: Michele W.

description:
I love Serrano's Pizza, it's pretty much exactly what I want every time I order, and the garlic cheesy bread has an excellent amount of garlic and cheese on it.

My husband and I usually order what we refer to as the "Matthew Pizza" because our friend, Matthew, introduced us to it.  It's a pizza with jalapenos, artichoke hearts, pineapple and bacon, and it's soooo good. 

Serrano's doesn't skimp on the toppings, and the pizza re-heats really well in the microwave without getting super greasy.

Good price for good pizza. :)
author: Margaret I.

description: Serranos Pizza is really delicious and made to order.  The employees recognize my boyfriend and I as 'regulars' and are always very kind in greeting us.  Always looking forward to coming back for another slice.
author: Haley G.

description: Old school pizza that reminds me of the '90s as a kid!  Humongous slices that take a long time to eat but worth the money.  Not really a sit down place just togo, has a few seats to snarf and go.
author: Eric J.

description: You get what you pay for? My first experience here was decent....my second sucked....leads me to believe that this place is inconsistent. I'll call Pizza Hut next time....at least I know what I'll be getting....meh
author: Ashley A.

description: Not only was it hot & ready when I got there to pick it up, it was very tasty! sometimes "I feel like I ate pizza" after I have some pizza pie, but this made me feel happy in my tummy! they had the pesto chicken mushroom pizza we were dreaming of & it was 11pm when we ordered!!! Thanks for being open late! We had to work a trade show in the city & had missed other places, so we were a bit hungry & so glad a local store guy recommended we give you a try!
author: Tamar K.

description:
Decent slices with good flavor, once it cooled down enough to eat.

The people that work there were a bit strange and give off a totally weird vibe.

Plenty of parking in a public lot across the street and there is metered parking in the neighborhood.
author: S M.

description:
I can't stop eating this slice...  well, that sounds ridiculous right? How can you not finish a slice of pizza? Well, I just had dinner... the tasting menu and extras at Mr. Pollo. Yes, that's a must try. I digress. I must also point out that this slice looks to be about 2/3 the size of their small pizza. Starting at $4, it's huge! Now it's not just a deal of a slice, it's also damn good. Crispy thin crust pizza made to order (yes even the slice, it's pretty much your own pizza shaped like a triangular slice) with fresh ingredients and a kick of herb and spice. 

This is not only a great late night pizza, it's a great anytime pizza. And do others agree? Sure there are these yelp reviews, but when I was waiting for my slice with the rest of the crowd the two phones WOULD NOT stop ringing. It's almost good enough to make a trip across the city for it. Just try it.
author: Al L.

description:
Someone wrote a negative review and included poor parking as a variable for a slice joint in the Mission?  They must live on the Peninsula?  Oh!  They do...Guess the gigantic parking garage directly across the street (which is actually reasonably priced) needs to trim the hedges so the poster wont miss it next time?  Also...the fire hydrant on the corner is always open if you want to go outlaw style.

A money meal on the go everytime for me, pepperoni light on the mushrooms and black olives.  Cheap?  Yep.  Crust, sauce and cheese are solidly correct
author: Jason K.

description:
Tried to order a pizza from Serrano's tonight.  There was an issue with the address of my building and my phone didn't ring when the driver was outside.  I called an hour an a half later after waiting hungrily for my pizza, and they informed me that "the driver was so mad that we refunded your order," and "no you cannot order again."
Thanks Serrano's.  Professional.
author: Andrew A.

description:
Good pizza.  We were in the area and hungry on a Saturday night, and this place was open late.  

Pizza is available "by the slice," but it's not ready-to-go (which we didn't realize until after we'd walked in).  Rather, ordering pizza by the slice is like getting your own triangle-shaped personal pizza made to order.  It take 10-15 minutes for them to ready your slice.  

The price of a slice ranges from about $4.85-8.95 depending on what toppings you want.  They have a lot of suggestions for interesting combinations of toppings, or you can roll your own.  You can also order non-slicey pizza if you want.

Kind of salty, but pipng hot and generically good.  I'll have to come back to try their pizza with clams.
author: Elaine S.

description:
I think the average review of this place has declined as the neighborhood has become wealthier and more likely to favor classier places to eat. I think the quality has stayed about the same.

It's very convenient with cheap pizza by the slice is what you're looking for. It's saltier than I'd prefer, but other than that it's tasty.
author: Jared B.

description:
What a surprise! I've never been at this place and have heard some chatter about how marvelous it is, so I had to check it out. 

I had parked at the garage across the street and was on my way to be a big lesbian at the Lex when I realized I hadn't ate all day. I ran inside the tight space and decided I'd go big and order two slices. Being used to Pizza My Heart and other somewhat underwhelming pizza places, I didn't think I'd be getting much. I was wrong. 

He comes out with a box with what looks like half a pizza. I opted for a Coca-Cola in a can and totally managed to nom my way through the whole thing. All for under 9 bux. Normally, I'd probably eat half of this and save it for later. It was delicious, hot, fresh, and a bargain. I'll be back!
author: Jeremy R.

description:
Nice place for slices.  
Slices are huge and made to order.  
That's unique.  

Pizza is a tad on the salty side, but good east coast style.  
Ordered in for take out.  No problems if you call ahead.
author: Jag A.

description: I've been going to Serraanos for years and their pizza is delicious. I did order a deep dish but was disappointed since the picture represents an actual deep dish pizza per Eat24.  It was more of a thin pizza with a very thick stuffed crust. That said I still like Serrano's. Just won't order deep dish again.
author: Peter W.

description: Two people, one slice, not two people two slices. Walk across street, grab beers at store, he'll open them for you. Practice your patience outside at the tables as that's what they're for. I've overheard the team inside deal with people that have to be the worst ever at ordering pizza. I've heard him say, "I don't know... it's a salad. It has greens." And, "The pepperoni has pepperoni on it. What else would it have on it?" I'm nostalgic about this space as I use to live on this block and there were block parties with badmitton. It's good to see this block hasn't lost its laid back vibe where people just seem to hang around, and Serrano's is a perfect neighborhood spot to do just that.
author: Jon A.

description: I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE Serrano's!!!!!  They deliver so quickly that the pizza is still piping hot.  They have great combinations that give you a little something new or allow you to stay with the more traditional flavors.  We have ordered from here for all our pizza deliveries and have never been disappointed.  Did I mention I love Serrano's?
author: Rebekah C.

description:
This place does made-to-order slices. Sure, you have to wait several minutes to get your slice, but it's fresh and hasn't been sitting around for a while.

As a former New-Yorker, this place has got great New-York-style pizza. The crust has just the right "chew" to it and the tomato sauce is really flavorful.

Note that this place is a clone (in a good way) of Deja Vu Pizza on 16th @ Guerrero. Perhaps they have the same owner.
author: Paul L.

description:
I had a Salami Deep Dish pizza here, It wasn't what I was expecting, it was a flat style pizza, but it had a huge crust. However The Salami was incredibly tasty, and the pizza itself must have been laced with some sort of drug because it was amazingly delicious.

Cannot recommend the Salami Pizza more! Super awesome.
author: Tim E.

description: My favorite pizza in sf. They should get this guy to come in:  http://youtu.be/yunwTSfbAyI
author: Jody B.

description: Really awesome! The pizza is a little messy but it's totally fine, super cheesy and tasty!!
author: Renee R.

description:
After my last venture into ordering pizza from unknown places, I decided to once again brave the world of delivery. With the sour taste of my most recent experience still on my palate, I was honestly praying that Serrano's would deliver something to make me forget all about that horrible pizza place from the other day.

Still craving pizza, I researched Serrano's and decided that their reviews were almost all fairly good and their prices were reasonable. I ordered my typical comfort food (buffalo wings and Hawaiian pizza with a soda). Predicted delivery time was an hour, they made it here before that, so kudos on the timing, especially for a Saturday night. The delivery guy wasn't a douche and didn't act like he was rushed, and he showed up with a smile, which is always nice.

I gave them four stars due to the pizza being a little bit too doughy. It was good though, as were the buffalo wings, which were a generous portion of about 10-12 wings and TWO sides of ranch (in the plastic tubs!). Both items were nice and hot, and the soda nice and cold, which tells me that my food wasn't just sitting there in a window waiting for half an hour before getting shuttled out. 

Someone at this place obviously knows how to run their kitchen. Definitely will be hitting up Serrano's when my pizza craving returns.
author: Eyva Kid C.

description:
Best pizza in town. A small place on 21st , parking lot right across the street makes it convenient to drop in for a quick slice. Also thumbs up for great delivery service!

A slice is good enough as it combines 2 stuck together. Quite a few to choose from ,Mission being my favorite.
author: Vikram D.

description: I always go here to grab a slice of pepperoni pizza. Speaking of slices of pizzas, they are huge! It seems like they are giving you 2 slices for the price of one. Their pizza is not only big, but they are delicious. Try a slice today!!!
author: Michael V.

description: Serrano's pizza gives you great food for the low. My favorite is the affordable lunch special. Fills you up and has a great taste to it! Now I'm ready for the rest of the day.
author: Miguel P.

description:
They have the ABSOLUTE WORST customer service ever. 

I placed an order for their "healthy chicken", which sounded yummy after a long day at work. Grubhub said they were a mile away from my house and my order would be delivered in about an hour. After getting in to comfortable clothes, I sat on my couch and waited for my food. I got a call not long after from this place telling me they won't deliver to my house because its "too far away". I explained that online it said it was only a mile away from my house and they just said "well you can pick it up or we can cancel the order". I expressed my frustrations with the fact that they couldn't deliver my food A MILE from their place, and they asshole of a guy on the phone asked me "if it's only a mile a way what's the big deal in picking it up?" First of all, I was already in comfortable clothes and did not want to leave me house. Second, if I wanted to pick it up I wouldn't have ordered it for delivery. Third, it is none of his business why I didn't want to pick it up. For all he knew, I could have been paralyzed and unable to drive a car and therefore ordered delivery. 

Bottom line: They are rude, inconsiderate, nosy, lazy people and I wouldn't even recommend this place to my worst enemy. If I could have this place less than 1 star, I would.
author: Alyson V.

description:
Possibly the best pizza in this side of the City...

My slice of Margherita pizza was HUGE (definitely sharable with one other person), and ingredients tasted fresh! 

Minus one star for hard crust if you eat slow (like me).
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Each slice is REALLY BIG.  I wish I had known it would be the size of my torso.

The slices were A-OK.
author: David W.

description: Mmmm, the thing to do here is order a slice of pizza ($2.80 for cheese). It is more than enough food for one person (and I eat it all with great gusto), and it is delicious.  And cheap.  And delicious.
author: Tasha D.

description:
I know there're a lot of awesome high end pizza places in town but this one is by far the only place we come when we feel like getting some pizza.

This small place is crazily busy.  The owner is constantly on the phone.  

What we love about this place is that everything is just right.  Sometimes the pizza sauce and cheese can be over powering.  Not that we don't like cheese or pizza sauce.  They put just the right amount of cheese and pizza sauce to accompany the toppings and you don't feel overwhelmed afterwards.  

The wait time can be a killer but all the pizzas are made fresh so it's worth the wait.
author: W C.

description: Salads, pizza delish. Everything is fresh and sometimes there is a wait which does not bother me because i like fresh made pizza vs pizza thats been sitting for a while.
author: Denise M.

description: Terrible experience.  The pizza was 90 minutes late and when it arrived it was the wrong pizza.  The worst part was that they came back to pick up the pizza so that they could deliver it to another customer.  Yuck!  Very unprofessional.
author: Freddy M.

description:
Yummy! 

Love the crust.

Pesto Delight is scrumptious and pairs so well with a glass of red wine. 

I also like the Veggie and they'll make it vegan for you if you ask for no cheese.

When I've had visitors we've chosen several meaty ones and carnivores seem to love those just as well.
author: Heirloom Z.

description: This is a basic but good pie. I especially love the sauce and Italian sausage--they don't skimp on quality. I appreciate how, unlike many local pizzerias, Serrano's is consistently good, and they're open until 1:00 a.m. on Friday and Saturday.
author: Raoul U.

description: Before you continue reading, this has nothing to do with the actual food, just the service and generosity of the company.I just went to Serrano's and Escape from New York Pizza to ask for a donation of pizza boxes to a classroom; I quickly received a "no" response from management of both places.  I will not be returning  because both of these neighborhood pizza places, both of which my school and I are regulars, do not care enough about schools or education for me to return to.   I clearly stated that I was a teacher and the pizza boxes were for a project.  They did not care about this information and just cared about the fact that pizza boxes cost them some amount of money that they would not be seeing.  The fact that teachers make little money or that education is in a state of crisis did not seem to bother them when they quickly told me no.
author: Rochelle R.

description:
Serrano's doesn't dabble in lean, thin sliced NY style pizza or the dense saucy Chicago style pizza.  They don't even do California pizza.  They make thick crust pizza with lavish amounts of cheese and topping.  Their own thing.  Which is actually a great change of pace from other places, and good on its own accord.  

Wholesome, Filling and Satisfying.

These prove to be much better than your average thin sliced pizza place.  And still cheap enough for you to be a regular at.
author: Raman S.

description:
This place is pretty sweet. There are a wealth of toppings to choose from, everything from artichoke hearts to zucchini, all very fresh. You choose what you want on the slice and they make it fresh right then. (So, if you're in a hurry, you may wanna call in ahead). The slices are also very large, which is great. Super value.

They have a lunch special that comes with a coke and a salad, perfect for that noon time meal. Outdoor seating in The Mission = muy bueno. Or is that multi bene? That's about it for seating though, aside from some counter space inside. It's a little cramped.
author: Wes T.

description:
One afternoon I was craving pizza, and I yelped around some places and asked a couple friends for recommendations in the Mission/Valencia area. 

When my boyfriend and I walked in it felt like we were walking into an oven. It was kind of a warm day, but the place was tiny and the pizza ovens are a couple steps away from the counter. The menu is super large and behind the counter. I ordered the veggie slice since it had all of my favorite toppings. 

The slice was huge, there were HELLA toppings, they were HELLA delicious, and it was HELLA cheap! So I will definitely be back on my next pizza crave.
author: Sophia G.

description:
3.5 stars.
For some reason I used to like this place more.  
There's a long wait, but even the slices, which are enormous, are made fresh to order.  
The pizza is decent.  It definitely fills the hole and is pretty good value.  I prefer to just get one to two toppings (sausage and olive!) because the specialty pizzas can get a bit soggy.  Bf likes the pollo loco specialty pizza. 
Free delivery is nice.
author: Jane F.

description:
We order delivery from Serrano's whenever we feel like pizza.

They have a terrific toppings list which includes items most pizza joints don't like pepperocini's.   The quality of the food has always been terrific.  Our orders always arrive on time and hot.
author: Russell D.

description: I love the calzones here! The ones that I've had have been good, but I LOVE 'Zoey.' I get one every other week--mandatory! They are very affordable, and delicious!
author: M'famous O.

description:
I threw 99% of this away. I give this 1 star (cuz you have to) but it should be zero because the pesto sauce was really truly boring no basil taste, toppings were too big spill-all-over the-place sloppy, everything was way too salty, and the boring bland crust was not all the way done in the middle- euw. 

BUT I WOULD GIVE THEM MINUS STARS if I could because after about 2 min of unhappy eating I had to run to the toilet - no more info needed!  I went back 4 times in 20 min - keeps going thru me - something on/in the pizza most certainly upset my stomach & I've got a strong system, takes more than a bit of uncooked dough to bother it. 

I will never order anything from them again, all it takes is one time like this for me, and I will warn others.

I keep re-editing this because I continue to feel ill.
author: Sybil H.

description:
The food is quite tasty and decently priced.

My problem is that my entire CC number was printed on the receipt! (including my copy, which I would have thrown away in whole if I hadn't noticed and torn it up!)

Watch out!
author: L K.

description:
My search for good pizza delivery continues with Serrano's.  Since I've moved to the Mission I haven't found a go-to place to order pizza, but I think right now Serrano's is it!

I got a mushroom, pepperoni and onion pizza and it was pretty damn good.  I've had their slices many times but hadn't ordered delivery until last night when I drunkenly awoke from an Iron Bowl induced slumber.  That stressful game, plus a dozen or so beers and a shot of whiskey had me down for the count after the crazy start and being down 24-0 only to come back and beat Bama's ass at their home stadium to stay undefeated and in the National title hunt.  Wow what a crazy game - still can't believe it's real, but the pizza box tells me it is - yum!
author: Gene X.

description: Yeeeeeees great personal pizza "slices" baked to order. Check out the oven scum on the walls and enjoy their fair prices
author: Louie A.

description:
Alright so everyone was raving about the crust I decided to get the deepdish with some garlic bread.  I ordered online, and they came literally in 15 mins and im in the civic center.  So I was pretty Impressed.  The pizza when I got it was ok, when I first tasted it, I guess because I got filled up with the garlic bread which was very good.  kinda tasted like dominos except with a better crust.  But I guess like most pizzas are, it didn't come into its own until the next day, when I reheated it.  It was absolutely delicious.  So yeah I'm a fan,  
Pretty impress to find good pizza here, being originally from New York.  
Its not up to New York's level, but pretty damn close
author: Marc C.

description: They have great service! I come here all the time. Has to be the best pizza joint in SF that I've had so far!!!
author: Lana H.

description:
The spot if you want to get fresh slices and not just something sitting under a heat lamp. Slices take like 10-15 mins tho'...longer if its super busy. Two cigarette wait time for your slice...at least two. Each slice is made to order, not from a cheese pie but fresh dough etc. I usually get the margherita which is all I really need. Tasty, the crust could be thinner but that's a personal pref.

I don't know about the whole pies or delivery but I can vouch for the slices. If you're lucky you'll get a seat, maybe even a table outside if it's sunny, but usually...you're lurking next to other random strangers. #passtheoregano. Everytime I'm there when its a bit busy I always think about getting a cheesesteak across the street...but never do. I'd rather wait for my margherita.
author: Chris M.

description:
Salty as hell but also damn tasty. Seriously though, once you pay attention to how salty the sauce is it can get a little gross. I still go here fairly often. As other reviewers have stated, they make every slice to order so call ahead 10 mins early and you won't have to wait. $3.50 for a filling meal is tough to beat even in the Mission.

The best thing about the baked to order slices -- crust all around, yo!
author: Aaron V.

description:
This place simply serves good pizza! You can count on the same great taste and they even make individual slices. I'm talking, your own pizza slice made to order. I actually crave this pizza often, it's simply what you expect from a pizza! 

P.S. i am a vegan, so i get mine without cheese and it's still amazing!
author: Caitlin F.

description: I ordered a 12" Serrano's Pizza (has a lot of toppings) -- seemed a bit overpriced to me but *shrugs* if the pizza is good I don't really mind.   Unfortunately the pizza did not taste good at all.  There was barely any cheese on the pizza, this caused ALL the toppings to just plop off the slice when you picked it up.  The toppings also didn't have much taste to them, the sausage needed a bit more seasoning.  After the first slice the only thing I could do to keep eating was drowning it in hot sauce.
author: Billy V.

description:
Little hole in the wall pizza joint, you walk in expecting to pick a slice and go. But this is made-to-order, so if you're looking for something quick to soak up the booze you just had, this is not the place. 

$5.40 for a slice of the San Franciscan. It is a huuuuge slice, covered in cheesy meaty goodness. I'm usually starving or buzzed when I go here, so I can't say my foodie taste buds are at their best. But there really is no better time to eat then when you're starving or buzzed, right? Plus, it's great to watch them roll out the dough, and if you smile extra nice, they might just make that slice a little bigger.
author: Ai S.

description: Great pizza, not sure why all the hate as of late - the slices are pretty heavy - doughy for sure. If you're in the market for the thinner stuff this might not be the place for you. I'd check it out if you were as hungry as I was.
author: David T.

description: Pizza made by the slice so it takes a bit longer. I have found my new SF pizza place.
author: Aaron W.

description: This place is definitely my fav pizza in town. The calzones are amazing, I recommend the Prima.
author: Matthew P.

description: Wonderful PIZZA! Made to order. Their slices are HUGE! I will be visiting again for sure!
author: Shannon T.

description:
I was a little confused when I first walked in - slices were touted, but I didn't see any. That's because, as I quickly learned, they are made to order. Which meant I could get one loaded with veggies, chicken and a dusting of cheese fresh out of the oven.

My slice was excellent, and while you might think $5 is a lot for a slice, you won't once you see how insanely massive the slices are. Enough for a meal. Made your way.

It's one of my favorite pizza spots in the city.
author: Jason B.

description:
The pizza here is great. I go for pizza by the slice; freshly made just for you.
One slice is more like two slices stuck together.

The place is very small. With limited seating, most people walk in get their pizza and walk out.
I really like that I can call in my order before I go.

I'd suggest a slice with Pesto, Feta, and Onion.
author: Adam B.

description:
My friend and I had a hankering for pizza. We wanted something close by, so we yelped this place and decided to walk the block and a half to get there from her place.

1st Impression: OMG that smells SO GOOD! lol
2nd Impression: hm, little hole in the wall ay?
3rd Impression: Wait... I can get a salad, slice of pizza and drink for $5 something dollars...? Something has to be up.
4th impression: Not what I was expecting, probably the best pizza i've had in the city so far! And they pretty much give you 1/2 of a small pizza when they say "by the slice".

Mmmmmm still drooling just thinking about it.
author: Chaslin S.

description: I had ordered here before and it was pretty good. This was not. So very not. It's still cheap, but dang. Crust was doughy and tough. Sauce was bland. The olives tasted very... 'canny'.  Maybe they were old, or something. Won't order here again.
author: Chris M.

description: This place was a lucky stop-in. I've never noticed it before and I'm in and around the Mission everyday. Their individual slices are enormous and the style with eggplant and red onions was done just right.
author: Ryan A.

description:
3 dollars. 45 cents. Slice of pizza. Topped w/ grilled chicken.
Slice = the size of your chest. Chicken is actually grilled pieces of chicken, not tiny gram size shreds of chicken. Pizza = above average.

Win.

PS - I have never ordered a whole pizza here, but one slice will feed one hungry guy or serve as 2 meals for a girl.
author: Sean H.

description:
The pizza itself is pretty good - when they don't screw up your order. 

Simple case of good pizza, with the joint run by people who are pretty low on the intellectual horsepower meter.  Otherwise the ranking would be higher.  If they got people in there who were less stupid, it would be better for everyone.
author: Rolando P.

description:
And then there was Serrano's...

I feel hungry (which usually happens all the time) 

I pre-order a slice of pizza at one of my favorites.  Where they make a fresh slice just for you and me and the whole wide world. You'll find no pizza sitting under the heating lamp waiting to be eaten.  Less than 10 minutes later my mouth is watering and my stomach is thoroughly satisfied. 

I decided to give a gift to Serrano's.  I'm sure they'll appreciate just how much I appreciate them. I wrote a song inspired by  "Tina Turner". 

Here it is: 

'...Serrano's, you're simply the best...tun tun tun tun...better than all the rest...tun tun tun tun...better than any slice....and anything I've ever had...'

That's all I could come up with, sorry I know you crave more of my creativity.  I don't want to overwhelm you guys, really it's for the best.

'...tun tun tun tun....'
author: SammyWammy S.

description: Mediocre pizza.  Took almost TWO hours to deliver.  When I called the cashier had an attitude like I had the nerve to complain.  Enough said.
author: Patrick Z.

description: Frankly, tried this based on Yelp reviews.  Sadly, me thinks the other Yelpers were stoned. Pizza was almost tasteless & too salty. Will not order from here again.
author: Peter S.

description: I'm extremely disappointed the pizza I ordered did not live up to the hype of this place.  My 16" Vegetarian Pizza arrived 51 minutes after my order - room temperature, soggy, and stale.  It was devoid of flavor and the lack of sauce made it even more bland.  I will continue to support the small business, but I will not recommend this place to anyone nor will I order from here again until they improve the flavor and quality of their food.
author: CHAD C.

description:
One of the best places in the city for cheap pizza.  I'm a fan of ordering single slices for the following reasons:

1. CHEAP! A slice of cheese is under $3.
2. HUGE! The slice is gigantic and provides for a pretty filling snack.  The belly is always happy when I order a slice because it doesn't put me in a painful food coma, but a very comfortable one.
3. FRESH! Slices are not picked from already-made pizzas that are sitting out screaming for attention.  Instead, they make each slice fresh as it's ordered.  It is a site to behold.  What pizza place does that?  This place deserves a medal for doing that.
author: Jaime L.

description: Love it! Once again, been getting pizza here since I was a child. Absolute top choice: Greek Special..don't think I've ever tried anything else from there and can never bring myself to stray away from that choice :3
author: Montserrat S.

description:
Won't order from this place again.  The pizza took an hour and a half to get to us and then it was burnt.  By the time the pizza got here, our guests had already left and we had a large bad pizza we couldn't eat.

Unfortunately we ordered online and had to pre-pay the tip or else they won't have gotten one.
author: Geoffrey S.

description:
Me and my friends were looking for a place to grab dinner and we decided to try out Serrano's Pizza.  At first, I was hestitant based on the appearance..lol.  The place is super small with only 1 table and booth seating.  You can order a slice of pizza or a whole pie.

I decided to order a slice of sausage and mushroom pizza.  The server told me it will take 15 minutes.  I realized all the slices are made after they are ordered, which means they are really fresh!

When the slice came out, it was super huge.  There was a lot of crust on all 3 sides!  I love crust, so I was really happy about that.  The pizza was not greasy, and it only cost $4!

Minus one star for not having a lot of tables for people to enjoy their pizza.
author: Rita V.

description:
OMG! The best pizza I've had in years since NYC!

A must visit if you go to the bay area and you like pizza. Their pizza slice is two slices in one, pre-cut. I think the slice was only $3.50 and I only can consider that a steal of a deal. They also have these signature slices that look BOMBBASTIC. If I had two stomachs I'd go for 3 slices.

Ordered the sausage and cheese...the cheese perfectly thick, the sauce yummy, and the sausage was a 10 on taste! While I was there I was thinking, "I wished I could FedEx their pie to me in LA." I didn't dare to ask. My second thought was I could imagine myself turning into a fat guy if I lived in SF anywhere near this place.
author: Derek G.

description: My old reliable. When I'm not in the mood/too lazy to cook/craving a slice/every other day I order from Serrano's. Rock steady slice pizza made to order.
author: Nick F.

description: I have never been in here (maybe it's different when ya order in?) but my sister has and highly recommended we order from Serranos last night. We were all very disappointed to say the least. The pizzas were on time and delivered by a very friendly guy. The pizzas however were VERY SALTY had THICK BURNT CRUST and topped with the CHEWiest of CHEESES. Nothing flowed together. Every layer was on it's own and they were all struggling. I was seriously trying to break the cheese down in my mouth until my jaws hurt. There was no love put into our pies yo. I love supporting local business but this aint the ticket.
author: Beaky L.

description: 1 star only because it's actually pretty good food and cheap. But the customer service, or whoever answers the phone, needs to get fired or learn how to speak to customers. Coming from someone who works in the industry when you answer a call you should say thank you for calling Serrano's Pizza how can I help you, and introduce yourself as well. Every single time one of my friends or co workers have called their today on 07/05/14 The girl answers the phone and says "Hello" with a rude attitude. I'm sorry but customer service is HUGE if you want to keep your business going.
author: Amber M.

description: Absolutely delicious, best pizza I've had, hands down. They make any type of pizza by the slice, they are huge, and the best combination of chewy/ crunchy dough.
author: Maya S.

description:
Late night pizza to the rescue!

The other night after being convicted of attempted murder of my liver, we thought it best to order a pizza to soak of some of the evidence. I looked all over Yelp for late night deliveries in the area and this place popped up. At first I attempted to order through the automated system, but with only about 3 minutes to go before they closed, my friend suggested I just call them. He's smert.

And so I dialed and received the following sad news, "Oh sorry, we aren't delivering any more tonight. We are closed." 

To which I pleaded, "But there's still 2 minutes...."

Pause. "Okay, I'll deliver it to you on my way home :)"

Yaaaay! That alone is worth the 5-stars, but the pizza was super tasty and the bacon salad was yummy too. Even noshing on the sweet remains of the cold pizza as I type this today, it's still deelish!

Good job, Serrano's! You made a definite fan out of me!
author: Stephy S.

description:
I've been getting Serrano's Pizza by delivery lately, so I'm not sure what it's like to eat inside. But it's fantastic. I haven't ordered a pizza I didn't like from here yet. Best hang-over day: Serrano's Pizza and movies/Buffy. Yay! But I don't have to be hung over to enjoy a nice slice.
Also the "deep dish" with the cheese stuffed crust? amazing! I'm glad we don't order it all the time anymore. Sometimes, it's too much cheese. For me. Other times, it's all I want.
author: Nicole G.

description:
5 stars because this pizzaria makes every slice from scratch. The slices are actually made from a triangular pizza dough, is quite huge and is cut in half. They also have a great selection of pizza toppings and the prices are from $3-7 per slice.  I'm a big eater and one slice is almost too much for me to eat, but I do it anyway.

I love white pizza with no sauce, just ricotta and mozzarella cheese (add American bacon for an extra tastiness). This isn't on the menu, but they will make if for me for just $3.50!!! They have no problems with building any type of pizza that you can dream up! Another pizza topping that I want to try is Iinguica (portuguese sausage). I'll update later.

Unfortunately, the pesto pizza is no good because the pesto doesn't have much flavor. Avoid!!!

They do take-out and the wait is about 10 minutes per slice on a normal night.  They also do full pizzas and it seems like I've seen delivery guys coming and going. If you are dining in, then good luck getting a seat during busy hours because there are only 8 or 9 seat inside and maybe 6 outside.
author: Rex D.

description: Wow all I can say is I'm very very disappointed. I always order pizza from serranos but today we did delivery and it was very burnt this would not have been a big deal if the Asian lady was even remotely nice about it but she was NOT. We already waited one hour now she's saying don't eat it and wait one more hour for another one. I then demanded I wasn't going to wait two hours to eat she then passed me on to another lady who finally decided to refund my money. Usually great pizza but HORRIBLE customer service. Never going back!!! They lost a faithful customer forever. Wish I could have recorded the conversation to replay for the owner
author: Keri S.

description:
Maybe I'm an East Coast pizza snob, but this pizza struggles to be just average. 

It arrived on time but  had likely not been hot for about 20 minutes.
author: Susie W.

description:
Just had a slice from here and to my pleasant surprise it wasn't premade and reheated. When I saw the cook pull out a huge slice of raw dough and add my toppings, I was happy to wait the extra few minutes for the freshness.
The crust was crispy, sauce was tasty, and toppings were plentiful.  I would order takeout again as I saw some yummy options on the menu.  This is the best place for a slice and the great part is one slice is so ginormous I can have the other half for lunch tomorrow.  That's only $2 for lunch!
author: anne m.

description:
Love the pizza - delicious! Especially the pesto sauce.

Disappointed to find my full credit card number, expiration date AND security code handwritten on the order form and my full credit card number and expiration date printed on the receipt. The beginning numbers weren't blocked out like most businesses do these days. Thank goodness I checked before composting the box and shredded it instead.

Needs greater security of my financial information!
author: C M.

description:
Serrano's revived my hope for good crust in San Francisco. While I'm California born and love our focus on fresh ingredients and carefully composed flavor palettes (which Serrano's does just enough of), I've been to New York enough to know good pizza dough when I bite into it: Serrano's has good crust. Best part is the fact that each "slice" is actually a pizzette, a triangular pie cut in half; this gives you two edges of tasty crust with every slice! Love it!

Edit October/2010: five stars. Just used them to deliver for a graduate student mixer --- on time, still crunchy crusts, piping hot and amazingly good. PERFECT.
author: Jay A.

description: Best pizza in the area. Always reliable by the slice. Strongly recommend against buying whole pizzas - it inexplicably becomes like freezer pizza.
author: Jerry Z.

description: Lunch speacials!! Pizza, salad and a drink.
author: Silvia R.

description: A couple days ago I got a delivery of the Mission Pizza which has onions, pineapple and jalapenos.  It was incredibly delicious.  I'll get this pizza again and I will order from here again.  5 stars, no question.  I am glad I found another good pizza place because I am pretty picky.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
Well it took an hour and a half.. it's Saturday so I wasn't too upset over that. The estimate was 30 minutes to an hour though.

Spaghetti was edible. I've had better sauce from a can at Safeway though. Not exaggerating on this either.. I don't even like Safeway so that's saying alot.

The green ravioli has the spinach on the outside of the ravioli, it looks gross. I wouldn't be so annoyed with that if it weren't for the fact that it was horribly dry and almost inedible. I could very easily boil something from a frozen bag and it would be better. ;/

Calzone.. was decent. Not good, but not disgusting. 

Side salad was my favorite thing here and it was literally lettuce, cheese, tomatoes, a few olives and a side of dressing. 

They forgot the cheesecake I ordered. Support at eat247 said they would have it taken off my bill. Still annoying though.

I would not order from them again.

This place makes me think of some college students heating up frozen crap in bulk and delivering it.. posing as a real restaurant. 

Yuckers I hope I don't get sick.
author: Amber F.

description: We stopped in here after our commute home from the city wanting a pizza to take home and enjoy. I'm so glad we stopped in this no-nonsense pizza joint. The owner quickly realized we were new to the place and made fun recommendations when we asked what his favorite was. He told us on Tuesday it was one pizza but on Friday it was another, but for me it would be the California. Haha! We got half Hawaiian and half California. Yum! The crust was thick and delicious while still being crispy on the bottom. We enjoyed it for several nights! Thanks Serrano!
author: Emily S.

description: Inconsistent service, delivery policy, food.  Don't waste your time.
author: Andrew S.

description:
This is absolutely the best pizza in SF. Hands down.
Thin crust. Lotsa cheese. 
It smells like NY!

The best.
author: Claudia B.

description:
Curses. I am so grossed out by an Escape From New York pizza opening a block from Serrano's, I have to write this review.

Serrano's is fresh and fabulous. The sausage here is good (always a good indicator for pizza), the crust is tasty and the perfect consistency, the sauce here is wonderful... I've eaten here a zillion times. We usually order to pick up. I haven't noticed a particularly long wait when I ordered it to my house when I am too lazy to walk the two blocks. But whatever. I'll wait. The pizza here is really, really good. It's not gourmet. That's fine with me. Gourmet pizza kinda irritates me. Serrano's pizza is the real deal. I never cared at all it was the only pizza place in the hood, and I really dig pizza. Serrano's was enough.

Escape From New York... GAWD! Why are you doing this to me??? I'm not surprised you moved next to ultra-hipster cafe on 22nd street which I also never go to  -  now that whole block is a disaster.

I'm a fairly PC chick, but if some chain has amazing product, hell, I'll patronize it. I buy my bras at Macy's. I saw Zombieland at the Metreon... but when a chain is *awful* like EFNY, and it's messing with a neighborhood gem like Serrano's, I truly cringe.

Please, my friends, order from Serrano's... you won't be disappointed.
author: Dusty R.

description:
Yep. Still a fan. I've been ordering stuff to our SOMA office via eat24hours.com. Just tried the grilled chicken and veggie pasta. It's as good as everything else I've had.

Still think the Calzones are the absolute best. Try the Pepperoni and Mushroom combo calzone or a Mushroom and Artichoke hearts!
author: thrasher b.

description: BEST PIZZA IN SF.  Hands down.  Just drink lots of water afterwards, as there's a fair amount of salt.  SO YUMMY GOOD though!!
author: eric i.

description:
My honeymoon with Serrano's is long since over, and I've been let down since then, but now that roller coaster ride has ended, things have stabilized.

I can safely say that I think Serrano's is A-OK; still a pretty good pizza place, still far from perfect.
author: Alan F.

description:
Serrano's, a reoccurring anecdote.  It is late at night.  You are tired and hungry.  You have spent way too much money in the last few days.  You have no interest in leaving your house or initiating any sort of reasonable human contact.  Open phone, select "Serrano's Pizza" and hit the green button.


Yes, it will only be slightly above mediocre.  Yes, you will have to repeat numbers several times.  Yes, it will take an hour.  But you didn't have to go anywhere.  And that's what counts.
author: Chris C.

description: I had to give them my order twice and they still got it wrong.  Pizza arrived on time, in an hour from when they said and it was good til the next day when we finished it.  I prefer a much saucier pizza tho.  Even though food was ok, there's enough pizza places out there though where i can get a pie from someone else and will.
author: Jo A.

description:
Update - yes... delivery is not always fast.  
But the pizza remains excellent.
author: Tim T.

description: I came here one day after school, starving and hungry for some good pizza, hoping a slice would do the job, but found out it was more than enough. I ordered a slice of the San Franciscan. The wait was about 10 minutes. The slice was huge and it was delicious. The combination of melty cheese, pepperoni, juicy italian sausage, mushrooms, and bell peppers, so good.. They have a variety of different pizza specials and you can also customize your own.
author: Nelson G.

description: so... First time I ordered.. they took like an hour and a half.. no big deal i guess.. when i get the order, it was incorrect. It then took another hour to deliver the wings they forgot... i thought hey.. mistakes happen.. and the pizza was OK.. so give them another try. I ordered. no issues.. THEN I checked my bank account. They charged me for the order, THEN 2 days later they charged me a 2nd time. I will NOT, i repeat WILL NOT order from them again. To much of a hassle  for pizza that is just OK.
author: Alonso C.

description: Salty, doughy, grody. This is at the bottom of the pile of SF pizza places that deliver. Not the bottom-bottom, but the bottom of the list of edible pizzas.
author: Larf P.

description: Best pizza delivery in the city hands down! The pizza has never been soggy, or cold upon delivery. The crust is that perfect balance between doughy and crispy. You feel like you're getting a great deal for the price. I love them and their ooey gooey cheesiness. Only thing I can say in the negative is to not expect a lot from their salads. They are very basic, nothin special, and you'll forget to eat it because you'll be full of delicious pizza.
author: Miquela S.

description:
Though I've never stepped foot in the place (hi, delivery!) to observe how they make the pizza, Serrano's mixes some type of magical crack into their dough, I swear. 

It's the pizza you always crave and never get... well, until now.
author: Carla C.

description: Went to this place because of the good yelp reviews, but what a mistake.  I was greeted by a miserable employee with a bad attitude, and I was one of the first customers of the day!  The pizza was salty and bad, and I'm not a hard to please person.  Disappointing choice.  Parking in that area is horrible too.
author: Tate B.

description: I have added a slice with rosted red peppers and black olives to my mix.  I generally alternate between that and one with pepperoni and black olives.  The Cookie Monster girl has yet to return.  Regret is still a bitch.
author: Michael C.

description:
I eat here at least twice a week.

Best dishes:
Cheese it's only 2.75
Cheese calzone 4 bucks

The delivery dude wears a leather jacket!
author: Natalie M.

description: Avoid these guys. 2.5 hours and still waiting to deliver a calzone. Called the restaurant and they kept me holding. Why taking orders of you can't deliver them??
author: Marcelo P.

description: I ordered a couple pizzas from here for delivery and was not impressed at all. I went back however, on a recommendation from a friend and got the lunch special, which comes with a really big piece of pizza, a salad and a can of soda for like 8 bucks. It's an incredible deal and tasted much better fresh out of the oven.
author: Shara M.

description: Just fine.  A bit bland in flavor and the crust is not great, but decent and well-priced.  Also, reliable delivery and good service.
author: Jenn S.

description:
I am giving this a 3 star and not a 2 /c they do late night delivery.
I was not super excited with the Hawaiian Pizza i ordered. Lady on the phone was rude and the pizza tasted ok. Nothing i would want to eat the next day as leftover pizza (which i love!).. 

I will not be ordering from them again.. it was really not good!

Will i eat it for breakfast? probably, ..with my eyes closed!...and maybe only one small slice..why? b/c i have not grocery shopped yet!!...eww, looking at this pizza right now and i cant eat it!.....trash...
=(...
author: C A.

description: The worst customer service. I waited on the phone for 10 minutes for them to tell me they won't deliver to us? The city is 6 miles across and they won't do it? Missed out on major profit for a lot of businesses down here.
author: Megan C.

description: Never been here.  I would have loved to check out a neighborhood pizza restaurant; but they littered my neighborhood with paper fliers.  They didn't even put them in mail slots or by doors, they just dropped them on front steps, which instantly got blown away and littered dozens of fliers all over the streets in Bernal.  I would never go to a restaurant that disrespects the neighborhoods that they serve.
author: Jerry W.

description: Very good pizza-by-the-slice in the city--second best in the Mission; Arizmendi being the first.  AND for being able to order exactly what I want to eat on my slices, 15 minutes is not too long to wait, methinks.  Their eggplant + feta = what I get every. time.
author: X-topher B.

description: I order from here like three times a week and it's always good. Way better then dominos, pizza hut and most other pizza deliveries
author: Mikee C.

description:
If you are new to Mission or SF area, this is by far the best pizza-by-the-slice place. They prepare and bake your order fresh into a piping hot slice with thin crust.

My two favorites are 1) the Chef's Special, made with a combo of grilled chicken, green onions, tomatoes, feta cheese, and oregano and 2) the Pesto Delight, made with pesto sauce covered in spinach, sun-dried tomatoes, feta cheese and broccoli.

Pluses:
+ Ji-gantic slice for the money.  One is enough.
+ Friendly and courteous staff.
+ Good selection of toppings.  Many vegetarian combinations available.
+ Calzones, garlic bread w/ cheese, and salads are great too.
+ Takes credit cards w/ $5 minimum.
 
Minuses:
- Long line.
- Hard to find parking. 
- Seats about 6 to 8 people.  Mainly a take-out or a delivery joint.
- Weekend deliveries may take one hour or more.

Tips:
* Try the combo: salad, slice, and a drink about $7.
* Call ahead for a whole pizza.  20 to 30 minutes for a pick-up.  
* Don't tell them that their pizza tastes better than Domino's, cuz they will chuckle, but will be insulted.
* Buy a whole pizza for the next day, just in case you didn't have enough.  You won't regret it, especially for those pizza lovers, who enjoy cold slices just as much.
author: CT L.

description:
DO YOU CRAVE SALT?

Do you get Margaritas just to lick the edge?

When you have coffee, do you forgo the sugar and creamer, and just reach for a canister of Morton's Salt instead?

When you go to the beach, does it occur to your to dip a glass in the ocean and chug it down -- and not just for the nutritive value of yummy plankton?

When you have pizza, do you think, "You know, instead of plain old tomato sauce, I'd really like something that looks the same but actually tastes like liquefied kalamata olives?"

Then Serrano's is the place for you.  

Yes, the individual slices are cheap and massive -- and for some reason, longitudinally pre-perforated.  But they are greasy, floppy, and completely saline -- sauce, cheese, and crust included.

So if you're overhydrated or just ran a marathon, come on over.  Otherwise save it for when you need to sop up some alcohol after a late night bender.
author: Daniel S.

description:
I'm really giving this place more like a 3.5 instead of a plain ol' 3, I'll explain. I'm not really an authority on pizza, I'll admit most of the pizza I've had falls into the middle range of good but not amazing or something I'd crave. To give you an idea my two favorite pizza places are pretty much opposites: Di Fara Pizzeria in Brooklyn and Papa John's. That's right a New York classic eatery and a chain make the best pizzas I've ever tasted. 

That said I appreciate the fact that Serrano's has a wide variety of toppings (hence the extra .5). I specifically craved basil on my pizza and searched high and low until I found a restaurant that offered it (you'd be surprised how many don't). They also offer ricotta cheese so my pizza contained both. Pretty yummy but my issue with most pizza is how salty it is. I'll admit I think I've developed a heightened sensitivity to salt. Better than Papa John's? Not quite but you might think Serrano's mighty fine.
author: Sharifa R.

description:
Serrano's is the best pizza, ever.

If I still lived in the city it would be the only pizza I eat (it was last year when I lived in the Mission).

TO THE NAY-SAYERS:
------------------------------
1. If you don't like waiting for the delivery, JUST GO THERE AND ORDER -or- call it in in advance and just PICK IT UP!

(If you know it takes long for them to make even 1 slice practically from scratch, delivery probably isn't the best bet!)

2. Service can be rude anywhere! The main people who take your order at the counter are very nice, though. Don't rate the whole place super low if one person was rude to you (some pee-on at that!).

SERRANO'S AWESOMENESS:
-----------------------------------------
1. Each slice MADE-TO-ORDER so it's FRESH!

2. Each slice is DELISH & rocks my socks off, completely.

3. Very fair prices for how good the food is and how much you get!

4. Nice place, nice people, etc.

5. Wide VARITY of toppings and unique pizza creations!

6. OPEN reeeeeeeeeeally late :)

NEED I SAY MORE?

******THIS PLACE DESERVES 5 STARS!!!!!!********
author: Kai S.

description:
This is our pizza delivery place.  Number programed into all our phones, etc.  The conversation isn't "where are we getting pizza from" but rather "what do we want on from Serrano's?"  The pizza is simply awesome.

There are, however, some things you should know:

Serrano's mystical pizza making process takes gabillion hours.  They must chant and sing or something.  Delivery takes about an hour.  Sometimes they'll be "fast" and get here in 45.

Their deep dish pizza has cheese in the crust.  This is awesome.  

Their deep dish pizza comes uncut.  Apparently this is done to keep the cheese from melting out all over the box.  If you - like us - don't own a pizza cutter you can tell them to pre-cut it for you.  A warning: this is an argument.  They really think it is better uncut.

It is absolutely impossible to park near the store.  Give up and order delivery instead. Delivery is reliable, our orders have always been correct, and the drivers can figure out complicated locations.  Just remember, it takes FOREVER.  But the pizza is worth it.

Writing this review is making me salivate.  I think I know what is for dinner.
author: Dee B.

description:
"I like Serrano's better and better every time I eat there." says Zac.

Well let me be the counterpoint , I've eaten pizza from there twice and found it more disgusting each time.  The "slice" isn't really a slice but an entire new pizza shaped roughly like a triangle.  Since it is no true slice, it takes forever as they have to make it from scratch, though i don't know why they bother since giving me a triangle shaped piece of cardboard would be sufficient....instead it just burns my tongue.  Maybe its like how muffin tops only taste good if you rip them off a muffin, so a slice only tastes good if its a true slice not some fake slice shaped whole pizza....Nah it just sucks.

The only way i will go back for a third time is if i'm really in a bind...  Like... maybe i'm walking home one night, and a group of robbers hold me up at knife and gun point.  They demand that i give them my wallet, and jacket and shoes.  Then they are particularly cruel and say give me your pants and your underwear too.  I say please sirs you already have my money, leave me some dignity.  Nay they say.  But we will leave you your socks.  Gee thanks (just socks is only the most unflattering look for a naked man).  In this desperate situation, i just may walk into Serrano's and ask them if they can give me one of those large brown bags they use for their tasteless pizza so that i may cover my junk and wait for the police.

down below yelp asks me to check a checkbox for what Serrano's is "good for:"

where is the checkbox that says "nothing (except for place to call police after being robbed)"
author: Irvin S.

description:
i've been eating serrano's for years, both delivery and in the restaurant itself. they've always been a solid, reliable, and hearty slice... up until tonight.
 
 i placed an order on-line with them just prior to 4:30 p.m. my confirmation e-mail said they'd deliver in an hour. then it's on to the waiting game. i waited until 5:45 p.m. to call and figure out where my food was. the woman on the phone had no customer services skills whatsoever, and made me feel like i had done something wrong.

 i work in a restaurant myself, and i know how difficult and demanding it can be. but, the key is, even when you're running behind, be polite, apologize, and offer a discount, refund, or credit for future purposes. if you're going to hire someone to answer your phones, take orders, and handle delivery questions, please train them, or retrain to ensure your customers are getting top-notch service. an occasional please, thank you, or sorry goes a long way. we understand you get busy, but remember it will always be in your favor to be courteous. 

 she told me, "the driver left a while ago, and he'll be there any minute."

 twenty minutes later, the doorbell. 

 my pizza was cold.

 i asked the driver why it took and hour and a half and after a minute, he called his boss to have him explain. his boss, cliff, said they were "very busy tonight, and only had one driver. also, there was a ball game."

 ha! that's really funny, because i watched both the 49ers and raiders game, and they had both ended prior to the time i placed my order. it was really a poor excuse. he offered to refund half of my order, so i was handed $8 cash. thanks for the nod, but at that point, i was hungry, and my food was cold.

 normally serrano's is a 4-5 star experience, but today sucked.
author: Andy P.

description:
Let me start with this:  best calzone i've ever had.  no doubt. 

The wait, however, is unbearable.  seriously.  way longer than 10 minutes, as others say here.  

Lesson:  Order ahead, and come here only when you have the time to wait, or wait for delivery.  The food is outstanding, so the wait is well worth it.  

But, if you live in the neighborhood and are out on the street and start thinking, hey, I'm hungry as hell. Right now. Serrano's loses a star because it is not where you should go.  

For that, you go to Escape from New York, which by the way, has incredible pizza, too.  And fast.
author: Michael H.

description: Good if you like marinara sauce on cardboard with slimy cheese to top it all off...
author: Lee L.

description: Great slice of pizza. The family split a great tasting slice of cheese pizza.  It was fresh and it was a nice Sunday afternoon place to grab a bite to eat.  I liked that the canned sodas were only a buck.  I'd definitely come back to try a whole pizza.
author: Augustine W.

description:
If I order pizza, I order it from Serrano's.  Why?

1. Very decent pizza.  Quality toppings, decent crust, good selection of toppings.

2. Very prompt.  They may not get there in 30 minutes, but they WILL get there when they SAY they will get there.  Consistency and predictability: these are a few of my favorite things!

3. Reasonable price.

Listen, even -I- can't eat steak EVERY night.  Try though I might.  And I do try.  But when it's pizza time, this is my pizza place.

The End
author: Ben P.

description:
I'm always in search of good pizza, which is really hard to find in SF.  Well to be more accurate, I look for good NY pizza, a pretty rare commodity.  Arinell is by far the best so far, but...  Serrano's slices are *huuuge*!

The first time I walked in, I ordered two slices being the naive first time visitor of the place.  Ten minutes later, I get a pizza box with slices that equate to a half-pie in NY.  Maybe I'm exaggerating slightly, but damn their slices are big!

I'm proud to say that I'm no longer a newbie.  I now get a single mushroom slice for $3.40, which has now become my ritual every time I do laundry on 20th and Van Ness.  What a dinner deal huh?

OK, so apart from the size benefit, how's the quality?  It's better than average.  Serrano's pizza may not fully cater to my particular taste, but I won't deny that it has character.  Their sauce or cheese, one of the two, is a tad too salty, but they serve it on a nicely toasted thin crust dough, which is what I love.

Overall, I'd say try it!  They're open late, till midnight.  Their slices are huge (remember... one slice, not two).  For what you get, it's cheap.  It's thin crust.  You don't really have much reason not to try it...
author: Daniels L.

description:
After getting our cuban salsa on at Dance Mission on 24th we walked over here to make up for all the calories we lost.  Tiny little spot with a wonderous menu board to decide on how you want ur triangle of love served up.

WARNING!  WARNING!  The slices are jurassic!(as in BIG not old--thx Eric!!!)  To be exact, every slice is freshly made from scratch after you order.  

One will do for ya just fine. I didn't realize this b4 ordering and ended up only having a bite of the second flavor--serrano special-- which i ordered with the corn and onion combo...YES!!!  Sounds too simple and a bit odd, but whoa nilly it is tantalizingly sexy as a greasy pizza can get.  

So yum!!!!  This place kicks major ass over Mythic, Nizario's and Seniore's
author: omar b.

description: The only real downside was the wait, but I wasn't in much of a rush so I did not mind. Very cheap, but very good.
author: Kendall F.

description:
So since I ordered pizza so early (before midnight!) the other night at work, I had many many many more options than I normally do.  So for the first time in my life I allowed a place's average Yelp rating to make my decision for me, and I got Serrano's.

I was initially a little wary about this place.  I don't know why.  Actually, it was because I couldn't order online and because the website was so preschooly.

But when the pizza came, it was delicious.  The ingredients were fresh; there was just the right amount of cheese, and the crust was perfect.  I know the next pizza I get from this place won't be as good, but that's OK.  As long as it's anywhere near what this pizza was, I'll be OK with it.  Oh, and it tasted even better cold, which is the true test of any pizza.
author: John S.

description:
I went in this weekend for a slice. at Serrano's they don't dress up a slice from a pre made pizza to your specifications they make you an individual slice from scratch. They take a piece of dough and smoosh it into a triangle and make you an individual small triangle pizza. You might think that sounds good but YOU"D BE WRONG!!! Serrano's whole pizzas can't be beaten but those individual slices don't bake right. They push the dough too thin and try to compensate by over cooking it so that your slice won't collapse before you get it too your mouth. The crust comes out hard and gritty. Also instead of cheese covering the slice they put it in little globs, I assume to keep it from running off the pizza during baking since there is no real crust. The slices are thoroughly unpleasant.

Take my advice, order a whole Pizza and avoid the slices.
author: Manny F.

description:
Totally, absurdly delicious. My fingers are somewhat slippery at the moment because I'm currently devouring a slice.

Serrano's is unique because each 'slice' is actually baked from scratch. You tell them exactly what you want and they throw on all the toppings on a slice-shaped piece of dough, and bake it right then and there. It takes a little time -- about 7-10 mins -- but is amazingly fresh and yummy. Even the mixed green salad is crisp and tasty with actual romaine and yummy Italian dressing; no wimpy iceberg lettuce here! 

One word of caution: make sure to note their closing times. I've been turned away twice for showing up 5 minutes too late... They stop taking orders for their slices about 20-30 mins before they close since they take the baking time into account. Nothing sucks like showing up with a buzz, craving a delicious slice of crispy, greasy pizza and being denied. Ahhh... the horror!

All in all, though, a great choice. Take that, pre-baked slimy, soggy reheated slices!
author: Jill M.

description:
Very erratic delivery and quality. Perfectly pleasant if everything goes well, very rude if they make mistakes.

Don't get me wrong, when Serrano's gets it right, the pizza isn't just good it's fantastic, especially for pesto-lovers like myself.

The problem with Serrano's: they mess up the order about a third to half the time. Wrong toppings, delivery times over an hour (of cold pizza), forgetting things like "please include crushed red pepper." 

The last time I ordered from Serrano's, I didn't even GET a pizza. 

After an hour and a half I called in to ask when I could expect the pizza: The man on the phone told me that the driver had already been by and attempted to "knock on my door" and to call me, but nobody was home. I said nobody had rung my buzzer and nobody had called, and he informed me I had given him the wrong callback number (I had not, gave my home landline) and that nobody had been home. I was very much at home, hungry and waiting for PIZZA before I went out that night.

I asked when I could expect the pizza, he said "I have no idea, the driver already came by." I said I would like to cancel the order and he said "the pizza will get there when it gets there, you gave the wrong number." I told him I did not, and that I needed to cancel the order because I had to leave my apartment. He said "fine, we'll cancel," and abruptly hung up on me.

My advice: If you're hungry and want good pizza delivered, go elsewhere.It's just not worth dealing with these guys on the off chance you could get a great pizza. Maybe take-out works better?
author: David M.

description:
When a friend visited from out of town we headed to Serrano's for lunch. Somewhat surprised at how expensive "a slice" was, about 5 bucks each, we were starving so we each plopped down for 2 slices each. Oops. 

About 10 minutes after we ordered, during which time they made the slices fresh, one of the pizza dudes brought out our food, a massive contiguous piece of pizza that covered an entire standard paper plate. 

I was about to say something, "We only ordered ONE slice of these pizzas, not two." 

But he quickly disappeared into the joint before popping right out again with another fully loaded plate of pizza. We sat there marveling at the sheer volume of pie sitting before us. Then dug in. 

I had the San Franciscan (pepperoni, sausage, mushrooms, bell pepper) and Clam bake (clams, garlic, onions). My buddy and I looked up and nodded at each other: this is great pizza. Fresh out the oven, crispy crust, just enough sauce, tasty (and novel) toppings. Delicious.

As good as the pie was I could have finished it all, but good sense kicked in. Happy, but debilitating food coma? Pass. But we were both left with what amounted to a SSU (Serrano Slice Unit) each, and were about to go trekking about the Mission.

Leon, the affable fellow behind the counter was a great help. "No sweat, just leave your take out boxes here, we can hold on to them and keep them warm for you on top of the oven until you come back." Very cool.
author: dave y.

description:
