The first night I moved to San Francisco, I ate at Serrano's.  It was about 9:30pm, my roadtrip friends and I had awoken that day in Salt Lake City and we were starving.  One of my buddies knew about this place from a previous tour through the city with his band.  

We order
-we wait (fresh baked slices)
-the guy at the counter gets in an argument with a male customer
-the counter guy appears to win the argument, male customer retreats
-male customer's girlfriend enters the fray
-male customer's girlfriend goes APE SHIT on counter guy
-male customer and girlfriend eventually leave
-male customer returns shortly (alone), orders a slice and sits down to wait
MORAL OF STORY: Serrano's pizza is worth more than your girlfriend 

All that said, the slices are huge and delicious.  They are all baked to order (on a slice shaped piece of dough) so you get a fresh slice no matter what time.  The pizza is NOT New York Style, it is NOT Chicago Style, in fact, I don't know what "style" it is.  Let's just say it's Serrano's Style, it's good, and leave it at that.
author: Garrett C.

description:
What is that?!?!?!?!?!?  

That's a slice of pizza?!?!?!?!?

This gigantic thing??!?!?!??!!!

This is one slice of pizza???!!!???

Holy crap!!!  I shouldn't have ordered two!!!!
______________________________________

I am not sure what the pie that can produce such a slice looks like.  But, the slices at Serrano's are huge!  And no matter what your appetite you likely only need one.  Served up super hot & quite tasty!

Damn!!  I can't believe it look me four and half years of living here to finally try this place.  My mistake!
author: Jeff P.

description:
THE  B E S T PEPPERONI PIZZA I have ever had in my life.  Their customer service is okay, I sometimes feel like they don't know i'm there.  I gota make a slight motion to get any kind of service sometimes.  That's okay though, they are usually in the back making pizza... the way the building is configured doesnt allow them to be making pizza, AND looking at the front coutner at the same time.  

WHATEVER.  The quality in the pizza and exceptional price, not to mention convinient, yet hidden-jem, location more than make up for a SLIGHT lack in Customer service.  

Best Pizza in San Francisco!
author: Donato J.

description:
Ok haters of Serrano's need to recognize!

I have lived in the mission for 3 years now and this place rules. A fresh slice of pizza is only a short phone call/ 15 minute wait away and it's big enough to feed you twice!

Would it be nice if they had fresh pineapple? Sure! But The pepperoni, lingucia, sausage slice is my best friend and you won't find anything better to clog your arteries in the mission.
author: Ben A.

description:
My co-worker and I have eaten at Serrano's many times. They make their pizza fresh everytime and they are always delicious. I have yet to come accross a problem with their food or service. Can' really say too much more. I'll let their score do the explaining. 

=)
author: Michael M.

description: Every time I order here they get my order wrong.  I ordered the exact same thing 5 times.  Each time I got something different.  Each time they charged me for more than a slice with one topping (my order).  Every. Single. Time.  The slices are big; every key ingredient (sauce, cheese, crust) compares but is not equal to competition in the neighborhood.  If they could get an order right....but no.  Too bad.  Still a large decent slice served up hot.  If you can handle random ingredients and a random price, and you're drunk, you'll be fine here.
author: Leon R.

description:
Serrano's has become a Friday night tradition (well not really every 58 Fridays in a year because then I'd have to rely on a forklift as my own public transportation.) Yeah I'm having it tonight...the art and tom terrific, but I wanted the Greek! The Greek pizza is the best tasting, pesto, canadian bacon, caramelized onions(yumm), and feta cheese! Once I had the greek pizza 3 nights in a week, see it really is as good!  I've also had the greek pizza deep dish, wasn't as good as I expected since the mozarella took over the feta cheese and the feta is the star of this pizza.  It also depends on who makes the greek pizza (order it at night.)   Some of the sauces are tangy especially the hawaiian and dolores pizza. I have yet to try the calzones..maybe next Friday?

03/29/2007: The four cheese pizza was delicious, the dough was perfect!
author: Glu C.

description:
Serrano's Pizza is not THE best in town, but it's very good. Great prices. Good portions. 

Order your pizza and seat outside to people watch: A) on a nice/warm Mission night (not a year round event). B) You are hammered. C) Shared a brownie with some random Irish guy at the Phone Booth and you are super stoned (what? it happens to all of us! right?).
author: Anabelle B.

description: Consistently good pizza, calzones, and salad.  Great deal for a fresh made HUGE pizza slice too.  And always very friendly customer service.  It's out go to pizza place.
author: Jennifer N.

description: Excellent pizza and the slices are giant. I've tried some of the other hyped pizza joints and they have nothing on Serrano's.
author: Bob A.

description: Definitely my favorite pizza spot to hit up in the city, let alone the Mission. Great toppings and variety of combo. specials. I love their lunch special that runs from 11-6 for $6; you get a slice of pizza, soda, and a small salad with a dressing of your choice. LOVE! If you're in the area, grab a bite cause you will NOT be dissatisfied.
author: Nancy R.

description:
Unspeakably bad.

But, to save you from eating there, I will speak about it.  I ordered the deep dish, which wasn't - it's more of a wide crust situation, with about 1/3 of the surface area of my pie being bread.  That's OK, because the actual pizza part was so bad.  Mild cheddar cheese (or perhaps it's american cheese?)on a pizza?  Huh? It really doesn't work, by the way.  And beyond greasy - I mean, I LIKE pizza, and it needs a certain grease quotient to be super cheesy melty good, I get it.  But this was just gross.  As in the bottom of the box made a squelching noise when i set it on the table gross.  The crust underneath the sauce and toppings was pale, floppy and glistening like a freshly beached sea creature.  Finally, the sauce and toppings (sausage and mushroom) were hugely over-salted and with that special tang only preservatives impart. 

I have never until today come home, looked in the fridge, seen a pizza box, and sighed in dismay at the thought of eating what's inside.  I wrote this review in the hope that my dismal fate doesn't become yours as well.
author: Jordan J.

description:
Fuck it, let's go to Serrono's.  I find myself saying that even though I live in burlingame.  It's cheap and you get the biggest weirdest shaped slice ever.  The pizza isn't gonna knock you outta your seat but the price is right and I'd say  it's a solid 7.  I've you're ever around valencia and 21st and are a cheap asshole stop in.

This is another one of those pizza joints owned by Brazilians and they have a HUGE menu of other stuff that I have yet to see anyone order from.
author: Boiled H.

description:
I'll admit it: I'm from New Jersey. South Jersey, a desolate place made  all the more desolate by a confusion pine trees, strip malls (& clubs) & innumerable fast food "restaurants".

Being from such a God forsaken region, I am unaccustomed to the fine & affected culinary tastes of a city like San Francisco. I am not yet sufficiently acculturated to pass judgments on sushi or even, for the love of God, Thai food.

But, what I lack in adjectives to describe the exotic food found in San Francisco, I can make up for in expertise regarding the one food "group" that any self-respecting New Jerseyian (I know, that seems like an oxymoron... and, well, it probably is, but you're not allowed to say that unless you're from NJ, dammit) knows: Pizza.

Take it from a recovering New Jerseyian: Serrano's is the best pizza in the City, at least as far as slices go. It isn't as bougie as Little Star or Pauline's, but the employees are just friendly enough, there's often just barely enough room to stand inside the tiny parlor, and the slices are enormous and made to order. What else could you ask for from a pizza place?
author: Stephen S.

description:
Best value pizza in the city.  Not open as late as some other spots in the Mission on the weekend, like Cable Car Pizza, but really much better.  That place reminds me of 6th St. Pizza in Austin, which is to say it  really isn't that good, but when it's late and you've had a few to drink, it's there.  Serrano's, on the other hand, is actually worth ordering sober.  For the same price you'd pay to get a normal sized slice anywhere else, Serrano's  gives you a slice the size of your freakin' head. They have to put each slice in its own carry-out box, it's that big. Overall, Serrano's is pretty decent tasting pizza. 

Maybe not the best pizza in the city, or even the highest quality place to grab a slice, but pound for pound, Serrano's is the best value.
author: Josh K.

description:
Temporarily closed due to a fire.

My arteries, they are happy, but my heart, it is sad.

Edit 2/5/08 : I just called and they're open again! Hello heart failure!
author: erik h.

description:
Good local pizza place open late (Midnight during the week, 1 on weekends).
Friendly staff, food is fresh.
Big piece of pie for a pauper's price.

One thing I like about a good pie is its freshness.
Serrano's makes each piece to order, really as though it were its own  pizza, shaped in a triangle... no kidding on that.  It's easily larger than a plate.

Also, Serrano's can do any of their pizza toppings into a calzone for a little more dough (pun intended!).  ;-)  As with calzones, be mindful of the tomatoes as they are so fresh, it can make the calzone a little runny.  I'd take fresh and runny over stale and raunchy any day, however.

Lastly, Serrano's has a good lunch special: a slice, small salad, and  drink for like $5...  Amazing.

Call ahead, it's ready for you in 10 minutes.  :)
author: Nathan M.

description:
Just had the Pesto Pizza and garlic bread.  It was really good and am looking forward to trying other kinds.

Delivery was about 30 minutes.  The delivery man was really friendly.  Definitely a great place to get pizza!
author: Lily B.

description: Definitely a staple.  Love their pizza.  It's not the highest quality, but it's always consistently "good" and the prices are great.  Will continue ordering for a long time!
author: Jeffrey B.

description:
As Snickers would suggest "satisfy your hunger"... I should have had a Snickers  After the hour and a half wait, the Pizza finally showed up... yay(?).  We opened up the side of wings, the smell was not what I expected, and the Pizza... The "Chicago style Deep Dish" looked more like a cartoon Ninja Turtles Pizza, that Pizza always looked good, right?  I'm pretty sure that if the Pizza the Turtles ate tasted like this, they would have switched to Sushi.

Don't waste your money here, you will regret it.
author: Amy A.

description:
Awesome prices and delicious pizza.  What else could one ask for? Their salads are always crisp, cold and crunchy made to your liking. It rules!!

For the younger crowd and for those that like bay area rap, I dont think it would hurt to mention that San Quinn eats here.  

Enjoy.  =)
author: Ricky M.

description: I'm not sure if this place is STILL my favorite place to get a slice in SF, but it might be... they have an excellent deal if you come in before 6... Where else can you get a slice a salad and a soda for under 6 bucks... And their slices are always fresh... made to order... Amazing crust, good spicy sauce!!! I'm hungry!
author: Nathan B.

description: I really like the pasta they have there. The service and the drivers are really good too. I like them!
author: Rob G.

description: I used to hangout here when I was in grade school to play the Street Figher arcade game they had there. This restaurant has gone through a couple of management changes. It's original name used to be called "Pizza Pop". There's a very small amount of seating in side and they have tables outside where you can eat your pizza in peace. It's especially nice during the summer. Anyway, haven't gone in a while so I don't know if they changed their prices, but I enjoy their $2 for a slice of cheese pizza. It's actually more like two pieces. I even ordered several pizzas for delivery in the past and they all taste great. Grease, but great. They also have other selections on their menus such as calzones.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
Wes, you're quick man! Guess that's why you're the elite and I the lowly user.  I have 3 words to sum up Serranos... Greasy as Hell.

Call in, go down, pick it up.  Wes is totally right, the outdoor seating is beautiful!  Take your girl, Sit down, read each other poetry, you know -- Mission Life in all it's glory. 

Warning to Serrano: if you try to charge me for ranch ever again I'm going to be much less Lovey Dovey about this place, go read my boogaloos review to see what your fate could be.  50 cents for ranch, its RANCH!!!!!  All customers, they will give you free ranch if you ask forcefully (and that might mean with a tire iron, I mean they deserve it -- they charge for ranch!). OK OK, end rant (sidenote why the hell won't yelp allow left brackets?? grrrrr!)

In Summation: Sitting outside and dipping your crust in ranch better than the greasy pizza, but the pizza's average for SF fare.
author: Tyler W.

description: Total nightmare.. How long does it take to make a slice? Well, on weekends it's about 45 minutes to an hour. Now you know why San Francisco reaches levels of mediocrity known for it's pizza. This is another in a long list of crummy pizza spots.. Here's a tip Serranos, look at how the shittiest places are run in Chicago and New York, and then maybe then you'll get a clue.
author: M M.

description: The pizza is ok, nothing to ride home about. I wanted deep dish pizza so I decided to order from this place and try it out but the only thing that was satisfying was the crust. The pizza part was average a little creasy. I think they might have forgotten to put cheese in the crust.
author: Macmall M.

description:
After a whole day of drinking mimosas on a very hot day in Dolores park, I neeeeeeeeded pizza!!!!

The pizza here is good, it seems a little expensive for a slice, but they are huge (basically the size of two slices from anywhere else) so it works out to be a pretty good deal.

The crusts are nice and crispy and they have around a million different toppings to choose from (a few too many for my mimosa-addled brain to take in...) I went for the chef special, which has grilled chicken, green onions and something else I can't remember right now!

It was good pizza, and I'd definitely go back, but at the same time, for some reason, it just didn't excite me...
author: Melanie B.

description:
Four stars for slices, yet strangely, no stars for pies. I've enjoyed a 1,000 slices here (especially those I've had the presence of mind to order "well-done"), but you've got to be so drunk to enjoy a whole pie, or portion thereof, it just isn't worth it.


They boost their average by having a great lunch special that is served 7 days a week (until 6 PM). It's a slice, a small salad and a canned soda for under $5! Friend to the worker...
author: Jeremy W.

description:
This place is magical and mystical. 

The magic: Everytime I go to some yuppie place and get just a drink for more than it costs to get an unbelievably huge, *made from scratch to order* slice here, I will be mildly pained. I thought I knew what a big slice of pizza was and I was WRONG. They say it's just one slice, but basically it's the size of two slices of pizza and they acknowledge this by cutting it nearly in half, like a sly wink- little devils! Plus it actually tastes good too. Score.

The mystic: How can anyone go hungry with places like this around? Also, an italian place staffed by asians? I guess I really am in California now.
author: jessica s.

description:
Hands down the best value for pizza slices in S.F.

Good sized portions, great tasting, and CHEAP!

The only thing they need is cheap beer.
author: Larry A.

description:
Oh Serranos...  I was SO sad when you caught fire.

Thank god you're back, and able to satisfy my evening cheesy cravings, as I satisfy the other cheesy cravings elsewhere.  I frequent here on Tuesday nights, right inbetween the Red Light Open Mic, and Rock Out Karaoke at Amnesia.  I've never had a bad slice, and never had bad service (although they can be slow at times, whaddya want?  I mean, c'mon, the slices are made-to-order!).

If you are in the area, GO HERE!  Seriously.  It is SO worth it.  You'll be glad you did.
author: Suzanne C.

description:
Seriously, a slice of pizza here is A SLICE. They make it to order and top it with whatever u like. The slices are like half a medium pizza, totally huge and at a great price which makes it that much better. I'm a big fan of thin crust, so it just hit the spot for me!

For a late night bite or BIG snack check'em out and you will not be let down!
author: Dave S.

description:
For less than four dollars, you get two---not one---slices of pizza.  Perfect for when you're broke, and hungry.

UPDATE:  Serrano's has had a fire.  They are currently gutting and repairing the space.  Please put in wiring that won't catch on fire.  And...HURRY UP.
author: Randy F.

description:
SO GOOD after a workout.

Agree the slices are LARGE - also excellent.  
And Crust, though doughy, was tasty.
author: laura g.

description:
Who wants to wait 10 min for a slice of pizza?  I guess that's tolerable considering the slices are made to order.  They stretch you dough, top it and bake it to order, pretty impressive, Seranno's gets points for that.

I can't say I was crazy for my Margherita slice today.  A bit too cheesy for me, but the crust was alright. You gotta not mind a lot of crust either, since they give you a slice with two sides of crust (I guess they cut off the other side?).  They were pretty generous with the basil, which was good, the sauce was good, but the tomato was not that ripe.  All in all, a slice for $3.80 filled me up and left me not in love, but satisfied.
author: Adrian L.

description:
The BEST slice in town!!!

I've live in SF all my life and probably eaten pizza at every pizza joint in the city and I have to truely say this is my favorite by far. 

A review below states that they make slices fresh, wouldn't you think that's a good thing? A fresh slice with crust all around, I'm getting hungry just thinking about it!!!

It does take long though, the only draw back, but you call in and order your slice and have it ready once you get there.

And they have a great lunch special too: pizza, salad and a drink for cheap. One slice is all you need and trust me, you'll be back...
author: FILL S.

description:
We were locked out of the public garage after a night out and came back the next day to pick up the car and decided on pizza.

This place is wow. We had two slices and they were huge. Each slice was bigger than most personal pizzas that i've had. 

It was freshly made and filled us up. One suggestion would be to use more toppings. Oh yeah, slices are cheap here.
author: James T.

description:
Excellent!   I've ordered delivery from Serrano's several times now.  Every time, the order has been carried out correctly and the pizza has been delicious!  And they are open late!

Their deep dish is more like a stuffed crust than a true deep dish, but its really good, as are any of their speciality pizzas.  Delivery time is slow, but they warn you that it can take a while.  Quality takes time, or so they say...  If you want a 5 minute pizza, go to Domino's.  If you want a very delicious quality pizza, wait for Serrano's or go in and try a slice at the counter.

This is my go-to pizza place in the city.  Haven't found any place better to date.
author: Cyrus C.

description:
The pizza here is a gigantic (and freshly baked!!!) slice of awesomeness for a few bucks (depending on what toppings you get). Me, I got clams and artichokes. I know what you're saying: "ooh, that sounds good!"

It is.
author: Maximillian M.

description: just got a slice and yeah, probably should have gotten a small for only a few dollars more.  while the triangle slice is large, came out a little too early.  would have liked the crust to darken a little longer.  had a san franciscan, a bit wet/oily, though dough was decent.
author: Rob C.

description:
I love this pizza place. :) it is awesome!!!!! 
They are pretty resonably priced considering the big slice of pizza that you get. The other great thing is that they make your slice to the order so it isn't just sitting there under a heat lamp. I am a regular and i always get the hawaiin slice because I'm too chicken to try something new but I will someday :) They are awesome love love love them. Their staff is totally nice too.
author: Carmen M.

description:
After a terrible pizza experience a flew blocks up on Valencia (see my Cable Car Pizza review) with service that was as awful as the cook's perm.

I'm happy to announce there is another choice for pizza my friends.  And that choice is called: Serrano's.  And Serrano's is d-e-l-i-c-i-o-u-s (my g.f. says it best).  The slices are served hot with any type of toppings you can think of and get this novel idea...they serve it up in a box or bag to go.

No cheesy (pun intended) wax paper and no guy with perm juice dripping on your pepperoni & cheese.  Plus, the slices are large, and by large I mean like personal pan pizza size.  

There's limited seating and the joint is usually pretty hot, so plan on eating outside or on your walk to one of the watering holes or home.  Yes, I said "to" the watering hole...Serrano's is better than late-night drunk food so you don't need to numb your taste buds before eating it.  In fact, I recommend a slice before heading out.  Serrano's uses a magical formula in their crust which soaks up just enough of the alcohol so you don't get belligerent.

Serrano's thank you for making good pizza.  Thank you for serving it in a to-go box or bag.  Thank you for not hiring smart-ass cooks with stupid hair.  
(*Disclaimer: On the off chance you hire that putz from CC pizza...I hate you and this review turns into negative 4 stars)
author: John D.

description:
Serrano's Pizza you are the pizza joint right around the corner from my house. You have helped me through the best times and the worst times in life. I would get home after school and spend what little money I had on you when I was in grade school and middle school. Now that I am older I don't have to worry about spending money on you.

Your slices are the biggest thing out there and are soooooo tasty too boot I miss you and wish you were in Texas with me. Anyone who says that their are better slices out there in this city are just lying to themselves. You are the best!
author: Patrick H.

description: Have never been to the restaurant, but delivery was slow (told one hour, took about 90 minutes), and pizza was cold, and unexceptional. Try Patxi's, or any other place that delivers.
author: David J.

description:
Great delivery pizza. 
My boyfriend and I love to order this pizza and cuddle up on the couch in front of the TV.
author: Katie V.

description: Placed a fairly large delivery order. Pizza was ok, but the people in the shop were just not pleasant to work with. A little nice, a little helpful goes a long way.
author: Laura B.

description: Serrano's has the best pizza ever! I seriously mean EVER. everything is fresh and made to order. I recommend the pesto with feta cheese and jalapenos. I once went there every night for dinner 5 days straight cause I couldn't get enough. no, i'm not a fat ass, i'm just a hardcore fan.
author: varuka c.

description: If you're looking for something different than Delfina, Beretta, etc. Serrano's is the best for delivery and to go. Pesto delight is delicious. And go hungry because 1 slice is the size of a small pizza!
author: Katie R.

description:
"Hello, Serrano's Pizza?" said the delicate and perky voice at the end of the line.
"Uh...yeah, I don't really know your menu, but maybe a veggie slice of some sort?"
"Ok, we have a few of those..."
"Ok...um..."
"How about Veggie combo? (lists ingredients)"
"Yeah, sounds great.  No black olives, though."
"Oh, ok!  Well, what would you like instead?"
"Jeez, um..."
"How about sun-dried tomatoes?  Do you like sun-dried tomatoes?"
"Yeah!"
"Oh...but it already has tomatoes on it, do you still want sun-dried tomatoes?"
"Oh. um."
"I'll put artichoke hearts on it!"
"Perfect."
"Ok, we'll see you in ten minutes."

There's nothing like a sweet, soothing, helpful voice to guide you through a pizza selection when you're stoned.  Great pizza, great service, 5 stars.  Worth the $6 for a loaded "slice" which is really the size of a personal pizza at other joints.
author: Jackson R.

description:
3.5 Stars.  Here's why:

-It's close by, so there's the convenience factor.  Also, they deliver! 
-Prices are good, especially considering the fact that you get coupons every time you get a new take out menu.
-Lots of toppings!  Oh how I love those toppings!  (Mmm the Portuguese!)
-Large slices.
-90% of the time when I call, it's hard to hear because it's busy or they ask me to hold and then hang up on me.
-The meat can be on the greasy side.  (Yikes!  The Portuguese!)
-The sauce can be heavy.
-The restaurant itself isn't very big and not very inviting, hence us getting it delivered most of the time.

I recommend this place if you're looking for good, greasy, late night pizza in the Mission.
author: Heather S.

description:
Like a lot of little children, i consider pizza my favorite food. If it were even remotely healthy, i would have it for every meal. But like most things that i love, it's not good for me. Well, enough about all that.

Serrano's isn't any where close to the best pizza in the city, but i support them because:

Slices are cooked individually with crust on all sides. Unlike the aforementioned little children above, i love crust.

Big portions - one slice is enough. I hate having to order two slices at a place. I simply don't want to appear in the panned in teaser for KTVU's "Obesity in America" story. Jerks

Finally, consistent delivery. They never mess up the order and are always there within 45 minutes. Yeah it won't win em a gold star, but reliability and pizza delivery don't really go hand in hand in this city.

Summary: it's my consistent go-to pizza spot, it should be yours too.
author: charlie A.

description: This place is amazing! They deliver super late at night, and their slices are huge. I would say a slice of pizza is equivalent to half a medium pizza. I going to have to say this is the best slice in the city.
author: Arthur-woodrow S.

description: Awful delivery. It took about 2 hours to deliver one pizza and It tasted just terrible upon arrival. I mean this place left me wishing i had gone with dominos or even digiorno instead! Not worth the high price for this sub par pizza.
author: Clive H.

description: Their pizza is probably great.  But I wouldn't know because 1.5 hrs after I order it's still not here.  Never ordering again.
author: Joo O.

description:
I'm giving it three stars, but it's really more like 2.5. I decided to be nice because I realize I am a pretty harsh critic when it comes to food.

My friend and I were in SF for the day yesterday and we were in search of good NY style pizza. We were in the Mission, and there is surprisingly many 4 star yelped pizza spots. We first tried Arinells on Valencia but we weren't very impressed, so we decided to try Serrano's. I was not a fan of the cheese...it seemed like the way frozen pizza cheese melts, and it didn't have much of a taste to it. The bottom of our crust was think and...chewy? crusty? hard? brittle?! I don't know the right adjective, but it was definitely something...not good. I would definitely say Arinell's is better if you're looking for pizza in the Mission!

In sum...it was edible. Not great. Or good even. Just ok.
author: Rasi A.

description: Great place for a $6 lunch to include grande slice, side salad, soda.  Pizza is made to order, not a slice from a pie that has been sitting out for a while -- so be prepared to wait a few minutes.
author: Don N.

description:
Okay. I love Serrano's food. Having discovered and subsequently attempted to work my way through their menu I have become increasingly disappointed.

I have to date only ordered delivery from Serrano's and this is where my Italian carbohydrate afterglow has waned.

My last order took 2 HOURS for them to get together. And I only ordered raviolis! SERIOUSLY LAME! Prior to that my orders have taken an average of 1.5 hours.

Unfortunately, my cheese and spinach ravioli's will be the last order. Perhaps on a brighter day with all the time in the world I could stop by the mission and check it out again.
author: Ennis O.

description:
I love that I can have Dinner in San Francisco for $2.50.
Cheese slices that aren't wimpy, matter of fact they could beat up your mom. 
Not just a slice but 2 in 1, made fresh, cheap, and if you have a few hungry friends with you it's free delivery!
author: Micah R.

description:
SF is Foodie Heaven...

except when it comes to pizza. pizza in this city is so average and borderline bad. 

to me the true test is pepperoni. if you cant do it, then shame on you. it is the most basic pizza aside from cheese. 

we had an x-large pepperoni delivered and it only took 20 minutes! the crust was perfect. not too thick or thin and not too doughy (like everywhere in this city). next time i will order a more taste specific pizza (like spinach, artichoke and garlic)... and give serrano's the opportunity to receive 5 stars.

2nd time around and i got a spinach, artichoke tomato and garlic. AND it was also really good and only took 20 minutes. at first i was surprised they used frozen spinach... but the flavors actually blended well. 
serrano's still deserves 4 stars.
author: SF U.

description:
Bestest: Mission Special 
Gooder: Pesto Delight 
Good: Crazy Pollo

That's how I'd rate the ones I have had (although my decision making may or may not have been "influenced" by other factors... this place is great late night ;-)

Prices for a slice are awesome and the slices are ENORMOUS.  So skip the small/medium and just get the Large.  If you are looking to spend less, go with slices, two is usually plenty.

I've always picked up or dined in.. never had delivery so I can't say anything about their delivery service, but they have been quick about it when I have walked in.
author: Niko B.

description: Huge slices, crisp crust, savory toppings.  It's at least a 10-minute wait, but worth it.
author: Vanessa H.

description:
best pizza in sf thus far. definitely a great hole in the wall to check out.

6 dollars for a decked out "slice"-- this shit is huge!
author: Stephanie T.

description:
Great for take-out. Just because there's seating doesn't mean you should dine in.

Made fresh to order is what everyone touts...but, uhm that's pretty standard and I would hope expected from a pizzeria. But if you're sitting right there in the tiny enclave and see all of the public walking through the tiny food area, then you might not be as excited about it as being fresh. Each "slice" is cut in half and can feed 2 semi-hungry people. It can be greasy depending on how much cheese makes it onto the slice.  
Good, but salty. The veggie slice had overripe/old tomatoes on it. If you're in a hurry and want something more fancy than the basic cheese, it takes much longer to make the slices than they kept quoting to people - so order ahead to go.

Speaking of which. This is one of those spots that you probably don't remember by name but call when nothing else is open at night. It's the neighborhood reliable eats. 

Easy going during the day with their lunch specials running from 11am-6pm. At night, you're also exposed to panhandlers -- we had a gentleman step right in and essentially corner me in the window when the sigfig brought our little one to the bathroom. Of course we're going to share with a hungry person...but it was odd to have literally been cornered in the bar window area to the right and nobody said anything.
author: Tanya P.

description:
Serrano's makes the best Hawaiian pizza. The slices are HUGE, making for a very inexpensive dinner.

This is a great place to stop for a quick dinner on the way to the bars on 22nd in the Mission.

And when I'm incredibly lazy / grumpy / tired and call in an order to be delivered, they have the nicest delivery people ever, who do not judge me for not walking the four blocks to the restaurant. And so I tip them well and give them a long, soulful hug before sending them back into the night. Okay, not really, but that's kind of what I want to do, I'm so damn grateful.
author: Jill C.

description: If someone ever says that Escape From New York is better than Serrano's you have my permission to give them a swift punch in the gut. Serrano's is such a better slice in terms of quality and quantity. They're not open as late, but who cares? The lunch special is an awesome deal and I have to get it at least once a week. The workers are always nice and I've never had any problems with waiting a long time for my order. If you live in the area and you want a good slice you've found a great find.
author: Bryan E.

description:
Serrano's pizza is our favorite pizza delivery, their open nice an late, they could work on their 45-60min delivery times but other than that its spot on.

Serrano's = delivery
Pauline's = thin crust dine-in
Little Star = deep dish dine-in

each has their own place in my hear and the pizza ecosystem
author: Jared Z.

description: This is a great little pizza place, I love that they your slice to order! The slices are also pretty big and inexpesive.  Its a good alternative to Arinell's if you would like to try something different  in the mission.  The staff has always been very friendly to me and my friends during our visits.  The place is small and the seating is pretty limited, but i havent had to much of a problem with it.  This is my go-to place walking home from benders, after a few beers.
author: daniel p.

description:
OK. We almost might come here for our pizza instead of the ever-more-convenient Goat Hill Pizza just a few blocks away from our Potero place, but it's just too far. Their $3 "slice" would pass as a small or medium pizza anywhere else, and it's deliciously fresh.

The downside (not a -1 star) is that all pizza is made fresh to order (even the slices). If you are expecting to just walk in here and grab a slice, you will be severely disappointed. So if you are at Laszlo and have the munchies, save their phone number and call ahead for your slice; you will impress your buddies.
author: Rob T.

description:
Vegan pizza delivered to your door? Yes please!

Sometimes when you come home from a long, cold, wet day in the East Bay to discover that your husband has completely flipped out and decided to paint everything in your tiny, tiny studio, you just don't feel like cooking. On those nights, you call Serrano's. When my living space was completely covered in paint, I ordered the Art and Tom terrific (artichokes, tomatoes, and fresh garlic - and they mean LOTS of fresh, RAW garlic just in case you were wondering), and it was delicious. The largest size is so huge the pizza box barely fit through our door and only set us back $20 and probably saved our marriage.

NB: Though lots of vegans tend to choose pizza parlours based on the availability/variety of vegan cheese, this vegan has been converted. A hot slice of well-made vegan pizza trumps throwing some Follow Your Heart on an otherwise mediocre pie.
author: Jordan P.

description: I love this PIzza place, especially in the summer, my children and I order a large cheese with pep, a couple of sodas and a salad, we relax outside and much away, while spending some family time.  The pizza is always the same GREAT!!
author: Tina E.

description: I'm always pleased with the food and the menu here, however it always seems to takes 25+ minutes. If you want something super fast don't go here, but if you have a minute you'll enjoy what you waited for.
author: Dorian S.

description: I don't know if we just got a bad batch or what, but this just isn't good pizza. It tasted like cafeteria food...
author: Grant M.

description: Solid, freshly-made slices, but frustratingly slow sometimes. I've had them forget to place my order and tell me something was coming right up when they hadn't even started making it yet. I had a whole pie once that i didn't enjoy as much, so I recommend sticking to the slices.
author: Marco L.

description:
Saved me from a hangover more times than I can count....refered to as "magic pizza".....

See what it can do for you.

Update....since the fire the prices have gone up and quality down....sadness.
author: Sierra D.

description: So I might have equated my Serrano's experience with being hung over.  My BF refuses to order pizza from anywhere else, so we always get Serrano's.  I hate when he eats the clam bake because his mouth reeks of stinky feet and ass afterward.  I enjoy the hawaiian and the hugeness of the pizza, but meh.
author: Skye W.

description: We've eaten here a few more times and it's always yummy. It really does deserve five stars. its our pizza place. :)
author: Merredith L.

description: I think they could improve their kitchen, or at least how it looks from the outside. They might know it is clean or sanitary, but it doesn't necessarily speak that to the customer's eye.
author: Lookass V.

description:
An unusual slice house in that the slices are made individually, and cooked from scratch, which means that they take 10-15 minutes.  This can be annoying if you're starving for pizza, and gotta wait.
They taste pretty good, though, which mostly makes up for it, but since each slice is sort of a miniature slice-shaped pizza, the crust:pie ratio can be a bit higher than you might like.
author: Don H.

description:
Best Lunch deal in the city.  You can almost share it it's so big.  a soda a salad and a huge slice of pizza for around $6.  
It's worth the wait to get your own personalized piece of pizza made fresh and hot to order.  
Long live serrano's, I'm so glad they are back in action after the fire.  :)
author: amanda v.

description:
I've only eaten "slices" when I eat here. The first time I did, I took longer than usual and the slice was not very uniform in appearance...
then I realize that the "slices" are actually all hand tossed mini pies.

This one of my favorite pizza places in the city.

The only thing to mind is the limited seating.
They do have outdoor seating too.
author: Geordie E.

description:
Have no idea about the food, but the delivery service is awful. Called for a delivery on new years eve with two nine year old boys ready for a fun sleepover. When placing the order, the cashier was polite. Provided our address and were told it'd take 45 mins to an hour. About half an hour later, we get a call from the driver. He had no idea where we live, was unintelligible given poor cell reception, and finally just said that he was not going to deliver the pizza. We called serranos back to inform them & confirm that the credit card would not be charged. The cashier apologized & said they had a new person who was unfamiliar with their delivery area. Hung up. Five mins later, they called back & said that there was a problem - they already made our pizza and tried to insist on delivering it anyway. Aside from the fact that the pizza would have been cold, the driver should have made some attempt to locate our address. Smart phone. GPS. Something. 
We'll see if they charge the card anyway. Sucks cause it sounds like its really yummy pizza.
author: jessica w.

description: ive never bought a whole pizza from here, only slices but its always fresh and hot. the slices are about $4 but they are huge! defiantly recommend this place. they aren't very big so its good to grab a slice and sit on the chairs outside or take it to the little park on Valencia
author: Lauryn L.

description:
I LOVE Serrano's. They've saved my grumbly belly so many times now that I've actually lost count.
Never has a pizza place made such good pizza by-the-slice as this little gem. They make each slice individually so that it always turns out with just a little bit of crust on all the edges, and they load on the toppings. You want mushrooms? Here, have half a cup of tasty, juicy, fresh ones.
They're open way late, they're way fast for made-to-order slices, and the price? Cheap as hell!
My friends and I eat here so often we've even christened that smaller slice on the one side the "girlfriend slice." It's like they even know that you want a whole slice to yourself but your ladyfriend's gonna eat  half of it anyway, so why not just give 'er an extra halfie so everyone goes home happy?
author: Erin P.

description: I haven't ordered from here this year. We used to order from here- an independent local pizza place, we should all support those right. Over the years we dealt with pizza arriving late, cold- despite us living about 3 blocks away, the toppings having slid off the pizza, and a lasagna or two that where the size of a saltine cracker in a large container. The last time I ordered I was told 60 minutes at 7pm- okay that's fine. At 8:30 I called to check and they told me it was on the way. At 8:50, I start to cook and called to cancel. At 8:56 the driver shows up and is arguing that they told us it would be longer than the usual delivery time and that it wasn't that much longer claiming it was really only took an hour & fifty minutes. An apology would have gone over so much better. Now we order from an independent pizza place in another neighborhood- so much better and no issues with delivery or service.
author: Naomi N.

description:
I first tried Serrano's when i was being given a ride home with a friend of mine after seeing a show downtown. The driver suggested we stop for pizza, and was all enthused that we try this place. I got a huge slice, and i remember really liking it.. 

Unfortunately, i think the liking had more to do with my drunk-munchies than with any virtues on the part of the slice. The next three times i ordered from here, the pizza was always incredibly salty, and two out of those three times, the cheese on top was leathery-overcooked..

it seemed like they use quality ingredients, it ain't a Domino's or Pizza Hut type dive, but i just could not get over the saltiness and the overcooked-ness.
author: XTA s.

description: Pizza, relatively cheap. Nothing really amazing about it.
author: Jack K.

description:
My friend and I stopped in here for a quick lunch today. Both of us had never been there before. My friend eagerly goes to the register and asks for two slices of cheese. 

"Whoa there," a construction worker to my right says to him. "You must have a big stomach."

Yeah. Thankfully my friend amended his order, because the slices are enormously great. Really, calling it a slice doesn't really do it justice, since it's roughly the size of a half of a small pizza and tastes really good for all of ~$5. What a steal.

Warning, though: prepare for some serious artery clogging, because this stuff is GREASY. I was able to drip off a half of a gallon of it.
author: Eston B.

description:
They took forever to make my calzone but it was freaking delicious.  Great blend of garlic with ricotta cheese.  I'll definitely be back.

Way better than Cable Car
author: Ankur P.

description:
Serrano's is almost the only pizza I eat these days (if Little Star and Pauline's were a tiny bit closer to home, however, it might be a different story).

The delivery is a tad slow, so if you live in the 'hood, peel your butt off the couch and walk on over for take-out to ensure a piping hot pizza. My favorite is the Portuguese special - loaded up with garlic, onion and cured Portuguese sausage. (note: serious mouth wash scrub-down required after dinner if you plan on going out).

There's not much room to sit - maybe a table and a few chairs inside and a table on the sidewalk.  Serrano's is best enjoyed at home.
author: Brady W.

description:
Best old stand by. Love the pizza and the green salad (surprising good and fresh). Giant slices, usually quick, and the cheese is fantastic.

Too bad you are closed from this fire! Come back soon- I ordered the worst Chinese food ever because you are closed.
I won't even use a coupon when I order next!
author: Toby B.

description:
We ask for a delivery from Serrano's pizza for a movie night in my place with some friends. That was the first time I've ask for a delivery and we were happy with our pizzas.

We ask for two mediums : one  vegetarian and one dolores. That was enough for three people. ;) Please take into account between  30 to 40 minutes for the delivery. They accept credit card as long as you tell us about that when you place your order. 

The pizzas came warm and tasty and the price were resonable.
author: Cedric L.

description:
SF Food Inspection Score: 96

UPDATE!

So yummy. I wanna order from here all the time. The freshest ingredients and the sauce is really tasty.

I wish I could come here all the time...

I haven't even eaten here and I love this place!

Me and the bf are going today and I'm very excited! I will return with and update.
author: Kristina C.

description:
This review is for the pizza we got last night. We got half San Franciscan and half Fresh Choice delivered.

The pizza was piping hot when we got it, which was a good thing. The San Franciscan was pretty tasty, but the Fresh Choice was really bad. There was something missing and/or the ingredients were just off. We spent the rest of the night with grease just sitting in our stomachs. Both of us had semi digestion issues and didn't feel so hot.

We've tried the San Franciscan calzone before, which was quite delicious. (Order on the phone! It takes 20 minutes to make).

I think it was the sausages that didn't sit well with me, but my boyfriend claims it's the Fresh Choice. No idea. Aside from the indigestion, the crust was good.
author: Angela H.

description:
Excellent Lunchtime place if your in the area. And their 'lunch' special as i remembered it was 11am-6pm. Worked perfectly when i had lunch at 5:30pm to prepare for a new years event! One slice is actually a mini pizza in disguise. But with the salad and drink in the special for 6$ you can't beat that! Tasty crust and sauce as well as fresh ingredients make it all the worthwhile for me to actually drive across town for it!
Parking is so-so not as bad but still at times it's a hunt, then theres the DPT nazis that check every 3 minutes for that red light on the meter to flash. 
Pickup is best and phoning ahead for either take-out or eat-in for the quickest of service.
author: ToAsTy T.

description:
One of the best bargains for lunch in the Mission on in the city.  First the lunch special runs from 11am to 6pm.  You get one slice (which is really two) a salad and any drink (canned soda, bottled water) for about $6-&7.

One of the drawbacks is the place is REALLY small.   The counter sits about 4 people, while they only have one table that sits 2 people and when the weather is good, there is outdoor seating with 2 tables.  Prolly not your best bet for a big group and parking is kinda scarce on Valencia and the surrounding areas, but if yer willing to make the effort and drop in, it's worth it.
author: Richie W.

description:
They deliver to my work every couple weeks. Very friendly and usually prompt. 

The actual pizza is so-so but always a good experience.

3.75 stars
author: Art A.

description:
It's 9:22 and I'm still waiting for the order I placed at 7:42. So...yeah. The pizza is okay, but nothing to write home about. I wanted to believe the hype but unfortunately I don't think I'll be ordering from here again soon. I'm hungry!

Oh yeah, the worst part is that I ordered from delivery.com and put a 20% tip on my credit card when I placed the order.
author: K. E.

description:
art & tom:  good. real good. must get it.
san franciscan: also really good.

called in and both pies were ready for pick up in 20min. you can smell the place from down the street (in a good way), and now my car has a slight artichoke aroma...mmm.

perfect crust too, not thin or thick; a good settlement for splitting between thin/thick crust aficionados.
author: eric f.

description:
I'd like this place a lot better if it was a teeny bit easier to order on the phone.  Last two times I've called I have had a very hard time communicating with the person taking my order.  Language barriers are especially frustrating over the phone.

Still, the pizza is good and I recommend it.  However, it might be worth your while to simply go and order in.
author: Nick T.

description:
Still my favorite place near work. $5 for a double wide slice.
Piping hot. That would be the price of a bagel at La Taza deli around the corner. The place is an oven to work in. Please tip the staff.
author: Pandora B.

description:
I LOVE this place.  Everytime I walk by here on my way to pick up food from some other place, I regret that I didn't order some Serrano's instead.  Definitely call ahead, because it can take 15 minutes to make your slice.

They MAKE your slice.  Not merely cut off a big pie that's been sitting under the heat lamps for who-knows how long.  And by slice, they really mean something like a personal pan pizza.  It's huge, shaped like a football, and crust on all sides.  I guess it could be bad if you didn't like crust, but it's oh-so-good.  And CHEAP.  

I for one actually think the food tastes worse when I'm drunk.  But maybe that's just me.
author: Christie C.

description:
Wow! Was I impressed with this place. After going with some friends for a little vegan dinner and a drink in the Mission, I was still starving. I suppose my corn and nuts were not satisfying. Nothing against vegans, but I need cheese and meat in my diet. 

I stopped by and was so hungry, I did not want to wait, even a minute. When I was told the wait was ten minutes long, I was not happy, but it was the Mission and late, so I waited.

The wait was well worth it. I was so impressed with the size, taste, and freshness of the pizza. They make each slice fresh, for the person, however you want your pizza. I was a simple guy and just ordered a slice of cheese, but it was delicious.

 As to the size, it was comparable to two slices anywhere else in town and for less than $3.00, I was a 110% satisfied. I have only gone once, so I can't vouch for the consistency, but I can say, my one experience was great!

They even cut it into four pieces, to make it easier to eat in the car, as I headed home. I love this place and you should not let the exterior stop you from having a slice...
author: Christopher W.

description: Yes!  A huge slice, so big they have to cut it in two.  $2.80 for cheese.  It has a strange but crackling good crust which also extends down one side, thin, good sauce and cheese ratio - very tasty.  Made fresh so please be patient because it's worth it!   A tiny place with hardly any seats that does a ton of phone to go orders...two tables outside - nice touch.
author: Jeff J.

description:
i've passed by serrano's for a while now, but i only tried this today. so anywho, serrano's carries the BIG ASS NEW YORK-STYLE PIZZAS around the block! very gourmet yet affordable for sure...

their pesto delight totally a delish for me..... never disappointed me at all. oddly enough, i went there twice today. first was with my cousin's wife and 2nd was with my bff.....love love looooove serrano's forrr suure b*ches! wooohoooooo
author: Marc K.

description: I don't see why all the buzz is about this place.  The pizza is adequate, but the crust can be soggy.  However we had delivery service on salad, pasta and clams and chicken parmesan and it was horrible.  The chicken could not have possibly been fresh by any means and the pasta was overcooked.  Frankly I expected more.  We couldn't finish the chicken because it had an unusual flavor.  Perhaps if you stick with pizza, the place is fine, but the rest of the food - no way.
author: Edward H.

description: Initial impression was "wow this is a tiny place"... ordered our pizza (which was refreshingly inexpensive) and sat down outside... out pizza arrived a little while later and was really good, was freshly baked and all the toppings tasted fresh... the sauce was a bit salty as other people have pointed out, but I was ok with that... a single slice was large enough to keep me satisfied till dinner...
author: Frank E.

description:
I LOVE THIS PIZZA. And I'm not the biggest pizza fan - The margarita pizza is where it's at! 

I have delivery from them all the time.

BUT - I have to say I was a bit disappointed when one of the employees (possibly owner) was so rude to this girl who had been waiting patiently for her slice of pizza.  She was upset and he was a total jerk to her.  

I get it, Serranos, you have awesome pizza and you're busy - but really?! You're going to be mean to this girl who works across the street and probably gets pizza from you guys all the time??

Customer service was a bit out of wack that night. It made me sad! I LOVE your pizza - don't be mean!
author: Lorissa A.

description: This is the biggest betrayal I've experienced by SF yelpers. Stale crust, tasteless sauce and almost rubbery cheese. Far from NY style, but not even California good. Toppings were the only redeeming quality, but even that's a stretch. Please people, be a little more critical.
author: Sarah D.

description: Made to order pizza in 10 minutes. Just a straight cheese slice is a great deal. Once you start adding toppings it jumps up in price but one slice is about as expensive as your average burrito and is about as much food. They clearly use quality ingredients, the sauce is tangy and fresh.
author: jason h.

description:
Pizza is great but the delivery guy is a complete jerk. I missed his call and when called him back he already left, was very rude and said he would bring back my pizza this time but never again and hung up. Great pizza horrid service, this is my last time ordering from them!

Update to my review. The pizza guy never came back, I called to ask for a refund and they hung up on me. I had to call and talk to the manager to get them to void my card. 

DO NOT ORDER FROM THEM
author: Amber A.

description: I ordered a deep dish pizza with half "San Franciscan" (pepperoni, mushrooms, bell peppers and Italian sausage) and the "Prima Special" (pesto sauce, fresh basil, chicken and red onions).  We got quoted an hour for delivery, and it arrived on time, which is a good start.  When we opened our box, it was not what I had expected.  It was a big sloppy soggy mess.  The Prima half was almost non-existent and covered with a half inch layer of cold hard cheese.  This place gives WAY TOO MUCH cheese.  I didn't know that was possible, but it is!  I could barely eat a slice without feeling really grossed out.
author: H. L.

description:
=
I love Serrano's. Perhaps that's because I live down the street and can call for a perfect, totally filling take out meal and be eating in 15 minutes. But I also like the pizza.

My favorite thing about Serrano's is that they sell pizza by the "slice" but the slice is really more like a personal sized pizza, each made to order. Then when you get pizza with a group, each person gets exactly what they want, and there's no arguing. It's great.

They'd get 5 stars if they used fresh spinach instead of frozen. Yuck.
author: Jen B.

description:
Always packed, and good only if you're nostalgic for gluey white crust, cheese but can't quite sell me on the fact that it supposedly once came from a living animal, and sauce that tastes like low-end tomato paste. Oh, and vegetables that taste like they were airlifted out of a food court in Ohio. 

In this neighborhood, you can do better.
author: H. S.

description: Incredible pizza.  Its not NYC style, but was easily the tastiest and best value slice ive ever had.
author: Jake S.

description:
Last night, I wanted to try something different for pizza, it had been a while since I ordered one, and I perused the Yelp reviews for a while, narrowing down the (new) choices to Serrano's and Pizzeria.  I've actually had both before and I don't remember either being particularly good or bad, but I decided to try Serrano's again.

When I called, they only warned me that it would be about an hour (40 minutes is typical for SF, but I should have taken this as a warning sign) after I had given all of order, my information, address, etc. so I went with the flow since it was, after all, Saturday night.

The pizza that finally arrived 1:20 later was barely warm enough to allow it entry into my apartment, but cold enough that after one bit, I put it into the microwave.  I think that was a first for any pizza delivery in the city.  Not good.  But, the main reason I will only be able to give 2 stars is that it reminded me of cafeteria pizza.  Yes, it was cafeteria pizza I was able to eat (3 slices, a bit less than usual), but there was zero pleasure and it merely satisfied my hunger.

I was tempted to give 1 star, but the pizza showed up with the correct ingredients, and I didn't get ill from eating it.  Good job, Serrano's.
author: Daniel Q.

description: Best bang for your buck delivery. Less than $20 for a ton of pretty decent pizza. This isn't Little Star or Pauline's but is great value. If your hungry it works well.
author: Ben L.

description:
Ok, so I should have reviewed the first time I checked this place out, but I'm a lazy yelper (I think I have 2 reviews).  Today was my second time ordering for delivery, and right on schedule it arrived at my door.  So both times I ordered the Art and Tom Terrific because I love artichoke hearts and garlic.  As a vegetarian I need something that packs a punch to the mouth, and this definitely does it.  The Pizza itself has a good spice to it, not like many bland tomato sauce pizza's I find everywhere.  Something about it really speaks to me!

I ordered the Calzone this time, which is a good sized Calzone and priced under $7.00.  That and a 2 litter of Coca Cola and I meet the delivery requirement, which is only $8.00.  I work a noon to 8 shift on Market St @ Tan Bella and don't get the opportunity to go get lunch.  Having a place that delivers and doesn't require a $20.00 minimum for said delivery makes me and my wallet super happy!

I'm going to try a different combination next time, not because I am over the Art and Tom Terrific but because I want to indulge in other goodies as well.  The only thing I wish this place had was better appetizers.  Mozzarella sticks, Jalepeno poppers, that's all I ask!

Thanks Serrano's for being there for me on my lunch break!
author: Andrew R.

description: Open late. Walking distance to where I'm staying in Noe Valley. Small space. Brisk business. Sauce was a little salty, but crust was perfect. Huge slices. 2 for about $6. Pizza was still yummy cold.
author: Kim J.

description: I love this place, its the little tiny pizza hole in the wall, that you crave for when you are 3 beers into the night. The slices are made to order, no pre made crap, the calzones are what I think about on cold hungry nights.
author: John R.

description:
For my money, some of the best pizza you can get on the quick in the Mission. Good prices for the size of the slice, which is basically two pieces. 
I don't like eating here, because the interior has some strange mirrors that make you stare at the other customers and stare at yourself while eating. 
Also, the wait usually is a bit longer than they say it will be.
author: Sarah M.

description:
What the heck? After reading these reviews I went and ordered a pizza from Serrano's--and was very dissapointed.  Certainly it came quickly and they loaded on the toppings.  But the only verb I could come up with to describe it was dry.

Meh.
author: M K.

description: BOMB... Had it once before... ordering it again in about an hour and i cant wait.... MMMMMM pizza.... Half cheese half peperoni soon in my life.. for the reasonable price of $12.90...mmmm mmmm good.
author: Samantha R.

description: I'm not sure why people think this is place is so great. I've ordered from Serrano's three times just to be sure.  maybe dinining in vs. delivery is different experience but i found the pizza to be super bland every time.  We ordered a couple pasta dishes one time as well and they too were generic and lacking in flavor
author: Samir K.

description: This place has been recommended to me several times and I finally made it over. It's awesome- same style as Deja Vu (they'll bake you a fresh slice right there, with fresh ingredients) but just a little less greasy. The slice is MASSIVE and medium thickness and FAR TOO FILLING for one girl to finish in one sitting. Over all, really, really good.
author: Amber K.

description: The pizza here is just ok.  The lunch special which includes a salad and a big fat slice of pizza for $5 is a steal.  This is a good size snack before I walk across the street for Jay's cheese steak.
author: Fatty A.

description:
The bad: Their pizza wasn't anything special as far as taste. I honestly feel that I've had some frozen pizzas that were better than this. I'd give it a 6.5/10 or so. Above average but  not by much.

The good: The slices are massive and CHEAP.
author: Mike V.

description: This is my roommates go-to for pizza delivery, and I'm generally a fan.  It's not my *favorite* pizza, but I do enjoy it, and am totally happy with it when it finally gets here!
author: Jennifer L.

description: After becoming vegan, I'd just about given up hope of having pizza that I truly enjoyed (instead of just reminding me how I'll never have cheese again).  Serrano's convinced me that pizza can be good even without cheese.  The crust and sauce are good enough to make me think that cheese would spoil it.  And they're fast.  The dough tastes fresh.  It's decently cheap.  I appreciate the oregano shakers on the counters.  All in all, whenever I eat pizza elsewhere, I inevitably find myself comparing it to Serrano's.
author: Nick H.

description: Not bad, not great.  The cheese ravioii was good, the margherita pizza had a bit too much basil.  Delivery was quick and they come to Glen Park, so hooray for that...
author: Emily T.

description: This might just be the most reliable pizza delivery option in San Francisco.  Love their sauce - spicy and a little bit tangy, crust is doughy (in a good way), and toppings are always plentiful.  I'm particularly enamored of the San Franciscan - pepperoni, huge chunks of Italian sausage, mushrooms, and green peppers.  (Why is that called the San Franciscan?  No clue.)  With the discount that comes from the coupons on their flyers, this is an all-around great deal.  Oh, and their pesto pizza is phenomal if you're not hooked on red sauce.
author: Julie L.

description: The best bang for your buck in San Francisco. Great pizza with top notch ingredients for literally pennies. Throw down $2.75 or so, and you will receive two HUGE slices and so, so tasty!  Caution: order by the slice and not the pie. Just not the same. If this place ever closes down, I will lose it.
author: Kenny G.

description: Tired of the thick gooey pizza you get at most SF pizza places? jonesing for a niche, thin tomato-ey slice?  Serrano's is way better than most of the delivery pizza in town...the staff is very friendly  and they give an accurate estimate of delivery time.  YUM
author: cheryl h.

description: Well, this is one of my favorite pizzeria in mission district. Their slices are huge, crispy and tasty. Half point minus--- their delivery time depends on when do you order it. I've figured out that from 8 to 10pm is the worst time to order.  Another half point minus---their pizza sauce is somewhat too salty to me, and I usually ask for serrano's sauce instead of that salty one. One tip for all the yelpers, don't microwave your leftovers, bake them in a pre-heated oven for 2-4 mins would make the leftovers as crispy as they were.
author: Ryan L.

description: Unlike other pizza spots that reheat slices Serrano's slices are fresh made to order. The slices are huge like two pieces huge! The ingredients are fresh and the prices are reasonable. love this place!
author: Josie M.

description: My favorite place for pizza in the Mission. You can get a HUGE slice of cheese pizza for under $4 or my favorite Clam Bake, with tons of clams, onions and garlic--
author: Lisa K.

description: I love love love the Valencia's Special pizza from Serrano's. It's a wonderful pizza, not too cheesy or oily, great sauce, one slice is filling, and it's got delicious eggplant on it. I really couldn't ask for more.
author: Lisa K.

description:
It's cheap, it's cheesy, and there's lots of toppings. It's not organic, or made of cornmeal, and has none of the frou frouiness of artisan pizza. So don't make it more that what it is: just regular old pizza that's made extra large and extra yummy.

p.s. it actually reheats yummily too!
author: Emily W.

description:
their individual slices are practically a small pizza. it takes a while to get them, but they are cooked upon ordering. it's nice to know that even at a drunken state, you're not eating pizza that's been sitting under a heating lamp. 

the pies and slices are thin, and the pizza sauce is tasty and flavorful.  the prices are decent for the quality and quantity!
author: Sheri N.

description: I remember our yuppily-adorned crew walking by here after dinner at Dosa and getting the head-tilt silent-judgement look from the Hipster Olympics winner's circle that was seated outside.  But no matter.  The important thing is this is the first of the semi-seatless, pizza-by-the-slice joints to truly rival my existing fave, Escape From New York.  I tried both the Dolores (mmm...must remember to eat more chicken pizza) and the San Francisco (which is so pizza-arcade classic it makes you want to run over and ask Dad for more quarters so you can beat Knights of the Round).  The slices may look pricey, but they're also enormous (really more like two slices).  And the 10-minute wait is totally worth it when it comes out super fresh and hot.  Heck, I might even try them for delivery next time instead of Seniore's.
author: Wes M.

description: God Damm, I still really love this pizza...and the fact you guys bring me pies all the way out here in Soma.
author: Brendan R.

description:
5 stars from the girl who hates pizza, wtf?  you heard it.  I blame Greg #1 (of 3) who only ate pizza, hamburgers and occasionally Taco Bell for the two years I was with him. Needless to say for 10 yrs I avoided all three food groups.

Serrano's pizza changed my mind.  they have THIN CRUST and if you ask for 'less cheese' it's even that much more perfect.  Yeah, did I mention I hate cheese?

This joint is a hole in the wall but you got to ask for the Thin Crust because the delivery one we ordered was regular.

hmmm meat lovers pizza with mushroom is the best.
author: Mona B.

description: After sweating it out in a fake striptease aerobics class and lifting weights I get real hungry. I like to get a large Americana pizza with extra pepperoni and a side of ranch. Why am I not losing weight? Damn you Serrano's!
author: Krismet C.

description: For years, I've been coming here for their pizza.  My favorite?  Fresh garlic, cheese and mushroom pizza.  The sauce is just enough and doesn't leave the pizza soggy.  I've been missing this place since I moved to the South Bay.  =(
author: Selene K.

description: I love this place it is the best pizza I have ever tasted in my life of fatty foods.  I have brought everyone I know here, and if I haven't I rant and rave until they crave it too.  I order a slice with cheese, pepperoni, and jalapenos.  It is always perfectly thin and crispy, and I add some more jalapenos.  I swear this slice just melts in my mouth.  Every bite literraly has such a good texture mmmmmm.  I want one now, but unfortuantely I am on the master cleanse and all I can think about is Serrano's.  Oh I can't wait !!!
author: Eryka V.

description: HUGE slices of thin-crust pizza await you at Serrano's.  The sauce is extremely aromatic---you can tell they use fresh spices, and there is just enough cheese so it's not too greasy.  The crust is crispy, not soggy.  Even better is that they deliver!
author: Aimee B.

description: Not bad, not bad.  I love that they make each slice to order.  Very slow food style and we all know a super fresh slice is a better slice.  Their crust also warrants a mention - bready, thick with almost a hint of sourdough just the way I like it.  Their sauce is nothing to rave about. The cheese is of average quality and applied too liberally.  The toppings are great but really expensive, I guess given the Times Square size of the slices it's the way it has too be...
author: Bryna M.

description: I think this is actually the worst commercial pizza I've ever had. The toppings are good but the sauce is vile and the crust tastes like Boboli. Actually Boboli is better because the crust isn't soggy. If I hadn't just bought two pies I would have just gone down the street to Mr. Pizza.
author: Arwen O.

description: If Little Star is the best classy pizza place then Serrano's is the best greasy pizza place. Oh man this place is the shit. Try their pepperoni. Best pepperoni pizza in San Francisco hands down. Eat this shit. And when yr drunk after the bars its even more amazing! Its like flying through the universe!
author: Claudius P.

description: The people flipping the dough at Serrano's know what they are doing. Good (giant) slices made to satisfy my craving for east coast pizza. They've got the right proportion of grease, cheese and sauce and the crust is exactly how I take it: thick, with a soft chewy inside and crispy outer layer. I would prefer a little more spice to the sauce, but other than that their formula is right on. Yay! I'm not so homesick anymore!
author: d p.

description: I'm not really sure what the hype is about.  Two of my friends and I went for dinner and were very disappointed.  My pizza was soggy and my friend's cheese pizza looked disgusting.  Yeah, it was cheap, so I guess you get what you pay for - really bad pizza. Honestly some of the worst I have ever had.
author: Megan W.

description:
serrano's is my stand by for those lazy evenings when i decide that there will be no cooking and that i don't want to venture much further than the comforts of my room and the joys of vegetating and watching mind numbing shows on the travel channel. buying pizza by the slice is cheap, delicious, and beyond filling. it is definitely a go to for delivery pizza, and it is always very fresh upon arrival. 

i live in a house with four other people, all with busy and varying schedules and friends constantly hanging around. i kid you not when i say serrano's received 3 different phone calls from different people in my house within a twelve hour period. i'm surprised they haven't recognized one of our voices over the phone by now.
author: Kayla K.

description: Different strokes for different folks, I suppose.  That a lousy restaurant like Serrano's can receive 4 stars collectively from over 160 reviewers suggests that a lot of people have terrible taste.  Serrano's pizza is unremarkable mostly because it's so greasy and the crust is soft and doughy -- you feel like you've eaten a brick afterward.  I just tried the lasagna and buffalo wings to see if they could pull off other low-brow staples.  They can't get even those right -- the lasagna was like cheese, grease, and sauce soup, with almost no solid matter in it and the buffalo wings are right out of a frozen package, with painted on flavoring that looks as sickly as it tastes.  All in all, disgusting food you don't feel guilty throwing away.  They won't get my money again.
author: Andrew L.

description:
I love their pizza, it's so good and they make each slice to order which obviously takes a little while, but the wait is usually not to bad and for good pizza who cares.  

I've never had a problem with their customer service either, that is until last night.  I get off work excited about eating some tasty pizza and while eating my pizza and at some point I see out of the corner of my eye that someone is giving me the creeper stare from outside the window.   Dude comes in and sits down next to me, I ignore him figuring he'll go away in a minute.  I was quite wrong.  Turns out he wanted money for pizza  and told me in no uncertain terms what he thought of me as a person when I didn't immediately reach into my pocket and hand him the money.  The old wingnut proceeded to tell me  he was going to murder me and in graphic detail, multiple times, how much of a lousy person I was etc. and all the while the people who worked there did absolutely nothing; didn't bat so much as bat an eyelash, tell him to leave or give me a sympathetic look.  I finished my pizza, hoped he wasn't waiting outside to actually make good on his threat, and I left.  My friend's tell me to go to Deja Vu pizza instead and from now on I will.
author: Dominique L.

description:
this place simply just has GOOD pizza. i paid about $4 for a slice (and they definitely get a little more expensive than that). the person i was with who also ordered a slice was told she would have to wait 15 mins. i was wondering why it would take so long, but it turns out each slice is made individually with fresh ingredients, not just reheated. so our slices came in less than 10 mins, they're HUGE and they are so tasty! i had a margarita pizza and the basil and tomato were fresh and it really made a big difference. i would definitely go back if i was in the neighborhood. 
bottom line: Havent had pizza this good for a long time, not greasy, fresh, gets 5 stars from me!
author: Margit H.

description: I really like this place, but I never ate their pizza. I cannot get enough of their calzones. They're not only huge, they boast a brood of mozzarella and ricotta cheeses with whatever ingredients your heart desires. I personally like pineapple 'n' onion. It'll set  you back about $5.
author: Monica R.

description:
Great place for slices.  Thin crisp crust, enough sauce and lots of cheese.  Over-sized and made fresh!  Fantastic.  

The lunch special is among the best food deals in the entire city.  Outdoor seating too!
author: The P.

description:
I hate Serrano's Pizza's chairs and tables. I hate the untasteful wood panels all over the walls of their location. I hate their website that looks like it's from the nineties and that doesn't really do anything. I hate that they don't deliver to my place. I hate that they are so far away.

And yet, once a week, I make the trip to go there to buy the best f-ing pizza EVER.
Every other pizza place in the world I have ever been at can suck it in comparison. They don't even remotely compete with the amazing pizzas, slices and calzones that the small team of Serano's Pizza creates in their tiny kitchen. 

Maybe I should move to the mission so I can go there more often.
author: m k.

description: I have only been once so this is going out a bit on a limb but this place is fairly unique.  They make slices to order (which could be good or could be bad because there are plenty of places in NYC that make great slices to go that are not made to order).  It takes about 10 minutes but for $2.50 you get essentially 2 slices of pizza.  Excellent crust.  Surprisingly good.
author: Narendra R.

description: Great, very large slices of pizza. You have to wait about 10 minutes for them to make each slice, but worth it.
author: Nish N.

description: Yah, well, I like this place.  I've been eating here for years for lunch, since i work 3 blocks away.  Call ahead for the huge 2-piece slice (peperoni, sausage, garlic is my fav) and it's ready when I walk in the door.  I've had the calzone a few times and like that a lot too.
author: Goolie G.

description:
Edit 6/8/08: I eat here so much now that I feel obligated to give them an extra star. Delivery is still a bummer though.
--

My dad introduced me to this place, and I am very glad he did. Getting the slice you ordered may take a little while, but it's worth it. The slices are HUGE, the prices are low, and the pizza tastes great.

Delivery, on the hand, is a completely different story.

They have a completely inconsistant delivery coverage area. When I lived on Monterey Boulevard, they delivered to me once, and the next time I called they said they didn't deliver to my location. When I told them that they had delivered in the past, they told me that "the driver probably lives out there and was on his way home, that's why".

This has happened to nearly everyone I know who has tried to get them to deliver.

Since I live farther away from them now, I probably wont go too often. But if I'm in the area, and have time to kill, I'll definitely stop in for a slice.
author: Alexis C.

description: This pizza is hella good. Huge slices....the only thing is that the crust looks like it has been surgically reattached. 4/5.
author: Curran M.

description: Probably my favorite slice place in SF now.  The cheese is tasty tasty tasty, unlike so many other bland slices.  Yums!
author: Davey R.

description: Would I order a pizza pie from here again....no.  However, if you're craving a freshly made pizza by the slice, I would recommend Serrano's.  While they're service is nothing to rave about, the slices are more like two large slices made to order.  It's pretty much a 10 inch pizza for $4.50 or so, fresh out of the oven.  So don't go ordering two slices thinking you'll get two thin cuts from a pie...you'll be suprised at how much food you really ordered.  Can't beat that in the area.  It's served to you on a glass plate with a fork and knife...not quite Italy, but appreciate their effort.
author: Adrian N.

description: My friend at work told me this is one of his fave pizza joints in the city but boy, was i SO NOT bowled over. It took them forever to make me the "San Francisco" slice, which I at first took to be a good sign of freshness and customization. But when I finally received my first slice, I couldn't undertand what I was supposed to be so impressed by. The pizza was sloppily constructed, the sauce was forgettable, and most importantly, the dough was tastless.
author: Baochi N.

description: I would give Serrano's a high three star rating.  The barbecue chicken pizza was delicious.  The barbecue sauce was particularly flavorful, and the only aspect keeping the pizza from a four star rating was the just average crust.
author: Josh K.

description: Just the usual cheap crappy pizza.  About pizza priced but takes forever.  Open late (that means past 10pm durng the week in SF).  Last night the choice was Serrano's or nothing, and I went with nothing.
author: Ian H.

description: Serrano's is my favorite pizza--- hands down.  Especially the art and tom terrific.  What I love most is the sauce.  Wish they had more Serrano's around.  The Greek Salad is also excellent.
author: Ona E.
