description: 4 bucks (including tip) gets you a slice of utility pizza as big as your head that is made to order. Hard to beat that in SF!
author: David L.

description: The best bang-for-your-buck pizza in the mission.  You might end up waiting 10-15 minutes for your pizza if you don't call in ahead of time and seating areas may be absent depending on the time of your visit.  The pizza slices are very generous for the price but not the best compared to what the rest of the mission has to offer.  I recommend pickup or delivery to eliminate wait time.
author: Derrick H.

description: Every time I'm hungry and I'm within a few blocks of Serrano's, I'm always tempted to get a slice.  I'd say it rounds out a good 'top 6 pizza shops in the city' list (although it's probably closer to 6 than 1) - still pretty good.  An anecdote to this review is that this is where my wife and I had our first date.  Everyone knows that nothing says romance more than hot slathering pizza grease on your face while sitting in a puncture-holed cushioned chair.
author: Eric S.

description: WOW!  Cheap and good.  I needed a pizza fast and cheap, got the Dolores Pizza, and it was great!!  If your not a fan of garlic tell them to hold off, but I love it and it really made it special.  It was one of the best pizzas I have had under $20.  I'm going back for sure.
author: Dane H.

description:
the pizza's fine, but there's quite a wait for the pizza by the slice.

i'd heard that the pizza is good here, and upon going by once on the way to a movie and seeing the pizza by the slice option, we decided to grab a slice so we could get out fast. 

not so fast.  your pizza by the slice order goes in along with any other orders (including full pizzas), and is made individually starting with raw dough.

35 minutes later we had our slices.  missed the movie.

my only beef is that in s.f. pizza by the slice is usually (in my experience ALWAYS) made from an already baked pizza with the toppings adjusted.  or, it comes from a pizza on the counter.  all i'm asking for is maybe a warning that these slices take a long time.  they're good, but not worth the wait.
author: will c.

description: Really good (and consistent) pizza slices. Also, generously-sized. Tasty.
author: Colin M.

description:
In short. Pizza was good. Wait wasnt too long. Prices fairly cheap considering the quality of product. 

My only beef with the place is I had ordered three slices. They throw two of the slices in a box... cool. But they didnt feel the need to give me a box for the third slice and slipped it in a brown paper bag. This may seem nit picky, but when you have a half hour commute home a paper bag isnt an ideal way of carting around a slice of pizza.

I would have given this place four stars had they given us two boxes to go. When someone orders pizza to go then you put their pizza in a box (and this coming from a person whose family owns and operates a pizza joint).
author: A G.

description:
I'm going to have to pass on this place. 

1. The pizza sauce is a bit too spicy for my taste... so far as pizza is concerned anyway...

and 

2. The person on the phone acted like I was from Mars when I asked for the pizza to be cut into squares. And I can't even BEGIN to tell you what the pizza looked like when it got here! It's like they cut it in pie slices first, then remembered that I asked for squares and did that too. It was a complete mess.
author: K. K.

description: They caught my bulding on fire and made my apartment smell like smoke for two weeks, but I am glad to have them back.  The pepperoni slice is average but the margarita and san franciscan slices will give you goosebumps, good goosebumps.
author: mike h.

description: I like Serrano's better and better every time I eat there. Its funny, when you order a slice they basically make you a small triangular shaped pizza. For this reason you wait longer than most "slice" places, but its a decent piece of pie, and always fresh from the oven.
author: Zac H.

description: My favorite pizza in the city!  Really crispy crust and unusual topping choices.  Try corn and onion.  I know, I know, it sounds weird but it's so good!
author: Elena S.

description: Ordered a corn and mushroom slice today (yes, it's weird, why do you care what weird stuff I have on my pizza? But I'm not defensive!) from Serrano's, and it was really good. The garlic bread with cheese was also yummy. My friend ordered his slice with broccoli and sausage, and if you go in for that sort of thing, he said it was delicious. Also, I'm not complaining, but "one slice" at Serrano's is basically the size of my torso, so don't go thinking you'll need two.
author: Jude F.

description: The waiting time is a bit of turn off when you're used to walking in and ordering up a hot slice, but if you have the time, leisure, and creativity, you can spend a while creating your own pizza, then hang out at the tables on the sidewalk jealously watching others that already have their food.  seating for maybe three at a table inside and bar seating for four more, maybe.  good pizza though.
author: shawn g.

description: Gotta love Serrano's.  Let's be honest, pizza in SF is crap, but Serrano's is taaaaasty.....
author: Bernard W.

description: Really big slices of pizza, so it's worth the money for a slice. Also fairly affordable pies for groups, and they're usually pretty good. The quality is hit or miss though, sometimes I've gotten a good slice as long as I kept it simple (which I usually do) and sometimes it tastes a little off. Overall it's not too bad...!
author: Gina R.

description:
It's not the worst food in the world, but I feel that those reading the other reviews here touting this as the "best pizza in sf" should be warned: it's not worth a trip across town, or even going a few blocks out of your way.

My tip is: go here only when there are no other options (read: it's 12:30 am and you're not in the mood for tacos), and get a plain cheese or pesto slice. The crust is thick and dense. The amount of cheese is (overly) generous and without much flavor, and "toppings" are big chunks of haphazardly cut veggies and meats, which leave a water-y pool on each slice. yum.
author: Spikes T.

description: It isn't special but it is good and it is cheap.  I haven't had some of the really bad experiences as the people below.  I'll be there this weekend.  Almost can promise that much.
author: Thadd L.

description: Great thin-crust pizza and generous portion! Great deals too - ask for a to-go menu and there are great coupons. There's usually a little wait after you order so I suggest you call ahead and pick-up.
author: Gladys C.

description:
i'm only giving this 3 stars because i feel like 4 would be misleading as i only tried a basic slice.

i stopped in here randomly on a way to a party after work.  my friend and i both got a slice of cheese pizza each (we found out later, we could have just split one).  it  was huge!  we both ended up eating only half of our slices and taking the rest to go (yes, we did eat in.  it wasn't bad.. but definitely not somewhere you go to wine and dine.).  i think the worst part about it is that we forgot our leftovers at the party.  i was really looking forward to the next-day pizza slice.

the pizza itself was pretty good.   a little on the greasy side but i was starving and i pretty much inhaled it.
delicious!

we had to wait a while (even for just plain cheese) which made me antsy.. but i like that they made it fresh and it wasn't sitting there under a heat lamp for hours.

i haven't tried anything other than the cheese slice so i'd hesitate to rely too much on my review.. but if you're into tasty greasy cheese pizza that is a lot of food for a decent price, i'd say stop in!
author: Lily B.

description: Enh.  The best thing about this place is the ginormous selection of pizza toppings (maybe 20 pies to choose from), plus pasta, plus calzones.  The pizza itself is not that special- very salty; crispy crust; unstringy cheese- but it doesn't give you indigestion and you do get a ridiculously huge slice for your $5.  Don't bet on seating; order to go, but if the gods are smiling upon you, you might snag one of the two outdoor tables, in which case you should sit back and let the mission entertain you.
author: Zoe L.

description: The ex and I have had many a good meal here...I have always ordered out and had prompt delivery.  The calzones are fabulous...even more fabulous are the memories on a rainy night.
author: Denny R.

description: Their salads are suprsingly good and the slices give most other places a run for their money. The crust is where the magic happens.
author: Roxane S.

description: Pizza is totally average, but the calzones are deeelicious. Thye take a while to make, but they're really good. Very cheesy, consider it a warning. Get it with spincah, it's tasty.
author: Liss C.

description: Such big slices! The slices are almost bigger than the seating area.  But it's all good, but it's delicious pizza.  About a five minute wait, not too bad.
author: Levi B.

description: Good but not great (probably 3.5 stars, but definitely NOT 4 stars).  Those that gave it 4 stars (or higher) must have been drunk when they ate the pizza.  Eating food when drunk leads people to think the food is better than if they had eaten it when sober.  I ate the pizza when sober and it's pretty good.  But, not great.  I think I will try Arinell next.
author: Sushant R.

description: This is one of my favorite pizza places in the city.  The pizza is made fresh with juicy ingredients that melt in your mouth.  They have a good selection of pizzas, my favorites being the San Franciscan, All Meat, and the Serrano's.  It takes them forever (like 15-20 mins) to make a slice, so call ahead of time to place your order.  They also deliver.
author: P D.

description:
oh my god oh my god CALZONES!

i had only had a calzone maybe once or twice in my extreme childhood, so those memories have been all but obliterated by one too many thursday night benders.

i was dragged here by a couple of friends who come here all the time apparently just for the calzones. i stuck with the cheese calzone, and added artichoke hearts, but apparently any of the pizzas are available. my friends both got the margherita calzone, and judging from the bites i snuck, it was delicious as well. but MINE WAS SO GOOD! and BIG! like the size of my head....or maybe half my head. now, we all finished our calzone, but let's just say i didn't need to eat for the next twelve hours. 

i only wish there had been juuust a little bit more sauce. i like 'em saucy.
author: Rebecca M.

description: great pizza, great service and love the lunch special! if feels like u get 2 slices for the price of one! one of my fav lunch spots:)
author: vicki g.

description:
There is better pizza in San Francisco but none at this price.  If you just want a really good slice of pizza, this is the place to come. (oh, and as others have mentioned, you really only want one slice).  The secret to the pizza is that they actually cook your slice fresh; which means that the crust is wonderful and the cheese isn't gross.  Most place just warm up something that has been sitting around all day.

I suppose I should ding this place a star for its grubby atmosphere but I am in good mood.

SFD
author: Peter H.

description: I'm not a pizza snob, but I know what I like. I'm a local, so the proximity is ideal and the price is right. Whenever honey and I don't feel like cooking or we are looking for a carb delight after a couple drinks on a Friday night, Serrano's is a lifesaver.
author: George C.

description: Finding good pizza in San Francisco is extremely difficult.  Serrano's is the only inexpensive place I've found that I like.  I grew up in Brooklyn, so I have a picky palatte
author: Alex A.

description: Big slices, made to order. Great spot. Hit it up instead of that chain place around the corner.
author: DE B.

description: Been here many times, simply the best slice pizza anywhere. They do take out too! Pesto Delight, with Broccoli totally kills it. Amazing! Place is tiny but can usually get a stall to eat at. Pop in every few weeks.
author: Wade M.

description: I love this place and have been going there a couple of times a month for lunch since i started working in the neighborhood. The pizza is tasty, good amount of toppings, sauce is flavorful, crust is perfect...Their lunch special is a great deal--a big honkin's slice, salad, and drink for around $6. You can't beat it...
author: Joe C.

description: Good pizza. Ginormous slice for 2.70. What's not to like? Oh yeah, the sauce is a little salty and too oregano-eee but like I said, it's 2.70 for a huuuge slice. What's not to like?
author: Andy L.

description: Ok, we've eaten a few more of their pizzas and now I'm a fan.  I feel so cheap but it feels goooooooooooooooooooooood.
author: Landy G.

description: ordered a pepperoni, tomato, sausage and onion pizza - phenomenal!
author: David W.

description: Great place, great pizza.  In fact, not sure there is better pizza in SF.  Yes, the slices look kind of weird, but the taste is really unique, and obv - I love it!  Also points for being open late in an area where lots of post-bar traffic needs eats.
author: Dominique L.

description: GARABAGE PLACE! HORRIBLE SERVICE! I told the guy on the phone I had a $2 coupon, he didn't take it off the bill. After I got delivery and found this he basically told me "tough luck" I should have gave the coupon to the driver. Dumb middle east driver didn't ask for it. I assumed it was handled. Will dispute with credit card co. and NEVER do business with these Iraqi's again.
author: Mod S.

description:
1) Their "deep dish" pizza is NOT deep dish at all. It is basically salty cheese stuffed into the crust, and the pie dough on which the cheese sits is paper thin (and breaks very easily!). FALSE ADVERTISING.

2) We waited more than an hour and a half (and we only live 10 minutes away!!) for their pizza delivery. We ordered on a Monday night for pizza.

3) They don't cut their pizza!!!? You have to cut it yourself when you get the whole pizza. That was sorta a problem since I am newly on my own and don't have a pizza cutter (i know, i know - - a total necessity!!)

4) Did they spike their pizza with lots of salt?? I was dehydrated all night and drank cups and cups and cups of water afterwards (and was still unsatisfied and thirsty!)

I think I'll go to other pizza places in the area next time! :p
author: E M.

description: I've ordered from Serrano's before and been "ok" with it. It's not the best, but at times can be pretty good. But after I opened up the box and looked at the pie that was just delivered, I'll NEVER order from them again. In the box was a mess of a pie with over inflated doughy crust, barely melted cheese, flavorless tomatoes and so much salt that I think they were somehow trying to preserve the pizza. If there were laws that protect pizzas from being f'd up, Serrano's would get a life sentence with solitary confinement for this one.
author: Kenneth F.

description: So far the only pizza place out here in sf that even begins to resemble a good new york slice. I couldn't think of a better complement to give a place.
author: Yussef C.

description: This place is awesome.  I've had everything from various incarnations of pizza, to lasagna, to their calzones.  Everything is delicious.  You really have to go seriously upscale to top this place.  I can't believe how amazing it is for such a small joint.  Everything, and I mean EVERYTHING is made to order, from scratch.  So while it is fresh, you do have to wait a bit.  I think the best thing to do is order in advance.  My first time there, I strolled in off the street and ordered a calzone.  I had to wait about 30 minutes and I had some time, so I just sat and waited.  In those 30 minutes, there must have been about 100 people come in and out of there.  But the staff is very cool, if busy, and it's well worth the wait.  It's my favorite pizza joint in the city.
author: Michael C.

description:
This is my favorite place for slices in the city... with caveats :
* They have a rule about not giving boxes for single slices, just paper bags.  Once I was biking home at night in the rain; after tipping 30% on the order, I asked for a box.  The manager yelled at me and told me to leave.  I didn't go back for about a year...
* Wow, it takes a loooong time.  On the other hand, they are making your slice by hand.  Just call ahead and stop by in twenty minutes.
author: zeph h.

description:
dear serranos 

i miss you. a lot. im sorry about the fire. get better soon. real soon. seriously, soon. please. 


let me know if you need help painting or something.
author: lydia p.

description: This place is amazing. They get your order right everytime; they have a huge variety of fresh ingredients; their slices are made to order, fresh; if you order a slice you actually get two big ass slices; tried their lasagna and was not disappointed; open late. I have nothing bad to say about this fine establishment. Show love, receive love.
author: Philipp S.

description:
i feel really good finally writing about serrano's. i will only comment on (food wise) the single slices of pizza they serve:

**its small place, but most come here for take-out anyway.

**amazing deal. order a single slice (which is basically two slices in one), and they will make it fresh for you in around 10 minutes. one slice is all you need!

**satisfying. i couldn't ask for a more satisfying pizza-eating experience for around $5.

**fresh. they make it when you order it.

**they let you order the pizza as you see fit, or compass you with their large selection of recipes posted on the wall.

**staff is pretty friendly, and reliable.

**almost never crowded. compare that to escape from new york right down the way serving last years relics to this years goons. ie. long line.

**though, i did notice this place is starting to incorporate the "keep a couple slices hot in this weird heater oven thing" gimmic that a lot of pizza joints incorporate. by all means, stay away from those objects.

**tons of different topping types. chef mom would be proud.

**they have the cooking time down to a science. i have been here a ohsoplentifulzillion times and the pizza is never burned or undercooked.

**caveat: the to go equipment meant to hold your slice traps in all air and moister, so make sure to vent it a tad to prevent a classic sogging event. and, if want a real pizza-type box, you will be dunked for around an extra fiddy cent.

must say, i have definitely been told to "just go", but in this context, its better sooner than later!
author: Dayman D.

description: The BEST pizza in the city hands down. great service and no nasty pizzas sitting under a lamp for you when you order all pizza are cooked when ordered so takes about 15 worth the wait ...bigger then Fat Slice and Blondies combined ! hellllla big slice and great taste !
author: Mike S.

description:
There's really only one thing to say about Serrano's:  they make their slices to order.  Let me make that more clear:  if you order a single slice, they will stretch out the uncooked dough, spread sauce, cheese and your topping(s) of choice on the slice, and then cook it in their pizza oven.  

This makes their slices fresh and a step up from any other pizza by the slice in SF.  The thin(ish) crust is crispy, the cheese is melty, it's a fresh slice of pizza (mmm good).  That's it.  Not re-cooked (ehhh bad).

It should be elaborated that the aforementioned (fresh) slice is also quite large.  Approaching the size of two slices anywhere else.  And they cut it in half, so it really is a lot like having two slices.  So at 3.35 for a one-topping, you're getting a lot for your money.  Because they are making it fresh, it takes a little while.  Expect to wait 15 minutes for a slice.  

Beyond that, this is an unspectacular pizza.  But it doesn't try to be something it's not.  It's just a good, fresh slice of pizza.  Nothing fancy.  If this turns you on, go get it.  If not, there are several other Mission pizza outlets.  As for me, I value freshness and simplicity, and so when I go to Serrano's, I am always happy.
author: Gabriel G.

description: Not much to say, aside from loving the huge, cheap slices with a plethora of available toppings.  It's close to my house and my sundry hangouts - what's not to love?
author: GeneR S.

description:
3 Reasons why Serrano's rocks:
1.) On time delivery
2.) Pretty cheap
3.) Damn good pie

I had the San Franciscan and it was great.  Good quality cheese and ingredients lead to a satisfying pizza.
author: Daniel E.

description: San Francisco's, Serrano's Pizza, mmm mmm mmm. What can I say, this pizza is just so frick'n good! My personal favorite is pineapple and pepperoni. I just can't get enough. Me and the boyfriend eat here entirely way too much. One slice of pizza is essentially two, and when you're watching you're figure... eat one, save one for later. It's so cheap and it's only 2.5 blocks from us!! Couldn't ask for any better.
author: Serena R.

description: Sweet place, the only thing wrong with it is the lack of seating. Still they deliver, and their slices are huge plus the slices are made immediately when you order.  I recommend the Chef's Special. Serrano's is one of  original lights of the Mission.
author: Mooky G.

description: I love Serranos pizza. I am Glad that they are back in the neighborhood after their fire. Beside the same concede Brazilian Pizza Maker  always giving you the angry look. This small place is good.
author: Juan T.

description:
if serrano's was a man i would marry him!  i first fell in love when i found out they delivery slices but our romance was sealed at first bite.

best combo ever: pesto sauce, feta chesse and fresh basil
author: Laura M.

description: Just had my second slice of pizza from here. Both times they were pretty good. It takes a little while to get your slice, but that because they cook each one from scratch.
author: Matt D.

description: Big 'slice' (more like a personal pizza since its baked to spec and is crusted all around) freshly made with pretty good topping combo's. At the price, big winner. Split one with a friend.
author: Portly P.

description: Reviewing perfection seems superfluous and definitely necessitates no more than the bare bones. Serrano's is astoundingly good. They both bake and sell by the slice so rather than getting a withered piece of congealed grease that's been sitting on the counter forever you get a fresh chewy triangle of freshly baked delight. Be warned thin crust fans: this is not the stuff for you. I respect your choices but Serrano's is for the serious pizza eater. Here are my top three: the Meat Special: It is a sinker, so be forewarned. I don't even know what all the meats are on this thing but there are many. I would prefer if it were a bit spicier, but a small quibble. The Americana: given my ardent affection for bacon one might expect this to be my number one, but it comes in at second place. Topped with green onions, fresh tomatoes and crisp pieces of bacon, it is a stunning beacon of near pizza perfection. My top choice at Serrano's, however, is the Pesto Delight. Pesto sauce covered in spinach, sun dried tomatoes, feta and broccoli. Eat the whole thing at once, pick each individual topping off for maximum savoring, consume it however you desire. Be aware that your wait might be longer than you deem acceptable but just remember that it is only because they are cooking you your own personal slice of joy so a bit of patience is more than worth the reward.
author: Tory S.

description: For cheap, late-night pizza delivery, Serrano's has never let me down.  Their selection of toppings is pretty good and their delivery estimates are mostly accurate.  Their crust isn't edible the morning after, but oh well.
author: Sarah K.

description: I was disappointed with the "deep dish" pizza. I'm sure they use a deep dish, but it's not like Zachary's or Little Star. Just a really big crust stuffed with cheese. The actual rest of the pizza was regular crust. My pizza was a little on the greasy side.
author: Ian W.

description: oh my god. hell yeah. love the san franciscan. just tried the hawaiian chicago style. hard to restrain myself from eating the whole damn pie. nice suprise butter under that roll of crust. mmmm-mmm love the massive slice option cuz then everyone can get what they want and yah don't hafta cater to yer bitchy vegetarian, or olive hatin friend YET AGAIN.
author: a w.

description: this is the best pizza delivery to noe valley! i LOVE their americana calzone!!! mmmm!!! and their pizza sauce is so tangy and good. plus there sausage is de-f'ing-licious! the only bummer is that it seems like everyone else loves 'em too, so delivery always seems to border on the hour side of 45mins to an hour, but it's worth it!
author: Toisha T.

description: Serrano's Pizza delivers a consistently good-quality pizza at good prices. While there have been occasional delivery glitches (one over an hour where the owner/manager compensated with a free pizza for the next delivery), generally they deliver within 30-50 minutes. I sometimes don't like others' prefabricated pizza options and I find that here too. But they make my favorite customized pizza without flaw virtually every time I find myself too lazy to cook, too impatient to find parking for restaurant dining, or too undecided to choose a restaurant (or cuisine type, for that matter.) Serrano's delivers.
author: Geo G.

description:
first of all, San Fran knows nothing about pizza. if you agree, keep reading.... 

this place is not bad. i give it 5 stars cuz everything else is pretty bad, esp in the area.
author: MC N.

description:
Two stars for delivery pizza, four for in-house slices

I used to work around the Serrano's and came to depend on it for reliably tasty slices.  Unlike most pizza places, Serrano's makes each slice fresh from raw dough- in essence each "slice" is just a small custom pizza, triangular in shape instead round, and one of the best deals in the neighborhood.  If ordering with coworkers, we'd get 4 identical slices instead of a pie, the slice being a better deal and somehow always tastier.  
Tonite I ordered a pie delivered, and I have to wonder if they farmed it out:  dry, leathery pizza, bland crust. Ech.  They warned me that it would be an hour and that was to be expected: it's Saturday night after all.   But Saturday night is when one craves pizza, right? I suspect that the pizza took rather extensive tour of the city before it made it to my place...    That, plus the odd disparity in quality between their slices and whole pies made it pretty much inedible.  It's in the bin as I type.  grrr.

Reading other reviews I see that other's note the difference between slices and whole pies, and delivery problems- too late to save my dinner, but not yours.  Stick to slices.
author: paul h.

description: Best slices in the city. Giant, crust on all sides. Like a whole pizza in themselves. Good sauce, yummy dough. There's nothing better if you're on the run or out late and need a snack.
author: Melissa M.

description: Serrano's comes through again. Around 1:00pm, I called-in an order to be delivered at 6:15 that night for a business meeting. I had my doubts about ordering so far in advance, but the pizzas and salads showed up precisely at 6:15 AND the 10% discount had been honored, AND the pizzas were hot. Hard to complain about these guys.
author: J M.

description: good stuff. good prices, very good crust and plenty of toppings. i like that they have the BIG garlic salt shaker with the usual crushed red pepper and basil. the only thing i can complain about is that they didn't completely slice the pizza, you know, when the middle is kinda stuck together. NO BIG DEAL, i was busy stuffing my face with this awesome pizza!!!!
author: oskar p.

description: is this place owned by the same person(s) who own(s) deja vu? the menu and pizza are identical.
author: Paul W.

description: ya know sometimes the pizza is a bit greasy, but on the whole this place serves up some solid delivery.com orders.
author: David D.

description: cool place but meh pizza...
author: xavier v.

description: I stopped by here for a slice of pizza today and it was delicious! What they call a slice is what most other pizza places call a small/personal pizza, haha. I had the pepperoni and it was very tasty. They also have a ton of different types of pizza such as pesto, hawaiian, and greek. It does take a little longer ordering food here as they actually make each pizza individually, which is pretty cool since you get a fresh pizza instead of a slice taken from one that was made earlier. Bottom line: A huge, tasty slice of pizza for a good price.
author: Jon W.

description: now, i'm not one to downplay the greatness of the west coast much, but whe it comes to pizza, i will admit that the west coast is usually severely lacking.  that being said, serrano's rivals any new york pizza place i've been to.  they serve an absolutely delicious, and enormous, slice of pizza.  as others have stated already, they make each slice to order, from dough, and do it pretty creatively (crust on all sides?!?!?).  if you're in the mission (which you should be - it's the best), then take a break from the great burritos, and head on over to serrano's.
author: jeremy f.

description: i love you, serranos.  so cheap and delicious... mmmmmmm... and an $8 minimum for delivery!!
author: Charly G.

description: I learned the hard way that you should call ahead if you want a slice (20min wait).  But it was really tasty--so big they cut it in half for you, so you come away with two still-big slices.  I ask for extra cheese, and I'm in heaven.
author: IMHeAsURHe B.

description: cheap, simple, fabulous. serranos is the best pizza in sf. nothing fancy, just damn good. No where to sit, but I always order delivery or pick-up.
author: Rosie M.

description: the best pizza/lasagna/greek salad with grilled chicken!
author: binh l.

description: Great Fresh Slice of Pizza!  Excellent value and excellent taste.  Sometimes a little inconsistent.  I prefer there slices to their pies....the whole pizzas are not as thin!
author: Le L.

description: what more to want in a slice. not just reheated but baked to order, big portion, generous toppings, quality toppings for the $. i've heard the pizza pies are less exciting than the slices, but for a run around the block it can't be beat.
author: This L.

description:
HOORAY!!!!   HOORAY!!!!!!  HOORAY!!!!!
     Serrano's is open for my trip to SF this weekend!!!!
     I consider myself to be a pizza connoisseur - I lived in NYC for 10 years, and have been to the best, most tastiest pizza shops in all of the boroughs.  Imagine my dismay when I landed in San Diego, NYC's antithesis when it comes to pizza (and most other things!)  So I make do with the meager selection of half-decent pizza joints here in SD in exchange for the endless sunny days.  (Though there are a couple of more than halfway decent shops out here - keep tuned for later reviews.....) 
     So - onto Serrano's.  My sister (who lives in the Mission) turned me on to Serrano's during one of my visits.  WOW!!!!!  As everyone else has written, they make each slice fresh for your enjoyment  And it is truly for your enjoyment - delicious sauce!  Awesome topping selection, and they're generous w/them!!!  Yummy cheese!!!  AND IT'S CHEAP!!!  And the slices are huge!!!  And holy eff it's friggin delicious!!!!
Yes, you may have to wait a little while for your order, but I'd rather wait for perfection than have someone reheat a 3 hour old slice.  Yuck.
     So Serrano's - I love you.  See you this weekend.
author: Liz R.

description: their slices are my favorite pizza in sf. love it.  weird though that when i order a whole pie, it's kinda different and not so great.  but i couldn't care less cause they'll deliver their amazing slices (as long as it's over $8). YUM!
author: Jon C.

description: it is silly to try any other pizza spot in the mission. worried about the wait for a slice? call ahead. it is worth it.
author: Stephen D.

description: too bad i'm never in this area anymore. i used to go there for my huge delicious slices of pizza with either eggplant, or onions with sausage. ah....memories.
author: jack d.
